name: Toufik
review_header: Infrastructure Built for Trust and Precision
review_body: I’ve only been using OVHcloud for a short time, but I’m already impressed by the clarity and structure of their platform. As someone involved in diagnostics and global deployments, I value transparency—and OVHcloud delivers that from the start. While I haven’t yet tested advanced features like PTR record handling or MAC/IP block mapping, the documentation and control panel suggest a well-designed and professional infrastructure. Everything I’ve interacted with so far has been consistent, responsive, and easy to navigate. Looking forward to exploring more and seeing how OVHcloud performs under real-world load. So far, it’s a promising start. Thank you for maintaining such high standards. I look forward to continuing to build and deploy with OVHcloud as a cornerstone of my infrastructure strategy.

name: Amine Darhoumi
review_header: The team response quickly over tickets…
review_body: The team response quickly over tickets and even social medias. im using OVH services since 2012 and completely satisfied.

name: Mr Smith
review_header: Good product terrible administration and support
review_body: I've been with OVH for 9 years. I've had no problems with the actual product in that time. It has always worked well. What I dread is any interaction with their customer service and billing system because it's terrible. Their customer portal website looks impressive on the face of it but it just doesn't work properly. My latest problem, which is typical of the OVH experience, is paying for my renewal. First they told me that my automatic renewal had failed because I didn't have a payment method - despite the fact I've had the same card on my account for several years and never had a problem. It turns out that OVH had deleted the payment method themselves. I re-added it but I just get an error when I try to pay. My card is working fine everywhere else, my bank confirmed that they only declined one transaction from OVH (the automatic renewal) which was because the wrong expiry date had been used. The expiry date entered was definitely correct - it worked last year and I definitely entered it correctly when I re-added the card. Clearly there is (yet another) bug in their billing system. I raised a support ticket but the support staff don't read anything you tell them, they just keep repeating the same 'solution'. In their latest email they actually threatened to delete my account even despite me telling them three times that I am trying to pay but can't. And now there is a technical problem with their support ticket system which makes it impossible to update the ticket. I've really had enough. If you are looking for a cloud provider and have any sense you will go elsewhere instead of putting yourself through this.

name: Manuel
review_body: what's the point of delivering the server in 5 minutes while delivering the needed windows key not for hours ? support not helpful at all

name: Ro Arthur
review_body: They keep canceling your orders without explanation, and still charge you for them. Save yourself the frustration: go with Hetzner VPS. For just a few extra euros or dollars, you’ll get reliability, transparency, and the confidence that everything simply works.

name: MU Eagle
review_header: Excellent Support from OVHcloud Claims Department
review_body: I recently had an issue with my VPS (vps-ee4d74bd.vps.ovh.net) and contacted OVHcloud support. Thanks to Leticia from the Claims Department, my request was handled professionally and efficiently. The server was successfully replaced, and the previous contract was terminated as a one-time exception due to my specific circumstances in Ukraine, where the ongoing war has created very difficult financial conditions. The invoice was canceled. Communication was clear, and all steps were explained. I am very satisfied with the service and the level of support provided. Thank you for your assistance! Ticket Number: CS11504227

name: Zeus TL
review_header: I recently had a case open with…
review_body: I recently had a case open with OVHCloud under ticket CS11501282, and I can honestly say I am very satisfied with the way it was handled. The support team was patient, attentive, and willing to carefully review my situation even though it was a bit unusual. What I appreciated the most was that they took the time to understand my problem and, after some back and forth, they offered me a fair and helpful solution. It made me feel valued as a customer, especially since I’ve been with OVHCloud for several years. This experience showed me that OVHCloud doesn’t just provide reliable infrastructure, but also takes customer satisfaction seriously when challenges come up. Thanks again to the support and claims team for their professionalism and willingness to go the extra mile.

name: Drunkpeacoak
review_body: Very satisfied about the support . case nr CS11502133

name: CK Ng
review_body: Good customer service. Had a misunderstanding of the service purchased, and customer service promptly resolved the issue with no fuss. Recommended.

name: Florin
review_body: Just avoid them. Purchased a VPS on Sep 3rd. Got an email some hours later that they cancelled my order for a vague reason: either inaccurate personal details, or related to the payment method. I paid with PayPal. I replied asking what else do they need. I proceeded to give them my zodiac sigh, eye color, and shoe size hoping they'll then be happy. I asked for either access to the VPS or a refund. It's Sep 8th now, and I've gotten no response, VPS, or refund. Very professional. I logged into PayPal to open a dispute only to find they didn't take the money but placed an authorization hold on the funds. If they cancelled the order 5 days ago, why didn't they release the hold as well? Jackasses. Reply to OVH’s reply: I responded to the info request with the account identifier. Curios what the reason for the poor experience is. Either way, for the record, I no longer want to purchase anything from you. I wasted enough time and energy on this.

name: Mark Hutchinson
review_header: OVH SLA's are NOT real, unless you pay more £££ for premium levels of support!
review_body: We have been using OVH for circa 12 years now, for the first 7-8 years support was good but over the last 5 years it has deteriorated significantly. Expect 20 HOUR RESPONSE TIMES to all support tickets (including server outages) UNLESS YOU ARE PREPARED TO PAY A LOT MORE FOR PREMUIM SUPPORT LEVELS. The SLA's you see for servers/cloud instances at point of ordering on their website are NOT what you are getting as standard - YOU NEED TO PAY EXTRA TO GET THESE!

name: Jey
review_body: Problem solved in about 5 minutes ! Greate intervention from Victor on the ticket CS11507605. He resolved my problem immediatly and i was able to continue my process. I was pleasantly surprised by the efficacy of the support team. Great job guys!

name: pmulvey
review_body: Support Ticket: CS11422741 (The printout of this ticket runs to 29 pages) On Fri. 8th Aug 2025 OVH issued an email offering me a free upgrade on my VPS. I immediately clicked on the link but it didn’t work so I assumed that I probably had to do a manual upgrade to the next higher plan myself for free. When a charge was levied I realised that this offer was not right. OVH sent a follow-up ERRATUM email a few hours later with the correct link. I raised this support ticket and the OVH response is simple. As a goodwill gesture they will refund my fee for the upgrade but since it is “technically” not possible to eliminate the charge at the next renewal I will incur that extra charge. The goodwill gesture identifies the mistake as mine despite the fact that I was misled by OVH. Today, 2nd Sept I sent an email asking that someone call me as I had a feeling that this Joanna B. might be an AI Bot. No so, Joanna B. is a real live person and she called me. She was very nice and did a great job for OVH implementing a pathetic Customer Relations Management policy. Bottom line is, I’m stuck with a plan that I took out having been misled by an OVH email. OVH is a big organisation but the amount of resources expended on this ticket alone would suggest that some form of early intervention was the correct way to handle this. My VPS is small beans in the greater scheme but I would be concerned if my experience of the OVH customer care philosophy would apply should I wish to expand to enterprise level plans and how would they deal with me? You would really wonder at the cost benefit analysis of not meeting customer expectations and being awarded a 1 star. I see that 50% of the reviews are 1 star.

name: Zakaria Benmoumen
review_body: Débora was very professional and helpful. She quickly understood the situation and provided clear guidance, reopening the service immediately while waiting for the payment confirmation. Her support was efficient and reassuring.

name: ahmed mohamed
review_header: Unprofessional handling: out‑of‑stock after KYC, slow responses, and no prompt refund confirmation
review_body: I purchased a VPS on Aug 30, 2025 (Order #6917874). After payment validation, I was asked to submit full identity documents the same day; my account was then approved. Listing a product as purchasable while out of stock after collecting personal documents is unprofessional and suggests weak stock synchronization—especially given that the funds were actually captured on my Visa. Immediately after approval, I was informed the VPS had actually sold out and was offered either to wait “up to two weeks” or take a refund. On my dashboard, the status showed “The product is being delivered,” yet support said it was out of stock. I followed up multiple times on Aug 31 during the posted support hours asking for a same‑day solution (deliver the VPS or provide an equivalent/higher plan at the same price). The lack of timely, actionable replies led me to conclude the support was not reliable for my needs, so I requested a refund and decided to move to a provider with better support. On Aug 31, 2025 at 2:58 PM EDT, support stated that my cancellation and refund request was submitted. However, as of Sep 2, 2025, I have not received any refund confirmation or transaction reference (e.g., ARN), which keeps my funds tied up and wastes more time. This feels misaligned with their own terms about processing refunds without undue delay back to the original payment method. Important note: As of writing this review, I am still waiting for any confirmation or response regarding the refund. Bottom line: A vendor‑side stock failure after KYC, slow/no timely responses to repeated follow‑ups, and delayed refund confirmation pushed me to ask for a refund and move on. I hope they improve stock synchronization, provide firm ETAs during incidents, and issue prompt, documented refund confirmations (with references like ARN) to restore trust. also i can upload file containing all this emails between me and them when required

name: Estevao
review_body: Decided to write this review regarding a recent experience (ticket #CS11494577). We've been using various OVH solutions over the past decade. varying from Dedicated Servers of all tiers to VPS. Throughout this period, we experienced only two outages, one due to a network connector failure in the first case and a disk failure in the second. Additionally, their customer service has significantly improved over this time. Even their response times for the standard support are short. We've tried alternative services on a couple of occasions and discovered that we were already using a solid, time-proven provider for our mission-critical services. If you know what you`re doing, go for the self-managed dedicated servers. If you don`t, get them to manage it for you. Also recommend checking out their Eco range for applications with lower requirements.

name: İsmail Sağlam
review_header: Loyal customer, satisfied with outcome after upgrade
review_body: I have been an OVH customer more than 10 years and have recommended their services to many others. Recently, I upgraded to a higher-level, more expensive server and no longer needed my previous one. However, its commitment was automatically renewed, which was frustrating. At first, I was told it could not be cancelled early, but after review, the Claims Department made an exception and allowed me to cancel the remaining commitment as a gesture of goodwill. I truly appreciate this solution, as it shows OVH values loyal customers who continue to grow with them. That said, I believe OVH’s policies around automatic renewals and commitments can still be improved, as they can create unnecessary stress. While my case ended positively, I’m not sure the same flexibility would be offered to someone leaving OVH completely. Overall, I’m satisfied with the resolution and thank the team for their professional handling of my request. My Ticket Number is: CS11495198

name: Lee
review_body: Super Impressed with the service of OVHCloud, everything working flawlessly, minutes to provision stuff, web interface modern and fully of documentation and features, will be migrating my other VPS servers to them in the future. no complaints from me :)

name: Hendrik
review_header: Not perfect, but very reasonable and functional
review_body: CS11443362 and others. I've been using OVH for >10years in various capacity and clients, but I can say that even though they aren't the cheapest, they aren't perfect, it was that 80-90% fit that suits the budgets. They don't have bleeding edge, but what they provided for me JustWorked(TM) most of the times. And the times it didn't they've been able to resolve it is reasonable times. For reasons I needed to move my servers to South Africa, and that is the sorry part that I were moving to a OVH-ZA. I'll advocate and use OVH when and were ever it suits my clients uses cases!

name: Michele Maran
review_header: Best price-performance ratio on the market
review_body: I have been a dedicated server customer since 2018. Recently i add a new dedicated server, migrating from VMWARE free to PROXMOX. At the moment to close the old server, Joanna (ticket CS11485211) kindly saved me from having to pay for early termination of the contractual commitment. Dedicated servers require a certain amount of technical preparation to take full advantage of them, but once configured, I've never had a problem that support hasn't resolved very quickly. Highly recommended.

name: Jack
review_header: Had a complex service delivery issue…
review_body: Had a complex service delivery issue (Ticket #CS11474925) that required escalation to the claims department. Initial support responses were generic and didn't address the documented evidence I provided from previous tickets. However, once escalated to Leticia in Claims, the issue was thoroughly reviewed and resolved appropriately. The claims process worked as it should, though it required persistence to get there. As a long-term customer since 2018, I appreciate that they ultimately honored their documented commitments and resolved the matter professionally

name: wilyam
review_body: I asked to cancel server but bill was issued at same day and I asked refund - Joanna B. helped, and was very kind and told very politely and warmly all time. (ticket CS11402962)

name: Arnaud Blanchet
review_header: Poor support (CS11486736) and outdated webmail interface -
review_body: I have used OVH email and web hosting services for years. I always received good support service when I needed it, except today. The webmail interface offered by OVH is outdated. Therefore I redirect my emails to a gmail account and I use the "send as" feature from gmail to send emails with the email address I created on OVH. The "send as" feature has suddenly stopped working and when configuring it again I get an error message that suggests that the issue comes from OVH server. The support team refuses to take a look at it and only offers as a solution to use the OVH webmail interface. It's disappointing to see that the only options are to use an outdated web interface or to not receive any support even when I submit the info regarding the error message received that seems to point to OVH servers.

name: Carlo M.
review_body: Ticket number CS11482746. I am really satisfied with the support I received from OVH and in particular from Joanna and Matias, whom I warmly greet and thank. I received very fast and precise feedback. OVH went the extra mile in fulfilling my request, which was admittedly a bit unorthodox, and decided to reward my loyalty as a customer by granting it. I thank the entire OVH Team and I highly recommend relying on their services, as their staff is extremely skilled and kind. Highly recommended A++ Great job guys, keep it up!

name: Max
review_header: Poor network quality and unsatisfactory support
review_body: We use OVH and pay for premium support, but we periodically experience unstable server performance. All three of our servers simultaneously show high TTFB and packet loss. We have submitted multiple tickets, yet support does not always respond within the same day, even though they promise assistance within two hours for paid subscriptions. When we asked why, they claimed they don’t have enough staff. Despite our repeated requests to investigate the network issue, they make us perform tests, even though we are not system engineers. These tests are costly for us, and we do not want to hire an external administrator, as it is obvious the problem lies with OVH’s network. The proof is that the issue occurs simultaneously across all three servers at specific times. The agent Jonathan V., repeatedly closes the ticket without solving the problem, without even looking into the real issue, and without studying the evidence we provided. He has ignored all our screenshots several times and closed the chat while the problem remained unresolved. We are very disappointed with their service and support quality. Ticket number: CS11436095

name: Adam Preece
review_header: Worst company I have ever dealt with
review_body: Worst company I have ever dealt with They try to trap you into their services by requesting documents that are not required on initial account opening . Then when you finally submit all the information they pass you on to other useless representatives who will request them again and again and you keep going around in circles! I have requested to terminate my account now, satisfied all requirement and for over 2 weeks they still are telling me they cannot close my account as they require information which I have already sent. Corrupt and shady customer services. I will never use or recomend OVH again , I have removed all my clients and partners are in the process of it too. Never again and avoid! UPDATE TO THE REPLIES FROM OVH!! I am fully aware of the active services , what you are failing to acknowledge is that the documents you requested , I had supplied you , and for over 2 weeks you were sending me support replies stating that you could not continue because you did not have the said documents , and you did! Your customer service representatives kept closing the case and were abrupt and kept repeating the same rubbish without acknowledging that I supplied the information. It even got to a point where you stated that I need to supply my username else you would not start the process which I sent you over 5 times!! You have misunderstood my requests time and time again. You actually still think I wanted you to close my account RIGHT NOW! When I just wanted confirmation that you will close my account and that no more payments would be taken out! You could not even give me that piece of mind. Your systems are full of bugs , even authentication is a pain as you have so many different sub domains on your automated emails that take you to the incorrect registered site. No matter how you try to spin this / justify your behaviour, you have lost customers that will never return. There is no excuse for the unorganised mess of customer service and my loss of time , even now wasting my time replying to you. But hopefully others will listen to this and avoid you! My account is finally set to be closed down and even though you still have not confirmed after 20 times being asked is this everything now , and no more further payments you still could not answer with out saying you needed to take primary support. In the end I have removed my payment method , contacted my bank and good riddance . I wish to hear no more from the like of OVH AVOID!

name: Oscar Palomo
review_header: Good platform but misleading and no help
review_body: Good platform but some information can be misleading, and you do not have a chance to see how it works unless you pay for that. If you realize this is not for you, thousands of providers offer a guarantee but not OVH they only reply that you have to read their terms and conditions. They do not care if you are an existing client or not.

name: MrSharc
review_body: Let's start from the very beginning. I have been using the services of this company for a long time. The only company that really filters attacks at the network level (l3-l4) in europe and does not charge extra for it, although this protection has its own features and disadvantages and their prices are low. On August 16, I ordered web hosting (shared hosting) from this company for the first time. I was lured in by their advertising brochures. But it turned out that there is no protection at level 7 at all (not even basic options for limiting bursts, not to mention installing a captcha or calling a java script), and as a result, at one point the site simply stopped working. I was forced to write to support and request a refund, support is very slow, the billing panel is slow and unclear, a lot of unnecessary actions need to be done to write to support. But I want to note that technical support really confirmed my guesses about the complete lack of traffic filtering at level 7 and made a refund, as a result I received the entire amount back on 26 Aug 2025. Thanks OVH, I will take a VDS server from the new line and set up the filtering I need, although I will spend a couple of days on this. Ticket number for analysis: CS11447099

review_header: Great support when I need it!”

Once you do get through, the help is good, but the waiting period can be frustrating. Overall, a positive experience, but I hope they improve their support response times.

review_body: I had and issue and help me to solve it. I think can improve in time response and notify any issue to the customer.

review_body: Hello OVH Team— I’m a longtime user and I’ve noticed that many companies now accept cryptocurrency for faster, more flexible payments. It would be fantastic if OVH could consider adding crypto as a payment option in the future. Are there any plans or discussions underway to enable this?

name: id k
review_body: Answered my questions clearly and concisely

name: postiv2
review_body: The dashboard interface is a bit convoluted and takes a bit of time getting used to, it displays some information in English and some in French, and some links and search results return 404s, so finding anything can be quite the ordeal at times. Downtimes are few and far between. Overall, I've been content with OVH.

name: Mohammad Adil
review_header: They Canceled My Order but Refused to Refund
review_body: They Take Your Money, Then Ghost You. Be warned. My experience with OVHcloud was a masterclass in frustration. They will take your payment, cancel your order for a vague reason, and then make it impossible to get your money back. Here’s their playbook: 1. You place an order and pay. 2. They cancel it, citing unclear inaccurate personal details. 3. You follow their instructions to fix it and reply to their email. They ignore you. 4. You open a support ticket. They ignore that too. 5. Finally, they block you from their support system entirely so you can't even check your ticket status. It's simple logic: if you cancel an order, you refund the money or give clear instructions on how to place a new one. OVHcloud does neither. They just play hide and seek to keep your money. This isn't just bad service; it feels like a deliberate attempt to rob you. They just wait for you to give up so that they can enjoy the money. It's an absolute waste of time, and nobody deserves this kind of nonsense from a company that acts like a thief. Stay away.

name: Zsolt G
review_body: Excellent support from Elisabeth! I had trouble renewing my domain for more than a year, and she quickly provided clear guidance to resolve the issue. Very professional, friendly, and efficient service.

name: Ale
review_header: good service with bad abuse handling
review_body: I have used OVH for a vps before for around 6 months and there were no complaints. What I do have a problem with however is their abuse procedures and processes, if it wasn't for this then I'd rate them 4 or 5 stars. Firstly, 99% of the email spam and brute force attacks I get comes from OVH since they dont block port 25. Secondly and the most annoying part, they also have no actual humans reviewing abuse cases, instead they just forward all abuse complaints onto their customers and rely on them to handle it. I have not received 1 response from an actual human regarding abuse cases. Do you think someone intentionally operating a mass email spamming operation or phishing page would willfully shutdown their operation when OVH forwards an abuse complaint over? No, they wont. Here are the ticket ids ZSGJDTGHPV QJLZLPPSKL PLPLCBRWML WVMFLDPTTN KMMNVNPKBM NPKMSZBRBS

review_body: OVH is an easy platform, but you need to know more what you do. E.g. when I auto renewed my DNS but not my domain name, I would expect to be warned before it shuted down. But customer service / chat is very efficient and OVH never let me in a bad situation, every time I asked them support.

name: Alec Thomas
review_header: I paid $441 to receive a dedicated…
review_body: I paid $441 to receive a dedicated server and after many hours of trying to contact customer support in order to access this service, I received no updates. It is important to note that I have used multiple VPS companies before and it is typical to receive a reply or at the very least further information within a few minutes. I am paying a premium price for a premium service with no updates. I have cancelled/blocked my payment with my bank and will be utilising another service. Very disappointing.

name: CC
review_header: Very prompt response to my problem
review_body: Very prompt response to my problem with email. Received very easy to follow instructions which resolved the problem quickly, with great communication.

name: Lucas Nguyen
review_header: Powerful specs at a low price, with some trade-offs
review_body: From my perspective, OVHcloud VPS is a good option for experienced users looking for a cost-effective solution. The biggest strength I've found is its incredibly competitive pricing, which is often much cheaper than other major providers, all while still offering solid specifications and unlimited bandwidth. However, there are some drawbacks I've had to consider. Customer support is quite slow, and it's largely self-service through documentation, which can be difficult for new users. I also find the network speed to be a bit of a limitation, as it's capped at 100Mbps—significantly slower than the 1Gbps offered by many competitors. Lastly, the complex and time-consuming registration and account verification process made my initial experience less than pleasant.

name: Leandro Oliveira
review_body: Excelent support

name: Michael
review_header: Fast and helpful answer to a ticket CS11426704

name: Rian V
review_body: Joined OVHCloud last month after hearing from them online. I took both a VPS and Dedicated Server package from the company. Allocation and setup was extremely fast and very easy using their guidance guides. I decided to renew both servers earlier and made use of their online chat facility. Customer support was instant and the operators were friendly, efficient and fast. Renewals took less than 2 minutes. This has been a great experience for our company!

review_body: Bought a UNBUNTU server, its been down for 3 days, and zero support

name: Rida
review_header: Debora is just an amazing person

name: Solon
review_body: I had an issue with a hosting plan due to cron job limitations that didn’t meet my needs. While a refund wasn’t possible under my company account, the support team offered a fair alternative by transferring my unused paid time to a new VPS. The process was clear, accurate, and handled professionally, with regular updates until the transfer was completed. A frustrating situation was resolved fairly and efficiently.

name: CHris
review_body: Stable, affordable and fluent hosting, and most importantly – the staff are extremely helpful! They never ignore even unusual or non-standard requests

name: Pierre
review_body: Effective support and loyalty rewarded. The treatment was not immediate, but there was no urgency. The response was very satisfactory. (ticket CS11305001)

name: Tom Bannister
review_body: I've had a positive experience onboarding with OVHcloud. Initially, I committed to a VPS with the wrong hardware stack for me. OVH worked with me and resolved the situation to my satisfaction. I'm looking forward to a long-term positive relationship with OVH, and we're off to a great start. Thanks OVH

name: Philip Evans
review_header: I have been using OVH for many years…
review_body: I have been using OVH for many years and until now have had no reason to contact support. I created a ticket CS11395229 I was very pleased with the response time and the resolve was well explained and it enabled me to get things back on track quickly and easily.

name: Jimmy Ruska
review_header: OVH fraudulent marketing, overcharging customers, gaslighting them.
review_body: I signed up to a server with the promotion of "lifetime fixed price", meaning the price wouldn't increase with inflation. After a few years OVH forgot the promotion and started increasing the prices. Support is gaslighting me that it never existed.

Remember ovh - we were patient with you when your shipping containers were on fire back in the day and this process you have is bad with the abuse team. Update to OVH Response: Key points to understand are: 1. We had been responding to email about the abuse and missed JUST 1 2. The ticket number you sent and I sent in my initial complaint is NOT in our account - check the live chat I did on Friday - the live chat colleague admitted it is NOT showing in the account 3. The Abuse Team switched off the server on a Friday evening and are not working over the weekend for us to respond and deal with the issue during the weekend which means a BUNCH of legit customers have been down You guys just need to admit to a bad process and fix the process of not switching off servers on a Friday whereby there is NO ONE at OVH is there to help and work with to resolve the issue over the weekend. You will see in our account we have been a long standing client of OVH and having the abuse team separated from your support team and clients do deal with matters is what results you getting a 1 star review.

name: Always Fair
review_body: First of all, the admin panel is poorly designed. I disabled auto-renewal weeks in advance, yet the system still charged me at the beginning of the month. Despite this, they refused to issue a refund. I’m not a novice, I’m an experienced user, and it’s clear their renewal settings are faulty. The domain wasn’t even pointing to their servers, so why would I keep it on auto-renewal? Even if we assume I somehow forgot to disable it (which I certainly did not), I contacted their support on the renewal date, and the service remained unused. That alone should justify a refund, and yet, they refused. Secondly, the VPS performance was disappointing. Despite having 8GB of RAM and a 4-core CPU, it was significantly slower than a basic shared hosting package. It was hosting a single PrestaShop site with very low daily traffic, so this is unacceptable. Lastly, the VPS came with a shared IP address that was already blacklisted on multiple platforms. This caused major issues with email deliverability, particularly with order notifications not reaching customers. REPLY: It has nothing to do with me. Your admin interface is not responsive enough. There may be a script interacting with the background database — I am not an expert to say exactly which — but whatever it is, it does not function properly. The cancellation request does not take effect and gives the customer the false impression that the command has been successfully processed. In this day and age, with a provider of your scale, no one would expect such a basic and frustrating error to occur. I never went back to double-check, only to discover later that it had not been cancelled when I was charged. On the very same day, I doubted myself and tried switching the renewal to manual. Right at that moment, one of the services — either the VPS or the cPanel — reverted back to automatic renewal again. That is when I caught the issue. One day, you will realise this mistake (if you have not already) and will regret blaming an experienced client. This is not about the money, of course. I could buy the entire OVH.

name: Joseph
review_body: We’ve been with OVH for over 8 years. We left Hetzner after some terrible incidents and never looked back. Our experience with OVH has been solid—excluding the major fire incident that happened a couple of years ago. To be fair, that was a big deal and quite a mess, but since then, all the new data centers have been built with multiple safety layers to prevent anything like that from happening again. Support has also improved significantly in recent years! Response times have dropped dramatically to just a few hours (this is with the standard, entry-level support plan), which is a huge improvement compared to a few years ago when we often had to wait several days or even call support directly to get anything resolved. The quality of support has always been high—our requests were never denied, and the support team was consistently polite, professional, and capable of resolving our issues. We’re writing this review because we recently needed to upgrade one of our servers. The existing server had a commitment for several more months, but support allowed us to move that commitment to the new server and even carried over the remaining credit (CS11336208)—no questions asked. So, thank you very much!

review_header: Avoid OVH for Microsoft 365 Licenses — Terrible Experience

I provided clear proof, including screenshots, that no emails were received. And what does support do? They just copy-paste the same useless response: "We sent the emails." No, you didn’t. Then they suggest I go manually recover the passwords for all 20 tenants - seriously? Why am I even using a reseller if I have to waste hours fixing your system’s screw-up? Their support doesn’t read tickets, doesn’t investigate, doesn’t help - they just bounce you around with canned replies. I’ve had multiple tickets now, and every single agent has been incompetent. If you need reliability, run from OVH. The platform is broken, and the support team is worse. I’m moving all my clients elsewhere.

But there is a negative, if you have just the basic support plan, support takes days to reply. In addition i recently had something really annoying happen with a SoYouStart server. I cancelled the server, but their system still charged my credit card. It took weeks of talking on the phone/making support tickets explaining how it was on their end. Thankfully they refunded me the money that was charged. The process for cancelling servers on SoYouStart is unnecessarily complicated (done through an API that submits commands to their back end). Regardless, with the one problem i had over the course of all those years i'm still a customer - it doesnt change how amazing of a host they are! P.S. OVHCloud owns SoYouStart.

name: Alex
review_header: You may lose your data with OVH
review_body: Please note that you may lose your data with OVH when you decide to leave. I have been an OVH customer for over ten years. I put all my website data and my company emails on their platform. A few months ago, they started sending emails to renew my subscription, which had tripled. I paid so as not to lose my data, but despite this, they double-charged my account. I brought this to their attention after several discussions with their customer service representatives, and after informing my bank that OVH had taken money from my account without authorization, they initiated the refund process and decided to exclude me from their platform without recourse. They sent me an email saying that I could recover my database, but technically it was impossible; every time I tried, the system refused to download it. After a few days, they cut off my access to the system and I no longer have any access to my data. I reported the problem to them, and they said they had referred the case to customer service, then to technical support. To date, they have confiscated my data to make me pay for no longer being their customer. Be careful if you are looking for a service to host your websites or store your data. With OVH, you run the risk of losing everything if you do not agree to pay the fees they increase without warning. Look for a more serious and professional service. Update 1: A ovh representative reached out to me stating that i need to pay for another year to get access to my data. A few hours after another one reached out again and requested my case number , which i gave him. He said they will be investigating the case to understand what went wrong. Still on stand by. More to come on this.

review_header: OVH is still a solid and affordable hosting option
review_body: I have been an OVH customer for many years through 2 different business accounts. Their service always offers really good products for the price. The only thing I miss from the previous years is the lack of official support for VMWare ESXi on their dedicated server although it works if manually installed through KVM/IPMI, with some quirks for their /32 public IPv4 address and out of subnet host route gateway. Unfortunately the day after we migrated some critical services from another cloud provider to a new OVH dedicated server, a datacenter incident took down our server for over 8 hours, interrupting our business operations. However the 99.95% uptime SLA policy was honored on the CS11269441 support ticket. After this I hope for a solid service for the upcoming years and also hope they bring back support for ESXi on the unmanaged servers, at least offering the required guidance and tools to make it work with their unusual public IPv4 address scheme. Finally I hope they further expand with a datacenter in South America, a service provider like OVH is really needed in this region.

review_header: 48 hours for a VPS and no refund
review_body: OVH takes 48 hours to provide a simple VPS, unlike other services that offer immediate provisioning. This delay was not clearly communicated. After purchasing the VPS and realizing it would take 48 hours, I decided to cancel immediately. However, as a company, I was informed that I am not entitled to a refund. OVH could provide a refund, especially for a service that hasn’t been used and was still within the 48-hour window, but after contacting support, I was told it’s not possible. Refunds are only issued if OVH fails to deliver the service within 48 hours, which is absurd. I was setting up a resource to test OVH’s services for a larger company project that would involve building a significant infrastructure. However, due to this experience, I will not proceed with OVH and will explore other alternatives instead.

name: John
review_body: I recently encountered a serious issue with OVHcloud's VPS service that I feel potential customers should be aware of. After missing a renewal payment, I immediately lost access to my data. Instead of providing a grace period or temporary access to retrieve my important files, my VPS was suspended pending "full deletion." When I requested access to my data, I was told I could only regain access after paying for the renewal effectively preventing me from retrieving my files unless I continued with their service. While I understand businesses need to enforce payment policies, holding customer data inaccessible without providing a reasonable opportunity to back it up first feels unnecessarily harsh. A more customer friendly approach would be to allow limited access for data retrieval before suspension. I've since decided to move to another provider with more flexible policies regarding data access during billing issues. If you value having reliable access to your data even during payment disputes, I would recommend exploring other hosting options.

name: xkalxm x
review_body: At first, everything was fine. I purchased a dedicated server and it was set up in about an hour with no issues at all. Later on, I started ordering IP addresses every few days. Eventually, when I tried to place another IP order, it said "additional verification required" and that it could take up to 48 hours. About a day later, the order was canceled. That's when the problems began. When I contacted live support, they told me I needed to update my account information — basically giving me generic responses. Anyway, I updated everything and tried ordering again, but the same thing kept happening. I submitted tickets, and a support agent named Gabriel N. told me to place the order again and that it would be manually approved this time. I did that, but once again, it was canceled after 2 days. Just ridiculous. Since they started responding extremely slowly, I went to the Public Cloud section and activated a project. I placed around 100 small orders, and only then did they finally notice. Clearly, they only pay attention when it suits them. Then the system created a ticket saying I needed to upload documents. I had already told live support I was happy to complete a KYC verification if needed. The ticket said to upload documents via the "My Documents" section — which doesn't even exist in the customer panel. Total joke. I contacted live support again and they told me to send the documents in the ticket. So I did — front and back of my ID. Then they asked for proof of address, which I downloaded as a PDF from an official government website and sent it. I've been waiting for days now. This is honestly the most frustrating and ridiculous process I've seen. I'm an active customer, and you're doing a fraud check? For what? If this were my first order and I was using a VPN or something, I’d understand. But I’ve already been using your services. My service is close to expiry — what if I can’t renew it in time because of this mess? Will it be canceled too? Do NOT order from here. They don’t even know how their own system works. Account: as371715-ovh

name: Manpreet
review_header: OVH is not a reliable server provider.
review_body: Edited after OVH reply (20th May 2025): If you have seen the ticket carefully, then you might have seen screen shots of the email that I received from your abuse team. And if you have carefully seen the ticket, then I repeatedly asked that "Please point out where is the technical detail in the email" My only question that stayed for long is that where is the technical detail?" If you have seen the ticket then you might have noticed that your team says they don't have access to abuse team. You take down a production server, and you say that you don't have access to abuse team. Is this not a shame on OVH? **** How was it fixed? ***** After days of research on internet I figured out that you don't have your own abuse detection system. You use Netcraft. I directly contacted Netcarft and they gave me issue number 68604359. After providing screenshots they agreed that they flagged the portal in error. You can see the issue if your fake abuse team has any access to them. Once Netcarft clear the flag, the next day I received an email from your fake abuse department that your ticket has been closed. Other than this they never replied to any email, even after updating my email address, as suggested by your so called support. --------- Original Review ------ We’ve been an OVH Cloud customer for over 11 years. Our leased server supports our tracking and communication software and serves around 3,000 GPS devices in a live production environment. On April 1, 2025, we received an email from abuse team claiming a phishing website was hosted on our server. As an immediate action I stopped the website. Still, on the third day OVH hijacked our production server. ** What was the business impact? ** 1. This server listens to approx. 3000 GPS tracking devices installed on commercial trucks and trailers. All of our clients lost connection with their vehicles. 2. Server hosts a communication system where dispatchers send live instructions to drivers on road. All clients lost connection with their drivers, and this caused missed deliveries causing financial loss to our customers. 3. Several other automations stopped. All of a sudden we had to migrate to a different server that we kept spare for urgencies. To understand the issue I created a support ticket and also called them to understand what was wrong. Support team told me to reply to the same email that was received from abuse team and assured that they will tell you. I replied to that email multiple times. But never got any reply from abuse team. I kept asking OVH support via tickets. But support kept saying that they don't have access to abuse team. Now we are in a business critical situation: 1. The domain they mentioned in the abuse email has nothing objectionable. It is a staging environment for testing our live application. 2. Because this domain was flagged by OVH, we have exact same web app running in production which we are keeping down because we are afraid of same wrong action on other server. ** What are we looking for? we appreciate that OVH does not allow phishing website. But the website they flagged is a normal web application used by our customers. Only those users can use them who were signed up by their employers. --We need to understand what was exactly on website that abuse system flagged the domain and hijacked our server even after the website was immediately taken offline. --We need detail, so that we could take care of objectionable things on several other applications running on different ovh servers. OVH team permanently closes tickets after stating that abuse team has provided sufficient detail. But abuse team just stated a domain name and nothing else in the email. To keep the conversation on, I create new tickets. I am keeping tickets open but they send a ready-made reply that they dont have access to abuse and ask to contact abuse team, but abuse team never replies. So for us OVH servers are no more reliable provider because they hijacked our business all of a sudden without any reason. They even do not explain what was the reason of hijacking a server. I am attaching all tickets and conversations and abuse email that, according to them, contains all so-called technical details. We request OVH to tell us what was phishing in the website.

name: Mateusz Franaszek
review_header: Absurd bureaucracy, wasted time and money
review_body: I placed an order for a domain and VPS at OVH. I accidentally used their Canadian portal, and the order was cancelled due to a "region mismatch." Support told me to create a new account on the UK OVH site. I did exactly that — and again, the VPS order was cancelled, but this time the domain was accepted and charged, even though I can’t use it without a server. They refused to cancel or refund the domain, hiding behind "registry rules." I also can’t remove my payment method because there is now an "active service" (the domain I didn’t want). Total nonsense. This whole experience is ridiculous: You buy a service you can't use, you’re charged for it, can't cancel it, can't remove your payment details, and can't close your account unless you file a GDPR request. I’ve submitted a complaint to Nominet and will be requesting full data deletion under GDPR. OVH is a perfect example of how not to treat customers. I wouldn’t recommend them to anyone — unless you enjoy bureaucracy, contradictions

name: Sasan
review_header: OVHcloud – Vague Accusations, No Accountability, and Zero Support
review_body: I have been dealing with OVHcloud’s support team regarding an unresolved issue dating back to October 2022. After multiple follow-ups over the years, OVHcloud finally replied — and their response was completely unsatisfactory. What happened? I ordered several VPS instances back in October 2022. Shortly after payment, my account (formerly is151300-ovh) was locked without warning. I promptly provided all requested documents (government-issued ID and proof of billing), yet my account remained inaccessible. Despite clear bank records showing full transactions (not just pre-authorizations) for amounts totaling 1,991.12 TRY on October 19, 2022, I never received any refund. For over two years, every inquiry resulted in generic replies claiming that only a pre-authorization had been made. My recently created account (using the same email) was also locked without any explanation, leaving me completely without support. OVHcloud’s latest response claimed: My account was disabled because of “illegal activities” on my server—an accusation made with no details, evidence, or even a single log shared. Their explanation was vague, citing “security reasons” and stating the decision is “final and unappealable.” They continue insisting that the charges were only pre-authorizations, despite my solid bank documentation showing otherwise. What’s even more frustrating? I have no direct access to a support representative. Every time I’ve requested detailed explanations or tried to escalate the matter, I’ve simply been told to “raise your complaint,” with no actual assistance provided. The lack of accountability and transparency from OVHcloud’s support team makes it nearly impossible to have my issue resolved, and I feel completely abandoned as a customer. Final thoughts: If you’re considering OVHcloud, be aware that if something goes wrong, you might not only lose access to your account and funds, but you may also face a wall of vague accusations and zero support. I urge OVHcloud to address these issues and for potential customers to be cautious

name: Sarah Conner
review_body: They are sharing my non consensual imagery across many of their websites and when notified, they would rather help the criminals than the actual victims in this situation... they're the only hosting company that refused to comply with taking down this sexual abuse imagery.

name: Olivier D
review_header: The worse customer service experience, ever.
review_body: Mame D. of OVH asked me to review their service, well... here you go, short and sweet: AVOID them at all costs! I have been asked to quote the ticket reference, here they are: CS10769529 & CS10960112. This way OVH can check and come back here to tell the world why this review is unfair. Honestly, be my guest OVH, I'm so done... Now, here is my experience: A couple of month back I spot a domain name I want to purchase, see it is available and start the process of purchasing it together with a web hosting, using OVH. The order is easy, everything is wrapped up fairly quickly. Then I start receiving some emails about my order, all looks ok. A few hours later, when everything things to be in order, I try to install a module on my website, apparently things are done promptly, all good. However, nothing shows on the website, I cannot access the module but instead see another landing page telling me that the domain I thought I owned was available for sale. I look back at my order, yep, I did try to purchase said domain. Investigating further, I understand that the domain was grabbed by a domain broker a few minutes before I did purchase it. Frustrating, but such is life sometimes. However, since I can buy the domain on the secondary market for a reasonable price, I do that. Once I fully understood this situation, I reached out to OVH customer service to raise this issue and the fact that AT NO POINT of the order process, or after, did OVH highlight that they could not give me the domain I ordered. Then, after I raised the issue, at no point did they investigate what happened and acknowledge their failure. Because I got rather insistent that they were at fault here, OVH said they may (!) refund me the cost of the hosting (which is actually roughly equivalent to the cost of the domain on the secondary market). They did tell me that, should the refund be approved, it could take up to a month... A good month after that declaration, nothing happened, no follow-up, no refund. So I chased. Tadaa: today, they refunded me and deleted my hosted website, suspended my DNS zone, just wiped out everything. Again, AT NO POINT did they say that, should they refund me, they would effectively disable all the services and throw me out. But they did it, the lovely people... see, they can be efficient sometimes. So, back to you, gentle customer, beware. You may need a lot of patience with OVH and maybe more than that. I used to be a happy customer of theirs but I will now migrate the various websites I held with them for many years to another platform, with better reviews than OVH. EDIT: As announced, OVH try to show they care, even though they don't. Not only they clearly glaze over the issue linked with their failing process, but they do not commit to change it and, best of all, they make it sound like it was fully clear they would cancel all services. Whilst I requested a 'commercial gesture', they 'offered a refund' which is in fact the cancellation of all services with the necessary refund that goes with it, which is a legal requirement. Honestly, if you haven't already just avoid them like the plague.

name: Abu Sufian
review_header: A Perfect Service with Best Value
review_body: I've used AWS, GCP, OCI and other VPS solutions. The price OVH offered for Bare-Metal Server is unbeatable. Server was up and running within 15 minutes. I loved that they also provide rDNS for the IP they allocate for the machine. I'm from Bangladesh, and I've faced payment issues with several other cloud providers. For example, I couldn't pay to AWS with IFIC VISA card. Azure works, OCI sometimes have problems. But OVH fully supported the payment platform, just like local.

name: Nico
review_header: OVHCloud risks legal action – confirmed deception and ignored refund rights
review_body: I rented two servers from OVHCloud because their website clearly advertised Windows Server 2025 Datacenter compatibility. That statement is false – and support confirmed in writing that this OS is not supported on those systems. ❌ Product doesn't match the offer ❌ Refund refused ❌ OVH still promotes this across all regions, despite being informed ❌ Support tickets were ignored or closed without resolution This isn’t a minor issue – this is a serious legal matter: § 434 BGB (German Civil Code) – product defect § 323 BGB – right to withdraw § 5 UWG – misleading advertising EU Directive 2005/29/EC – unfair commercial practice UK Consumer Rights Act & international laws – violated 📂 All evidence is documented: screenshots, internal chat, website capture. 🧾 PayPal disputes have been submitted. ⚖️ Next step: legal complaint to the German Wettbewerbszentrale, Verbraucherzentrale, and formal proceedings under EU consumer law. 📢 If OVHCloud does not resolve this immediately, I will file: A criminal complaint under § 263 StGB (fraud) Reports to data protection authorities and hosting watchdogs A public press release to warn others This is not a technical issue. It is systematic deception with real legal consequences. You’ve been warned. #ovhcloud #legalaction #ovhfail #consumerprotection #uwg #bgb #eucomplaint #windowsserver2025 #falseadvertising #trustpilot #fraud #serverhosting #dedicatedserver _____ J’ai loué deux serveurs via OVHCloud.com sur la base d’un argument commercial : compatibilité avec Windows Server 2025 Datacenter. Ce point est faux, confirmé par le support OVH par écrit : le système n’est pas supporté. ❌ Produit non conforme à l’offre ❌ Remboursement refusé ❌ Publicité toujours en ligne, malgré les preuves ❌ Tickets fermés sans solution Ce n’est pas un simple malentendu. C’est un dossier juridique majeur : § 434 BGB (droit allemand) – défaut de conformité § 323 BGB – droit de résiliation § 5 UWG – publicité mensongère Directive 2005/29/CE – pratiques commerciales trompeuses Loi britannique & droit international du consommateur – violés 📂 Preuves : captures d’écran, site archivé, conversations support ⚖️ Procédures PayPal lancées 🔔 Si OVHCloud ne réagit pas immédiatement, je déposerai : Une plainte pénale pour fraude (article 263 StGB) Un signalement aux autorités de protection des consommateurs Un communiqué public adressé à la presse OVHCloud n’a plus d’excuses. Il ne s’agit pas d’un bug, mais d’une tromperie systémique avec conséquences juridiques graves. Update – Fall wurde gelöst Nach längerer Auseinandersetzung wurde mein Fall durch OVHcloud mittlerweile vollständig gelöst. Die Rückerstattung wurde durchgeführt, die betroffenen Server wurden entfernt, und der Fall ist damit aus meiner Sicht abgeschlossen. Allerdings möchte ich auch transparent festhalten: Ohne den öffentlichen Druck auf sozialen Netzwerken, umfangreiche Dokumentation und die Weiterleitung an die Claim-Abteilung hätte der normale Support das Ticket vermutlich weiterhin ignoriert oder geschlossen. Die ursprünglich beworbenen Eigenschaften der Server waren tatsächlich nicht wie beschrieben verfügbar – das wurde mir später auch schriftlich bestätigt. Dass es erst dieser Eskalation bedurfte, bleibt schade – aber ich anerkenne, dass OVHcloud letztlich reagiert und die Rückabwicklung ermöglicht hat. Ich hoffe, das Unternehmen nimmt diese Fälle künftig ernster – im Sinne der Kundenzufriedenheit und Rechtskonformität. Update – Case resolved After an extended dispute, my case with OVHcloud has now been fully resolved. The refund was processed, the affected servers have been removed from my account, and from my perspective, the matter is now closed. That said, I want to be transparent: It sadly required public pressure, daily documentation, and escalation to the Claim Department to reach this outcome. The servers I ordered were not compatible with the features advertised, as OVH later confirmed in writing. It's unfortunate that such escalation was necessary – but I acknowledge that OVHcloud ultimately acted and allowed a fair resolution. I hope they take similar customer issues more seriously in the future – in the interest of transparency, accountability, and legal compliance.

I am currently using aws and azur, and some overseas traffic cost more than necessary, so I was looking for other overseas region cloud companies. It seems that we have finally found a perfectly suitable company. I like the price compared to the specifications, and there is a wide range of choices as it provides a variety of products. Above all, compared to other companies that provide similar products, the experience from purchase to post-installation use is good. From my point of view, I was worried because it was my first time to know the company, but Jennifer, the person in charge, called me directly to explain and guide many of the things I was curious about, raising the OVHcloud's trust.

review_header: OVH does not consider its customers
review_body: OVH and the lack of respect for its customers. I bought a server over 10 months ago, with loyalty, but it had a bad block on the HD, OVH, I had to migrate because OVH did not have real-time delivery, and I could not exchange the HD with the risk of losing all the data. OVH needs to worry about serving its customers better, because a decade-long commitment relationship is worth more than a simple $80 contract compared to the thousands of dollars invested as a customer.

name: Chris Haynes
review_body: Our VPS 8 core 8GB Ram server with OVH was setup on Friday, we noticed immediately that the load was high with nothing on it. We figured it might be an issue with updates etc. We wrote a ticket to support and we left it overnight and came back Saturday morning with the same issues. Contacted sales and support. No response. The sales department left us on hold and then came back saying they were having internal issues and hung up. Support did not respond period. We terminated our account immediately. Server was not live for more than 24 hours. We requested a refund. On Monday morning, we received a ticket response to the cancellation (not the high load - still no response on that), saying they could not offer a refund and they could help with the cancellation. Stay away from OVH. They are not worth it.

name: Vinko
review_header: Why are we landing in the 48 hour order validation again in a timely urgent situation?
review_body: Edit: The issue was resolved in time, although multiple paths and multiple requests were needed. -- This is about order number 225222001. We set up hosted exchange with you on Monday, with the surprise that our order needs 48 hours processing time. When we asked support, they told us that we absolutely had to set up exchange by Friday, as our old hosting contract expires at the weekend. The support agent on the phone explained to us that the 48-hour check only occurs the first time and not for subsequent orders. With this confidence, we bought the necessary hosted exchange licenses on thursday (yesterday), trusting that the order would go through immediately. And we ended up in the 48 hour check again!!! We absolutely have to make the migration today (Friday 21.03.25) as our contract with the old hoster expires at the weekend. I have contacted telephone support twice today and chat support twice and they don't want to speed up the validation of our order. The fact that we were told that validation will not happen again for subsequent orders is being ignored. If the validation can still be carried out today, I am happy to withdraw the rating. But if the order won't be processed today, our business will be impacted by that decision.

name: Emmanuel dC
review_header: Give them dozens of thousands of $, they'll treat you like sh*t
review_body: If you enjoy being treated like sh*t by a company you give dozens of thousands of dollars or euros, go for OVH Cloud! that I started being an OVH customer back in 2000, ie 25 years ago. In total, through my various companies, I've given them a few dozens of thousands euros. Last year, we received an email from them stating that they unilaterally cancel one of the servers we pay every month, because on January 1st 2025 they would close the data center where it's located. In December, they sent us a follow-up urging up to migrate to another server, and providing a discount coupon in order to make up for the trouble. So we invested quite much time (ie money) migrating to a new OVH server, that is more expensive than the previous one. Yet, in the first days of January, they charged us again for the old server that they actually terminated! I wrote to them, they apologized and said that this server was still totally operating, because they changed their mind and decided not to close the datacenter. But they didn't think that maybe it would have been smart to let their customers know, so that they don't waste time and money!! As a way to apologize for the trouble and refund what they charged us for a server that was supposed to be cancelled, they credited us one month of rental on a new server. Also, we decided to commit for one year on the new server, in order to fully use the discount coupon that they provided us (valid for 12 months). But when committing for one year, the discount was not taken into account. Their support told us that it was only a display bug, and that after the one month they give us for free the amount they will charge us would include the discount. This is not what happened. They tried to charge us 300 euros more than they were supposed to charge us, because the amount didn't take the discount into account. Luckily, the transaction was blocked by our bank because of its amount. We immediately contacted their support and told them about their mistake, so that they can fix it and charge us the correct amount. That was 5 days ago, and despite two follow ups they still even haven't replied. Even worse: last year, we received an email from them stating that the server would be suspended if we don't make the payment ASAP. But this still links to a page with the wrong amount, so they haven't fixed anything. Oh, and I forgot to mention but to give you an idea of how unreliable and unprofessionnal they are: when we initially ordered this server, it was advertised that it would be delivered "within 72 hours". In the end, it took 5 days! In the end, OVH Cloud was a great company in the past, but all this story shows how terrible this company has become. You should defininely avoid them and work with a more reliable partner.

review_body: Scam service, not recommended at all, I have ordered a domain and later disappeared from my account and transferred without my permission to another company, I contact support they told me they will refund my order, now another one and half month no refund received Try OVH if you want to lose your domain. review_body: 1. got recommended 2. signed up an account and placed a Singapore instance order 3. used my wife's credit card to pay by paypal 4. checked but could not find my server status 5. looked around the website to find my server info 6. order status: order is not received, checked paypal, payment went through successfully. 7. waited until the next day, someone named Maria emailed me to welcome me, then asked me to add her whatsapp, wechat, telegram. 8. added whatsapp and wechat, auto response - "out of office hour" at Singapore 2pm+ on Tuesday. then about 2 hours later, she replied - "which company are u from... " I said, "i got your email and i am a newly signed up user". then no future response. 9. till now, after 1 day has passed, the order's status is only changed to they received it. 10. got another email saying, Your order is cancelled, ... and the interpretation here is 1) U agreed on all of our TOS 2) U must save ur credit card info with us 11. I am really happy now, that they gave me a chance to choose a better hosting.

After I order services, they cancel my order for existing reasons and make me redo the order and send your money in 21~29 days, forget about this aspect!. But after I place new order they suspend my account without notice. Never try to order any service from this company!

name: Adam Wojciechowski
review_body: Non-existent support. My dedicated bare-metal server had a 2 hour outage yesterday. I noticed it myself 20 minutes after it started. After failed restart, I received email saying "it will be solved in couple of minutes". I have also sent a ticket. And here's where trickery starts - my ticket was set to priority 3 (even though it was complete server outage). I had no influence over that priority. And their TOS say that SLA is only relevant for priority 1 events (which as it seems I'm unable to report) and that it only starts after report. So basically SLA is worthless, as their system will not allow you to send priority 1 ticket. But that's not all. There has been no activity on any of my 2 tickets (I tried another time hoping that priority 3 is a mistake), but server came back online. Shortly after I received email which liked to page, which claimed "outage was due to SCHEDULED maintenance of [electric systems}" and that "affected users were notified in advance". No, I wasn't. Now, 14 hours later - my tickets are still waiting for any reply/action. at 9:39 (12 hours after issues started) I got email which says somebody is looking into it - but it seems 2 hours is not enough for person supposedly taking care of it to figure out server is fine now. The only place, where I got response was their facebook, where I got same template message, as many people are getting on their reviews here - 12 hours after outage started. There is absolutely no way to contact any tech support. All messages, calls are ignored for hours. This is absolutely unacceptable for any business site/application. Disclaimer: outage was complete, server was unreachable by any means (KVM, SSH, Serial over lan, rescue system). It's my first and last business with ovh. Once prepaid term is over, I'll be moving over to hetzner. ADDED: From discussion with OVH it turns out, that their SLA and response times are simply a lie. Copied over from their message: "For your information, please note that there will be a delay of 24:00 to 48:00 when you create a support ticket." This means if your server is down, you'll have to wait 24 to 48 hours for them to even start looking into it... To OVH reply: Yes, they replied to tickets after 24 hours. They didn't even figure out that tickets WERE placed during outage, so congrats on "solving" tickets AFTER issue was no more. And I did not receive any notification in advance about the outage. Again, their reply shows very well how much their "SLA" and "guaranteed response time" is truly worth. Also, terms and conditions clearly states, that their reaction time should be 1 hour - not 24 or 48 hours response time they keep referring to in their answer to this comment (Rise dedicated server).

name: Muqsit Rayyan
review_body: Great customer service. I have used OVH for the past 10 years. Their support is probably best as it gets. If you are shifting servers or transferring contracts, they will thoroughly assist you. It is good when hosts offer customers this flexibility instead of having you be stuck with their old servers for contractual reasons.

name: Danislav
review_body: If you want to create an account, they require you to first get a free trial, but that free trial is not really free and you need to deposit 30$. After their ass ticketing system that no one responds to, I decided to not go back to OVH and request a refund (they promised that refund will be available at any time), and now they just redirect me from ticket to ticket just wasting my time

review_body: Horrible customer support. Instead of answering my questions gave me a knowledgebase link then disconnects the chat when I asked to cancel the service. I have to be disconnected twice. The third rep which was my first rep that disconnected me earlier, instead of doing my request gave me a bad link for the knowledgebase. Had to just look for where you can cancel. Also they dont give refunds even if it was just charged today and i have not been using it for 3 months.

name: Milan Moerman
review_body: I started using OVH a couple years ago, didnt think very much of it... wanted to cancel some of my services. There was my first problem with OVH, it wouldnt allow me to cancel my own services i was paying for. Very hard to figure out how to do it the correct way. The user interface is not user friendly at all! U can go on a cancellation to cancel 1 of youre srevices and it would give an error. But you can also request a deletion of youre services then get an automated mail with the same cancellation form and that is the right way to delete 1 of your services. very unfriendly for users. And if u want to ask customer service? Good luck with finding an email u can write to. All the phone numbers they provide are very expensive. So now i got billed 55 euros for a service i didnt use for the laste 1.5 months... just because the customer service is so hard to reach out to and the correct cancellation form is way to hard to figure out how to get there. I will probably not get a refund, because u can already guess... the customer service is unreachable or very expensive. OVH, if u read this im a very unsatisfied customer and wont be comming back to u if i need services in the future!

name: John brown
review_body: The service is chaotic. Billing is erratic and quite exorbitant. I have never used this service and I don't plan on using it. Your system does not even allow me to cancel the service. It's a complete nuisance system.

name: Pierre-Louis
review_header: The hosting is slow and support null
review_body: The hosting is slow. Very often the backend of my wordpress just hangs for minutes. Or just give me server500 errors. Even before launching my website, ie when no one else than me was trying to connect to it. Now I have about 100 users, and they just can't reliably download a 500mb file. It keeps failing. I bought their CDN option, because I thought it would improve the situation. But nothing changed. No clear documentation to explain how to set it up. And the worse, what really get them 1 star is the customer support. Forget about it ! You try to contact them, they have setup a wall of chatbot / fake chatbot / fake ticket submission forms / various pages redirecting you in all directions. The goal? Very simple: Discourage you from contacting them. You will try and it is going to make you mad. Because wherever you click you cannot reach them. But don't worry, their useful chatbot will redirect you to whatever unrelated FAQ.

name: Epea
review_body: We had expensive stealth 'premium' management charges on the account despite no active services, and not using their support for years, and never activating them. Tried to cancel the management, dashboard wouldn't let me and ust sent me in loops. Live support cut me off twice, then was very unhelpful. Servers overall were slow and unreliable, so cancelled the account anyway.

name: Darren Birks
review_body: So was using OVH for some time (mixture of dedicated and VPS) Recently I started getting emails that one of my VPS's was the source of spam. Naturally I investigate and find nothing. I shut the VPS down but the emails keep coming in. The spam seems to be referencing a domain that for some reason still point to the IP of my VPS and this domain is hosted by OVH. OVH keep mailing me with abuse of service threats despite this been nothing to do with my machines. There support are useless because they tell me to reply to the emails - which I have been - with no replies. Ironically the only spam I can see is the number of abuse tickets coming in from OVH. I actually had to add an auto filter to my gmail to block them. Terrible service, and I will be migrating all my services elsewhere. UPDATE: Despite requesting (and me supplying) more information I got no further contact from OVH. Tickets I open just kept getting closed with telling me to contact there trust/safety department - who never reply. EDIT: No everything is not ok - I still have hundreds of scammers domains pointing to my IP on your DNS servers which you are refusing to remove. I do not use X or facebook so cannot continue there.

review_body: I recently encountered some limitations due to US-based restrictions, which made it necessary for me to cancel my service with OVHcloud US. Their responsiveness and customer-focused approach made all the difference. Overall, while some policies may be strict due to regulatory reasons, their support team is top-notch and willing to assist where possible. Kudos to OVHcloud US for their excellent service! ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
