review_body: Le support technique a été très réactif .... !!! super

name: Muz S
review_header: Dedicated Server abruptly deleted. Support difficult to reach & get
review_body: I have been OVHCloud advanced dedicated server customer since 2023 Last week my server was deleted and I received message 'In accordance with your request, the server has now been deleted. This operation is irreversible.' No I did not make request to delete. But, I intended to continue service. I was having errors in payment, but finally I received message that payment processed. But the service(server) was abruptly deleted within week, without giving notice, message or opportunity to continue. This happened while I was engaged in personal emergency situation. Server service was decent, but after deleting service it has been very difficult to reach support to get service restarted or recover important data lost due to abrupt action without consideration for impact on the customer. The interfaces, especially related to support just keep redirecting without letting you in, and I am not even able to create support tickets. Looks hopeless situation. Dedicated server service was acceptable. But systems and interfaces, especially related to crucial customer support are very frustrating and appear flawed. I am willing to restart with new server, but would be needing data from old server which has abruptly gone now, making it experience to mourn. ----------------------------------------- Update [20 Feb 25] : Thank You Maxime.R for your attention and reply. I have provided requested information couple of days ago. It serves to have got connected with responsible representative, and I am hoping that needed assistance would be provided quickly in this critical emergency situation. ----------------------------------------- Update [22 Feb 25] : What makes OVHCloud interface confusing and frustrating is that user gets transferred to subsidiary sites of different countries 1) I noticed that while OVHCLoud presents me login screen for customer account, I can login from sites of certain countries like canada, else my login does not get validated. (Which was not issue earlier) 2) For support ovhcloud kept me redirecting to GB site, where I could not login for support. Now I can login from Canada site 3) But as my services have been deleted, I can not create support ticket for relevant deleted service. It would have helped if there was way to create general support ticket. 4) Payments redirect to US site. Payments may get processed, without creating charge on account. Flawed. And then my service got deleted. ----------------------------------------- Update [23 Feb 25] : I have submitted requested details again on 20th Feb to do checks (Customer Account sm530267-ovh, which was mentioned on this review since 18th Feb .. 6 Days since then now). I request to provide needed assistance ASAP. I request to restore deleted dedicated server. Or help me with data recovery from the deleted server. I have many off-site backups, but I also lost critical on-site data in server deletion done in confusion. I need to setup my server & services immediately now. There has already been loss of many days. ----------------------------------------- Update [27 Feb 25] : Any checks done related to my requests? I've also provided my email. I've received no communication so far.

name: Ludovic
review_header: OVH made a programming mistake that led…
review_body: OVH made a programming mistake that led to my PayPal details being used on another account for years. When I finally found out and asked for my money back, they said I was the one who had set up my payment method on that account (I had not) and that they would further not remove it from that account for GDPR reasons, despite the paypal account being mine. While that ticket was still open, they managed to bill me one more time, with the support of PayPal, despite me having cancelled all automated payments towards OVH.

name: Mehdi Chokhmy
review_header: I have been an OVH customer since…
review_body: I have been an OVH customer since January 2021, spending more than $300 every month on cloud services. This month, OVH suddenly closed my account, citing a Spamhaus complaint that had nothing to do with me. Despite my attempts to clarify the situation, their support team provided no real explanation or resolution and their abuse team doesn't answer. They chose to shut down my account without warning or investigation. No due process, no appeal, just an abrupt termination—effectively locking me out of services I paid for. If you're running critical infrastructure, think twice before trusting OVH. They can terminate your account without proper evidence or a fair chance to defend yourself. Their handling of this situation has been unprofessional, and their customer service is non-existent. Avoid OVH unless you’re willing to risk losing your services without justification.

name: Brillian Esa
review_body: Account Suspension and Server Shutdown in Just 3 Days Incident Timeline: Account Creation – I created my OVHCloud account on January 24, 2025. On the same day, I purchased a Dedicated Server (ns5190**.ip-192-99-45.net). Three days later, I suddenly found myself unable to log in to my customer panel. My Dedicated Server was suspended due to an alleged unpaid invoice. Typically, hosting providers allow a reasonable grace period before suspending services due to non-payment. However, in my case, the suspension happened just three days after the purchase, which is unusually fast and highly inconvenient. I was never notified about any pending payments before the suspension. Losing access to both my customer panel and server without warning is highly frustrating, especially for a newly purchased service. My experience with OVHCloud has been extremely disappointing. I expected better service and communication regarding billing. Instead, I faced an abrupt account restriction and service suspension with no prior notice. I hope OVHCloud can address these unfair suspensions and improve their billing transparency. For now, I cannot recommend their service to anyone looking for a reliable hosting provider.

name: Katerina Kulhankova
review_header: I warn against this hosting! it is dangerous!
review_body: I warn against this hosting. For someone who is dependent on a hosting it can be fatal! This hosting is cheaper, but you can repay for it like we did. As I can see by the reviews here (I find that Trustpilot trustworthy) almost all the others have a similar experience as us: OVH is great for hackers and anyone who wants to harm others. It is enough to write to OVH claiming there’s something wrong with someones website, and OVH, without any verification of whether it’s true or not, will shut down all the services without any prior warning. That's what happened to us. When we requested proof of the existence of malicious code, an analysis, or any evidence showing how they believe or verified the claim, we received only a clearly generic email response completely unrelated to our query, like “we’re talking about one thing, and they’re replying with something entirely different.” If you find this hard to believe, here’s a quote from the email telling us they're shutting us down: *"It has been brought to our attention that you're hosting a phishing webpage on your service ns3192371[.]ip-135-125-189[.]eu. Regarding the abuse (Phishing) reported to you on your service ns3192371[.]ip-135-125-189[.]eu, we are forced to put your service offline to stop the abuse."* ...they mentioned one url of our web. There is no malicious code on our website. We’re a reliable online store (20 year history, 1700 reviews on Trustpilot with rating 4,7), and we thoroughly checked the entire site, especially the specific page mentioned. Nothing suspicious was found. OVH provided no specific details and kept repeating the same nonsense, essentially saying: “Someone said there’s something wrong with your website, so we shut it down.” OVH is essentially a perfect support system for hackers—a method for taking down someone’s website and putting it out of operation. All you need to do is send them some made-up nonsense, and they’ll shut down the target website. We have pay for the hosting **€3,000**! Imagine that—a cheaper hosting service must be even worse....while anything worse is hard to imagine. Of course, we’ve switched our hosting elsewhere. We’ve suffered a big loss because our online store was hosted on this service, and we will sue OVH for the lost revenue and the damages and expenses caused by this. UPDATE 26the of January: Our OVH account ID is:bv194584-ovh We have sent SEVERAL emails to OVH emails and links. We were asking for datails, any informations but we only have received "automated and "formal" answers from OVH. Out ticket ID: Ticket #ABUSE_ZJGTNDKRMV), which we have written into the email subject and we sent it to: ZJGTNDKRMV.6920@abus.... (emails are not allowed to enter here] We got any answer which answer the basic question where OVH abuse team sees some non-compliant code. Because there is nothing like that as far as we analyzed. We also informed OVH about the damages and losts caused to us. Although we sent several requests, we did not receive any answer except some automatically generated general answers (with no information value). how suprising is that the only normal non-automated response we received from OVH is here on this review! We are already solving the case with the help of our lawyer, who accurately calculates the damages and losts.

name: Sapu TSM
review_header: Charged for Deleted Instance and Given Runaround from Support
review_body: I'll start by saying I was a mostly happy OVH customer, and while I'm certainly far from a large customer, I was spending comfortably in the 5 digits with them annually for many years. All my usage within the past couple of years has been on their public cloud offering. At the end of October, 2024, I went in to clean up some instances that I was no longer using so I wouldn't continue to be charged for them. I tried to go in on the 30th to delete them, but their control panel was down (and the server actually went down for an hour), so tried again the following day on the 31st. I kicked off a snapshot in the off chance there was something important on the instance that I needed again in the future. This snapshot didn't finish running before I had to go to work, so I came back in the evening and finished off deleting the instance (well before midnight in Quebec, where this instance was based). The next day, I logged in to find that there was a charge on my November invoice for this instance, so I raised a ticket with their claims department to get the charge cancelled. I got nothing but legalese thrown at me by the claims department, with them saying I needed to cancel the instance 24 hours before, and them later saying actually I needed to cancel by the 19th of the prior month. At the same time, their very own documentation states "You will need to delete this instance before 00:00 on the 1st day of the following month, so that your monthly subscription is not renewed for this instance." I pointed this out to them but they were completely unwilling to work with me on this. To add insult to injury, the snapshot I had kicked off failed due to a bug on their end (which their support confirmed in a separate ticket). However, I later found that they were still charging me for the storage used by the failed snapshot, which didn't even contain any usable data. After almost a month of back and forth, they finally gave in and agreed to cancel the charges. At this point I asked for my account to be closed completely which they did. In the end, the resolution was satisfactory, but the process put me off from ever using OVH again. This is in no small part because even after closing the issue, they still asserted that they did nothing wrong. I can only conclude from this experience they don't care that their documentation is misleading (they still haven't fixed it) or that they were charging me for a failed snapshot. They obviously don't want to keep me as a customer, so they won't. There are plenty of other companies in the space who offer competent customer support.

review_header: Poor support and no regards for clients
review_body: I manage about 35 domain names. For the first time, I had to use OVH because the .mobi for the domain can only be managed from a few registrar. GoDaddy's price was simply ridiculous. So, I followed the instructions on how to transfer a domain to OVH (like I have done a lot with my regular registrar). Because "privacy" was not deactivated with the old registrar, I got an email saying that the operation was cancelled. Fine, I'll correct the situation on my side and restart the process for the transfer. Via Chat, no response, no way to restart the process. Finally got an answer the next day that they weren't not able to restart the process because they already paid the old registar. As per the answer, I had to restart the process and pay for the transfer again. Since the service was not rendered, I asked for the refund but, again, I was told they could not because the service was already paid to the other registrar. With my regular registrar, when something like this happens, I just ask them to restart the process via Chat and, bam, it's done. But OVH, apparently works by other rules than normal companies. Very poor support, information is hard to find on their website and, apparently, they like to charge people for services that they don't deliver !!! Update 25-01-07 : waiting for your answer. Account cp332005-ovh Update 25-01-21 : finally got the full refund of the service (domain transfer) that never worked. Not sure if I would have been if I had not written this review. Doesn't change my opinion of what happened. So, still 1 star and still would not recommend them to anybody.

review_body: Terrible Service – Stay Away They bait you with limited-time trial credits to try their VPS, but my experience was a disaster from the start. Yet somehow, they still charged me because I forgot to delete the project—even though it was completely empty and used no resources. How does that even make sense? On top of that, their support is painfully slow—I waited more than a week for a response, only to be told there would be no refund. To make it worse, they closed my support ticket without even giving me a chance to respond. Avoid them at all cost to save your time and money.

name: Guilherme
review_header: Makes orders available, gives deadline and then cancels without helping customers
review_body: I purchased a dedicated server after waiting patiently for its availability, even accepting an initial delivery estimate of 120 seconds. However, after 24 hours without delivery, I contacted support and was told it would take up to a week. While not ideal, I agreed to wait. Yet, days later, my order was abruptly canceled, and I was instructed to place a new one on your website—only to find that the server I needed is no longer available. This lack of coordination and clarity has caused significant disruption to my business operations. To make matters worse, your support team has been unhelpful and dismissive, failing to understand the critical impact of this decision on my company. My team had already decommissioned our previous server in anticipation of the new one, as per the updated timeline provided by OVH. Now, we are left scrambling to find a similar server, with no success so far. This entire experience has been deeply frustrating and has disrupted our technical operations, effectively ruining my month. My ID: pg288611-ovh // order:218888651

name: João Gabriell
review_header: I do not recommend OVH Cloud services
review_body: I do not recommend OVH Cloud services, do not count on them as a provider. They advertise a server that they don't have and leave you hanging without even caring about the consequences for the customer. Run away!!! I recently received an email informing me of the cancellation of the purchase made on the 19th due to an alleged lack of stock. However, I was surprised to see that the same server was made available to the public again, even though previous orders were still delayed. This situation is contradictory to say the least and demonstrates a lack of commitment and respect for the customer. How can a company the size of OVH Cloud offer servers as "available" on the website, allowing purchases, and then cancel orders under the allegation of unavailability? This practice is unacceptable. I have accounts with OVH US and OVH PT and I am seriously thinking about the possibility of migrating to another provider, more than US$400 per month and they don't respect you! My OVH World account: tc282112-ovh

name: Norbert Kiszka
review_header: Bug in web payement and unpleasant bugs/issues when reporting bugs...
review_body: My experience with VPS-es and domains is quite good. Infrastructure fails are very rare, but when it happens, downtime is very very long (many hours and even days). I give two starts mostly because their very poor support. Today when I tried to renew service, I saw something strange and different than usual. I didn't know if this is a bug or some fraud/attack attempt (from third person). Support page is not the best, but when I finally found a link to the chat and after talking with stupid bot with not huge amount of options, and after redirect from one person to another, chat was suddenly ended - bug number two. In second attempt with this chat, finally I was able to speak with somebody competent to my problem. Meanwhile, person which I spoke previously opened a bug report (email). Finally there was two bug report duplicates. After spending some time, I wrote a message to this bug report. However... after spending another about 15 minutes to write this to be short and detailed, I tried to attach a print-screens. After that all my message was gone completely - I was writing it for long 15 minutes, to be short and helpful with bug report. Normally I make copies from some time to time, when I write in a browser textarea, but not this time... Bug number three. So... I tried to use chat once more to report a bug with a bug tracker. This employee wasn't able to understand me. I was forced to explain to him what is a software bug... Finally I don't know if he opened a ticket for this issue or not... Also, my problem wasn't solved, but currently in their bug tracker, I cant add any message (only those screenshots which I mentioned before - with lost message). Only information "We will share this information with the correct team." and two options: "Accept solution" and "Reject solution". Finally Im very angry with today experience. Normally it's very hard to make me angry, but they succeed with it. PS. support guys tried to be nice, but in the end Im not pleased with that support, which is OVH huge fault.

name: krikey
review_body: Ordered an Advance-1 dedicated server on April 2024. Had a RAM failure in May, an NVMe failure in October and another NVMe failure in November. Whilst the support team have been quick to respond, and I appreciate that things do go wrong, the amount of hardware failures seems excessive for the period I've had the server. Looking at the specification of the NVMe drives, it looks like they provide consumer grade drives (a "WD PC SN810 SDCQNRY-512G" and a "SAMSUNG MZVL2512HCJQ-00B07" ), not enterprise/server ones as the TBW is relatively low. Beware!

I told them I didn’t even pay by bank; I paid through PayPal. They didn’t have a response and just told me to contact PayPal, then closed the chat.

name: Anonymous
review_header: Freshly purchased a simple web hosting…
review_body: Freshly purchased a simple web hosting plan. 24h after deployment I realize the IP of the server where my one page website was hosted had been blacklisted everywhere. Customer service are simply unable to understand that they should be monitoring server IPs and that they should not deploy server (even shared ones) on these IPs. Not only that, but after going back and forth for 4 days, no one at OVH seemed to want to address the issue. All the agent wanted from me was to jump on a VPS (Virtual Private Server) or a dedicated server. To host a simple HTML form. 1 page. Seriously. The cherry on top was that all web hosting plans force you to buy a free domain (even if you already have one with them...) and after 7 days, I am only offered a partial refund. There dedicated servers may be fine for some folks. But don't trust their cloud offering much less their capabilities at maintaining their IPs. 100% would not recommend. If OVH wants to gain a better reputation, they need to admit their faults, monitor their IPs, and just care even just a little about their customer. And don't tell someone you can't change an IP, or migrate a service/server to a different one. When all you have to do is unrack that stainless steel plate, walk to a different rack and rack it. Then mark the IP as blacklisted, and don't rack any server in that slot until the IP is unlisted. EDIT: The fact that it is a shared service does not justify the blacklisted IP. OVH on shared services should be using multiple IPs to circumvent the potential blacklisting. Same services multiples IP. That way you can easily change the blacklisted IPs while you are trying to resolve the issues. Therefore, your customers would not be experiencing the issues I have been. Maybe OVH should rethink their shared infrastructure. At the end of the day, on day 1 I experienced the issue. How do you think I can perceive OVH's capacity to provide such services. When OVH won't even take the most obvious approach to this issue. OVH needs to maintain their IPs. Finally in regards to the full refund. The Consumer Protection Act protected my client in this particular case. By not making the skip button obvious (putting it in a odd place and with a much different style then any other buttons in the interface to make sure it is not seen) you are forcing consumers into free offers which even if they are personalized item, remain free. Thus you cannot claim a value on the item. OVH was completely off the Consumer Protection Act and that is why OVH finally decided to refund the total paid. Not because it is an exceptional service. Also, the fact that if I want to move a purchase domain, I have to register it a second time, makes it an unpersonalized item. Since I need to repurchase it all over. You are trying to shift the blame here to protect OVH's interest. Instead of acknowledging OVH's faults and trying to find solutions. That is the core problem with OVH. Accountability.

review_header: Avoid This Company – No Service Provided and No Customer Support

I've reached out multiple times via email and phone - each time they say they will get back to me and never hear back. All recent messages have been completely ignored, despite even contacting key managers & execs within the company. This lack of communication and failure to deliver the service is deeply unprofessional, and I feel that I’ve been misled. I've given them ample time to respond and rectify the situation, yet they've failed to do so. I’m now in the process of reporting this issue to Action Fraud and their payment processor. I would advise others to think twice before trusting this company with your money. Save yourself the hassle and choose a company that respects its customers and fulfils its promises.

review_header: No Support for VPS customers, buggy site
review_body: Tried to purchase VPS. Their wizard forced into 2-factor, where both of the 2 options they presented immediately bugged out. Tried the live chat support, but no one answered. Tried calling support phone number, very long automated menu, long wait; again, no answer. Website full of bugs with no support options for new customers, how are these guys still in business? After posting the above review, I received a response with request for more information about my experience from OVHCloud. The response was automated and made no mention of any of my actual issues. I don't get it. Why come to review sites with a bot to send automated messages trying to convince reviewers that they care? They literally cannot even be bothered to read. Let me make this perfectly clear. Do NOT put a live-chat support on your website WITH NO ONE MANNING THE CHAT. Do NOT put a support phone number on your website WITH NO ONE ANSWERING THE PHONE. Do NOT force new customers into 2-factor authorization WHERE NONE OF THE OPTIONS WORK WITHOUT BUGS. Guys, this is simple business. Do not come here to review sites and pretend to care about your customers when you spend zero effort in actually taking care of your new customers nor do you even bother to actually read our reviews! review_header: I ordered a VPS server for a project…
review_body: I ordered a VPS server for a project that I urgently needed. My order was placed under review, and I waited for 14-18 hours. I tried contacting someone via Live Chat, where a ticket was opened to expedite the verification process. However, no one responded to the ticket. After more than two days, my order was canceled with the following reasons: Your personal information is inaccurate or needs to be updated, which goes against Article 2.1 of our General Terms and Conditions of Service, which you agreed to; You need to update the payment methods saved to your customer account; We are currently verifying your account as set out in Article 2.2 of our General Terms and Conditions of Service, which you agreed to. How they came to this conclusion, I have no idea. Perhaps it was because I paid with my friend’s PayPal account? But that’s not all. The funds are now locked in my PayPal account for 29 days as an "Authorization". They rejected the order, but they won’t cancel the PayPal payment authorization. I contacted them again through Live Chat to request that they cancel the PayPal authorization, but instead, they basically treated me with disrespect and closed the chat with the following response: "Unfortunately, this length of time is beyond our control as it is the standard credit card or PayPal process. Once the pre-authorization has expired, the money will be returned to your account. Thank you for understanding." This whole experience has been extremely frustrating and unprofessional. I will never recommend OVHcloud based on how poorly they’ve handled this situation.

review_header: The worst IT Services provider I have ever seen
review_body: The worst IT Services provider I have ever seen. And I'm fullstack developer with devops skils for a 10 year. Register a new account for my client, add my own payment card. Order a domain for a 10 years, and there was a promotion for 1 year cheap VPS. About 170-180$ in tottal. They get money from my payment card. Next day both orders was canceled. About 1 hour I had search for an UI to send a ticket to support. next day had a responce, like "your account info required to be the same as your payment info". your money will be come back after ~3-14 days. ...I make services for a clients, all included, just send them a bills about where and how much I had spend money. oooh. ok. have ask my client, he's agree to add his payment card. 3-d try, 10$ prepay, money send, order cancelled. Payment 10$ with my Paypal-cancelled. Trying to activate "Public Cloud Project" to buy a VPS-cancelled. Support, HELP! send a new ticket. Send my customer ID, my ID, my bank statement, my own email account at OVH(about 4-5 years ago I had use them). Asking them to enable "Public Cloud Project" so I can by a VPS. ...and you know what? I got a responce: "your money came back after ~3-14 days". same as in previos ticket. sick! write a resp, that I know, that my money will came back(and now I'm not sure, because the is a looot about the same trouble all around a world). I know, but, please, activate my "Public Cloud Project", so I try to buy a VPS(it's impossible if the project is in discovery mode as far as I know. And with a those sick UI, I cannot be 100% sure). and the finished line, a support resp: " Regarding the error 906. Unfortunately, I regret to inform you that you are not allowed to create any public cloud project. This decision comes from our Validation department and can not be changed. I can only advise you to use other services (VPS, dedicated servers...) to improve your score and be allowed to create public cloud projects again. " in other words - buy a VPS at the project, that we did not want to activate for you, and make a payment that we will cancelled in a next day. -10 score point. Guys, it's a top of stupidy I ever met at support! PS. "To resolve this issue, please use a payment method that offers all the necessary guarantees in terms of security for the transaction." - IS THIS NOT EHOUGHT ? 1. - my customer: payment card + ID ? 2. - developer: payment card + ID + bank statement ? 3. - developer: Paypal all orders with this payment methods was cancelled. Isn't it obvious that when a person buys a domain for 10 years, they are not playing games with you? review_body: Customer since the beginning (When Oleg answer himself on the OVH Forum). From now on I will stop recommending OVH to my friends and clients. The anti-fraud politics and commercial strategy becomes inhuman. It doesn't matter if you've been a customer for 15 years, they can cut your account at any time. Half of the people I recommended OVH to had their orders refused and their money blocked (on hold) for months. It's sad to see a pioneering hosting company being sabotaged by terrible customer service.

name: John Doe
review_body: Order 17899805 declined for unspecified reasons. All the information was provided. It wasn't enough. The company seemingly is so rich, they don't want new customers. OK then. Trying to add new information to a support ticket: "Dear Customer Your reply could not be added to your support request: CS10150396: Order 17899805 follow up. This ticket was closed 12.09.2024 22:47:57 GMT. Please create a new support request. Thank you for choosing OVHcloud. The OVHcloud team" This is the worst experience I've had with a web hosting company. At least their online chat is swift and there are actual agents willing to help but it looks like they can't do anything. The user dashboard/control panel is extremely slow, works only every other time. You also have to login carefully because they have the login system specific to a region. Had you chosen the wrong region, you'll never be able to login (wrong email or password). That makes zero sense. ----------------------------------------------------------------- Addressing a "reply": > In the case of an order cancelation, this can have several reasons, such as a lack of information on the account or a payment method that does not make the transaction secure, etc. 1. You could use a spell checker, it's "cancellation" in all English dialects. 2. I provided all the required information including my postal address. I did not provide my phone number because not a single support agent told me it was a requirement. And you never asked me to provide the number in any of your emails. 3. How come my debit card is "insecure"? What is this baloney? Continue to destroy your reputation by posting generic replies without addressing your customers' issues. > In order to be able to analyze the eu exchange with our support and the order concerned, I invite you to respond to our request for information. I haven't received any follow-up emails from you. But I have received your prompt cancellation emails from someone "verifying" orders. Must be my non-English name that set them off. So be it. > In addition, in response to this request, can you provide me with your OVHcloud NIC handle in the form abXXX-ovh, or your customer code XXXX-XXXX-XX. Dear LaiM, I've provided TWO order numbers which UNIQUELY identify me. Please look it up. I'm _not_ doing your job. Lastly, your login system is outright BROKEN!!! I cannot login because my IP address is from the UK but I'm a global customer: "Error: Invalid Account ID or password". This has been an issue for months if not years. How your customers are putting up with this amount of negligence, semi-broken very slow user control panel (for instance there's a three year old notification you cannot dismiss) and login system bugginess is beyond me. They must have nerves of steel. -------------------------------------------------- Addressing the second reply: > In general, in order for an order not to be rejected, the customer account and payment method information must be complete and correspond to each other. The second time I ordered, I filled in all the information except my phone number. This was not required. The fact that I did not provide it could not possibly be the reason for the cancellation. If it is, you're losing customers left and right. After my order was declined for "unspecified" reasons, and no, banks have NEVER done this to me, I deleted my personal information and asked the agent to delete my profile as well. You must have a complete log of every order placed with your company. You must be able to see what information my order contained and why exactly it was rejected. We're in public space right now and I have zero desire to reveal my real name, just as you're just some "Liam". Why you insist that I publicly reveal my information is simply outrageous, offensive and concerning. I have yet to receive a single email from you even though you know exactly what my email address is. A few hours ago I filled in a special form on Trustpilot, giving my email address and real name. You must have received them. My email address has never changed. If you want me to place an order a third time, please let me know. Only this time around you will take care of it personally. Also, you must know why my second order was declined. If you never let me know what exactly it was, that's the end of it. No, you're a not a banking organization, you're a hosting provider. And then banking organizations are transparent, unlike you. They have laws and regulations. You seem to have neither, you just wantonly turn orders down.

name: mohsen freelancer
review_header: Horrible Support and Deceptive Plan Descriptions
review_body: Horrible Support and Deceptive Plan Descriptions I absolutely do not recommend purchasing from this company. The plans are not described adequately, and they keep pushing you to upgrade! I initially bought a basic hosting plan. They claimed you could add domains, but when I tried to add one, I was told that the panel had too many domains and that I had to delete some. When I tried to delete them, guess what? They told me I needed to upgrade my plan to delete domains. I contacted support to ask if upgrading would solve all these issues. Let me tell you, their support is incredibly vague and does not explain anything clearly! I upgraded my plan. Now, when I tried to upload my backup files, there’s a size limit of 5MB to 10MB, and extracting large files is not allowed. Compared to other file managers, this one is absolutely terrible (they use net2ftp, and they say you need to talk to an admin to increase the file size limit). When I contacted support again, they said they don’t provide support for this issue unless I upgrade my plan again. Ridiculous. I have never seen a company as greedy and deceptive as this! I’m not asking for special support, just to remove the file size limit, which is something they should do as part of their service. They also refuse to give refunds. Friends, do not buy from them under any circumstances. They charge extra for every feature (features that other sites include in their basic plans). Support name : Rosario T.

They havn't released the 'on hold' payment so I have to wait 2 more weeks for the payment to drop back into my account. I wont ever use or recommend this business again UPDATE FOLLOWING OVH REPLY "We're sorry, but unfortunately, we cannot act on these banking deadlines, which are specific to the different banking organizations." Not true, I work around e-commerce myself. If you have an e-commerce system that notifies the merchant that you have cancelled the order it will release the 'pre authorisation' back to the customer. You choose NOT to do this and leave it hanging untill the bank cancels it.

I hope they improve their payment systems and train their support staff to be more, well, supportive.

name: Mike HHH
review_header: SUPERB VALUE VPS: Provided you READ and grasp what you are getting for your spend. IGNORE the groaning groaners, who think they'll get the world for pennies.
review_body: I've been a professional design engineer working in electronics for well over 50 years - yes 50. And I've been in computing & IT just as long, I've used various cloud and hosting companies down 30+ years: OVHCloud offer THE MOST STARTLINGLY GOOD VALUE SERVICE I HAVE EVER SEEN. Quite Staggeringly, I have a research VPS which I'm using internationally, which costs me the ENORMOUS SUM of £2.16 - yes two pounds sixteen pence sterling.... each month. TOTAL. AND it runs Debian smoothly with a virtual desktop and does all I want of it. All of us who work in cloud, know there are reams of companies out there who can do this - but it's very easy to spend £10/20 a month for one VPS. To be able to rent working servers - with 20GB disc space - for well under £3 -- is a MARVEL -- THANK YOU OVH, I am impressed and I recommend you widely. There are other companies out there that offer marvellous service - but they all have their strengths and particular focusses, there are things they don't do and things they do very well. And there are a few who do nothing well (you know who you are 1and1). So - find who's best for what, by experiment and by looking here. Now I'll break all the Trustpilot rules and give a quick separate shout out to -- UK2.net, the BEST WEBHOST in Britain by a country mile, for your fine service down 25 years, Back to OVH - their plan - unashamedly - is to offer superb pricing, for baseline services, delivered cleanly to people who can self-manage largely. If you need reams of help & support, maybe go to Digital Ocean, but be prepared to pay 4X - 5X as much. Many "grumblers" who write the "1 star" reviews here seem to be non-professionals, who don't grasp what's what (eg a tearful "....but they didn't back up all my data for free..." - when OVH never said they would, you can purchase backup options - pretty plain to my eye ). I shall continue to use you OVH -- very best wishes from the UK.

name: M D
review_header: Incompétence et Service Client Scandaleux/ Incompetence and Scandalous Customer Service
review_body: Français Je suis extrêmement déçu par le service à la clientèle d'OVH Canada. J'ai acheté deux noms de domaine, mais je n'ai reçu aucun courriel de CIRA pour activer l'un d'eux. Leur abonnement inclut un nom de domaine gratuit que je n'ai jamais reçu. Leur équipe, notamment Fernando V., a fait preuve d'un manque de professionnalisme scandaleux en insinuant que j'avais mal passé ma commande. Ils n'ont même pas pris la peine de vérifier correctement les détails de ma commande avant de répondre de manière inutile et désinvolte. Le problème n'est pas le nom de domaine gratuit, mais l'attitude du service client. Fernando V. m'a répondu avec une phrase irrespectueuse : "Vous aurez du regarder la commande avant de payer." Cela fait maintenant trois jours que je n'ai pas accès à mon nom de domaine, ce qui démontre leur incompétence. Ce manque de sérieux me fait perdre un temps précieux pour un montant dérisoire de 9,99 $. Maintenant, je comprends pourquoi cette entreprise a une note aussi lamentable de 2 sur Trustpilot Canada. Leur incompétence et leur attitude nonchalante sont inacceptables. Affaire à suivre, je reviendrai pour dire la suite. Je déconseille fortement de faire affaire avec eux. English: I am extremely disappointed with OVH Canada's customer service. I purchased two domain names but did not receive any email from CIRA to activate one of them. Their subscription includes a free domain name, which I never received. Their team, especially Fernando V., showed scandalous unprofessionalism by insinuating that I had made a mistake with my order. They didn't even bother to properly check the details of my order before responding in a useless and cavalier manner. The issue is not the free domain name but the attitude of the customer service. Fernando V. responded to me with a disrespectful phrase: "You should have checked the order before paying." It has now been three days without access to my domain name, which demonstrates their incompetence. This lack of seriousness is wasting my precious time for a paltry amount of $9.99. Now I understand why this company has such a lousy rating of 2 on Trustpilot Canada. Their incompetence and nonchalant attitude are unacceptable. To be continued, I will update with the follow-up. I strongly advise against doing business with them.

name: deferred_impact
review_header: Locked my account, stole $50 with no explanation
review_body: Horrible. Utterly horrible. EDIT: It's even worse. See further down. A few days ago (Friday i think it was) i ordered a dedicated server from OVHCloud to host my multiplayer game. The server was great! Superb performance and straightforward setup. Cost me $50 ($25 setup and $25 first month). Then Saturday morning i wake up and find out i can't log into OVHCloud, and my game is unplayable as the server is dead. What the hell? OVH offered no explanation (beyond a bunch of generic "your service has been terminated" messages in my email). I had no choice but to create a new account, as i need an account to open a ticket, to complain about this. But of course since it is Saturday, nobody cared. Finally on Monday i got a response on my ticket... "we cannot address your issue as it is related to a different account." What the absolute f... I can't open a ticket on my actual account because you locked it! They suggested i email (abuse at their site dot net) instead. So i did. Thankfully, that helped... no it f...ing didn't. It's been 24 hours since i sent my email and no response! They suggested i call their support number. First of all, why the absolute hell do i need to call when you already have a proper support ticket system? What is the point of a support ticket system then? But fine, i thought, i'll call. And... the number doesn't connect! What is going on with your company? This isn't about the $50. This isn't about the server. This isn't about the time i wasted setting stuff up on your platform. This isn't even about the (so far) 4 days of not having a proper server (thank gods i still have my old server running, so i just pointed the DNS back to it and we could still play the game, albeit with worse performance). No. This is about the attitude. This kind of customer "support" is atrocious and utterly unacceptable. Why completely lock an account? Why give zero explanation for locking it? Why redirect me from your ticketing system towards your email and phone? Why treat me like i'm your enemy, when i'm just trying to pay you money and get a basic level of service in return??? At this point all i care about is getting back my $50. I will never once touch OVHCloud again. EDIT: I just finally tried to call their support phone number, cuz it's apparently "not connected" most of the time and you have to call it during specific hours. So i finally had the opportunity to call. Guess what?! Every single option is "this option is currently not available"! This is ridiculous. Literal scam. EDIT2: and now they are asking me, under this review as you can clearly see, to provide an account ID. That i can only fetch by logging in. When i am literally complaining about them LOCKING MY ACCOUNT to the point that i CANNOT LOG IN. Wow. This level of trolling is honestly impressive. Well done! Why the f... do you need my account ID?? You KNOW MY EMAIL ADDRESS EDIT3: I suspected a security issue was the cause of account termination. That is fine. The issues are: - it has never been explained to me what conditions i breached. I merely hosted my multiplayer game on your server and uploaded my binaries to your S3 buckets as a way to quickly transfer them to the server. How is this against ToS?? - support quality has been atrocious. Terminating a "malicious" account is perfectly fine, but cutting off all communication is unacceptable. What if the termination was not, in fact, correct? What if your automated system misidentified my perfectly valid use of your services as malicious? I still believe i never misused your service, and deserve a refund. *If* you actually contacted me and provided details on which ToS points i violated and how, perhaps i would take back my complaints.

review_header: Extremely Disappointing Service and Support from OVH Clouditle
review_body: I am compelled to share my extremely disappointing experience with OVH Cloud for the second time. As a business owner, my reliance on consistent and reliable server access is crucial. Unfortunately, OVH Cloud has failed me at a critical time, risking my business operations and potential financial loss. Recently, after a server reboot by OVH, I was unable to access my server for remote desktop connections. Log in server had been functioning without issues until this incident . Despite multiple attempts to resolve the issue myself, I was left unable to access my server from 7/7/2024. Adding to my frustration, I reached out to OVH Cloud support immediately, highlighting the urgency due to the impact on my business. However, their response has been unacceptably slow. It's been a significant amount of time, and I have yet to receive a meaningful solution or even an acknowledgment of my issue. This lack of timely support is utterly unacceptable for a service that claims to cater to business needs. The potential financial impact due to this downtime is severe, and OVH Cloud's inability to provide prompt assistance has left me incredibly dissatisfied. As a paying customer, I expected better service and support from OVH Cloud. Their failure to address this issue swiftly and efficiently has resulted in a significant disruption to my business operations. I am deeply disappointed and would not recommend OVH Cloud to anyone relying on stable and responsive server solutions. OVH Cloud, you need to significantly improve your support services and ensure that your customers' issues are addressed promptly, especially when their businesses are at stake.

review_header: Clunky and buggy panel, HORRIBLE customer service.
review_body: Slow Panel. Ordering / sign up process takes you through 10 domains and takes several minutes loading between pages. Contract I was given was in French despite signing up in Australia. Their billing system etc and everything is incredibly buggy. I tried to cancel a service, at the time no invoice was generated, however I was given an error and the service wouldn't cancel properly. I submitted a ticket and then they said cancel through the API, which is insane and clunky. I then tried making a ticket to null the invoice, but they said no as API cancellation was after the invoice was generated and closed the ticket immediately. It took 4 days to get a reply to the second ticket I made. In setup fee and ongoing fees, their dedi's are by no means cheap, but they have horrible service. I used to use OVH for their cheap VPS and the service itself was reliable, but I will completely avoid them now, there is zero point or reason in using OVH.

name: Nectar
review_header: Bad service compared to other providers
review_body: Very poor DDoss protection, the dashboard loads very slow and sometimes takes several seconds to load a single page and the support is bad. For the price OVH charges, compared to other providers, it doesn't deliver any real value. I would suggest anyone to use another provider.

review_body: Très bon service via l'application x Contrairement au service tchat via la page web OVH qui et inutile

name: Michał Wołek
review_header: You cant refund when you dont like the services
review_body: There's no option for a refund. I bought a server with personal plan, then upgraded it to pro to get SSH access to the server, and then when I realized there's no root access, I wanted to refund my services since they were useless to me. There was no option for a refund after not even an hour after buying them. And you have to buy the plan for the whole year, so if you don't like it you lost 1 year worth of money. Support pretends it doesn't see tickets.

name: Jorge Guillen
review_header: This company uses an untrust way to verify accounts
review_body: This company uses an untrusty verification method, asking for sensitive financial information to be sent by email. In today's business environment, we have many solid and simple ways to verify accounts using the principles of Digital ID Verification, so to ask for a credit card to be sent by email is a coarse and primitive way of conducting business. If you're looking for a reliable and trustworthy VPS or similar service, shop around, and you will find a company with transparent business practices that will avoid this archaic business model imposed by OVHcloud. Now, I need a piece of parchment to write the name of this company on!

So, I spent 15 minutes figuring out how to send a support request to explain this inconsistency. The support team responded: "Thank you for your interest in our services. Here are the steps to follow from your client area to upgrade your web hosting plan..." And they did not address the question at all. The issue was marked as "Resolved." The response email provided a link to the ticket... which does not work. Ticket number: CS9736186

name: Rob Lambden
review_body: I run cloud infrastructure and have been looking to use OVH for additional capacity. I spoke to someone in their pre-sales team (in Spain) to clarify capabilities. They advised that I should email and they would ensure that specific questions were answered. I have sent several emails. I got one response at the outset saying that my queries were passed on, but nothing since (for more than 12 months) despite chasing. Note that as reviews must be within 12 months and I have been waiting for more than 12 months now I have put todays date. Update - OVH have responded asking for more information which is good. However they ask for details of the account I have with them, which completely misses the point that this review is regarding the failure to enable me to buy from them as I was unable to discover enough detail about their services to place an order. I have provided contact details to enable them to contact me to follow up.

name: William
review_body: I've used OVH and before then SYS for many years but now I would find it hard to recommend them. There support for billing issues is horrendous as you can't create tickets for pricing issues you have to contact sales not via a ticket and you only get 300 characters to explain your issue instead of using the ticket system like everyone else I would only ever recommend OVH servers if they are on a mega deal unless you are going to sit in contract while people pay lower than you and when you get out of contract they refuse to readjust the price of the server to what they current advertise. There pricing is cheap but it's a slap in the face to have to be paying more than new customers or be paying double than a customer who bought it on a deal. But just to reiterate the breaking point for me was when you refused to readjust my price to the new one after my contract (I was asking to match with the without commitment price just to be clear) I was told to contact sales not through tickets for some stupid reason only to have a ticket created and be answered by the same person who told me to contact sales. The reason this isn't 1 star is I've had no problems with the hardware or networking however the main thing when it comes down to is cost and to pay double what new customers and to be told to reorder my server instead of reducing my prices is unacceptable for a company of this size If you could help it would look elsewhere **Update do not give them credit for asking for more information nothing has been done and I have not been contacted

review_body: Worst Company ever They emptied my server only a few days after my credit card got invalid. Updated: They sent one warning about the server deletion and deleted one day after.

name: ClydeNoIQ - From DarkVibes
review_body: OVHcloud is the best provider for bare metal clouds, offering top-notch DDoS protection. Their services are reliable and powerful, making them an excellent choice for anyone needing secure and high-performing cloud solutions. We've been using their services for our game servers with thousands of players monthly. However, their customer support needs improvement. The response times are slow, which can be frustrating when urgent help is needed. Additionally, you have to pay for higher-level support, which can be a burden, especially for smaller businesses. Enhancing the basic support services would make OVHcloud even better.

name: WBTeam
review_header: RAID issues, No Help after a day. Avoid Avoid
review_body: We had a error in hardware raid created ticket 1day no response. Followed up with more data still no response. We have over 100TB data cannot access because of this. Chat interface, phone call no one to help. No one should use this guys. ==> Their response below says they replied in time. Not true. Got a response after this review was posted (2 days). They replied asking for a question which was already send to them the first day. So all I got was a standard reply with no one reading my ticket content. I replied immediately and so far no answer. They are asking for hard drive serial but as the raid controller is bad I cannot even get to that step. Asked when can they intervene I said anytime as I cannot access any content. This was 14H ago. Still waiting for them to reply. Now 3rd day. We have lost countless customer.

name: A Fakhro
review_body: UPDATE: One week has elapsed. The server is still down. Nothing has been done. The amazing aspect of their billing system is that on the my services page, 'Server' status shows 'Bill to Pay' (which means Due Now). When we click on 'View Service Details', it opens the 'Licences - Windows' page and shows 'Renewal due on 30 Nov 2024'. They actually asked me to pay this amount until I highlighted this internal billing error. After this, OVH has reiterated the fact that there is 'NO' technical issue and it is in fact an internal 'billing error'. These are their own words below: "After further analysis, it seems like it is indeed an internal problem related to the Billing system. Since you are currently communicating with the Cloud technical team and we have very low impact/accesses on the Billing aspect. In that case, it would be better to discuss with the Billing team for that matter." Pay careful attention to their response above. They are trying to portray that the technical team and billing team have no access or communication with each other. I understand that they are separate departments but from the same company. Instead of asking me to deal with the billing department, shouldn't they deal with each other internally and fix the matter? After almost a week, they have the time to send me a response and ask me to deal with their billing team instead of reactivating the server by any and all means possible. Questions: If there is no technical error, why is the server still down? If it is an internal billing error, why can't they rectify it and activate the server? Why is all this takings weeks? Who will compensate the business loss associated with this server outage? Again, I fail to understand one basic concept. Are not the cloud technical team and the billing team from the same company? Can't they coordinate with each other and fix the problem? When you order a dish at a restaurant, they are supposed to serve you the dish; Not inform you about the ingredients and how to prepare the dish. Even there is a problem with the dish, they fix it! Not tell you how they will fix it or ask you to do it yourself! I AM PAYING FOR A SERVICE AND I NEED THE SERVICE TO BE ACTIVE. ABSOLUTE DISASTER AND FAILURE. MY MORNING AND EVENING ROUTINE INCLUDES MESSAGING OVH. GOODBYE DEAR SERVER; "Reposez en paix" ________________________________________________ This is by far the WORST customer service and the WORST technical support. Their support is non-existent. Here are the details of this operation: Server check Date 2024-05-14 11:14:32 BST (UTC +01:00), Server check: Server hardware checked and no issues found. Issue seems to be due to billing robot not updating the server's state. This is the message we received. For two days, the server is still down. They have clearly stated that the server hardware is intact. Issue is clearly caused by their billing robot. Multiple Live Chats and service tickets later, its been over 48 hours. From what I have read here, I am one of the lucky ones. With no technical issue present, why has it taken them this long to reactivate the server, especially when the fault is theirs? Will they reimburse the losses? They also had the audacity to inform me to moderate my attitude. In line with most of the comments in this site regrading OVH's service, I also reiterate the fact that one must Give Respect and Take Respect! If you were in our place, facing losses due to server outage, and sending multiple service requests and conducting live chats without any result, your attitude would be far worse. Put yourself in the customer's shoes. From what we have seen on this site, we are not alone in this mess. It seems like you have tortured enough and more people with your extremely poor service. I already informed my business associates, who I recommended to start using OVH. I sent the transcript of my Live Chat to all 152 associates and convinced them to cancel their subscriptions. They all cursed me for pushing them to change to OVH. A server company, in this modern era of AI, cannot keep giving crap excuses and keep cheating loyal customers. One good thing is that their Billing Robot NEVER has any technical issues when it comes to deducting our charges monthly. I would request your inefficient team to assign this Robot to deal with all their customer issues. It is better than human beings, with robot like attitude and no power or knowledge to resolve any issues.

name: Daniel
review_header: The server is broken, but they deny the evidence.
review_body: I've been a customer for a long time and have significant experience managing servers. I'm not a novice when it comes to dedicated servers. I purchased a new server with an annual contract in November 2023. On December 26, 2023, we experienced a malfunction and subsequently had the server replaced. They provided a spare server, which they claimed had been recently tested. Since then, we've been experiencing frequent system freezes, occurring randomly every 3 to 20 days. We've encountered at least 6 freezes. Each time, the system freezes with the keyboard becoming unresponsive. During this period, my technical team thoroughly analyzed the operating system and the configuration of all installed software. We found no anomalies in the various logs analyzed. Additionally, we updated the kernel to the latest available version. We also hired an expert from outside the company to identify any possible software-level anomalies, but they found no evidence of software problems. Finally, following OVH's suggestion, we performed diagnostic tests on the server hardware using OVH utility in rescue mode. During the last test, the server crashed while diagnosing the CPU. It's important to note that these tests were conducted in rescue mode, confirming that the issue is not software-related. Given the above, we requested that OVH proceed with the repair or replacement of our server with a new unit as soon as possible. However, OVH's response was that there's no evidence of hardware failure. Despite repeated requests for proof of the hardware's condition, they never provided any evidence. Instead, OVH closed my ticket, accusing me of not wanting to deal with such failures and suggesting I switch to their cloud service, which costs three times as much. Furthermore, they closed the ticket in a manner that prevents me from reopening it to continue the discussion. This behavior is unacceptable for customer service. It's more like customer disservice. I would purchase a new server myself to replace the faulty one, but I'm bound by the terms of my annual contract. Before considering OVH's dedicated server service, I urge you to think not once, but ten times. If your server turns out to be faulty, they'll deny responsibility and stop communicating with you altogether. EDIT 07-03-2024 They requested my OVH details that I promptly provided, but nobody contacted me for a solution. UPDATE A server freezes multiple times with black screen and keyboard not responding and they responded that "no problem affect the performance". Performance is not an issue. The issue is that this server get stuck with keyboard not responding and black screen, therefore the off topic reply here is a proof of the poor service that I'm receiving. If they're technician are unable to find the problem it doesn't give them the right to deny the problem. Why should I accept apologize from a company that provide a poor service like that and deny the problem in front of my evidence? As I said I would buy a new server and reinstall from scratch again but I'm linked to an annual contract and I'm forced to keep paying for a broken server unless they propose a real solution like to enable me to transfer the annual contract to a new server What I can say. Stay away. EDIT 04/04/2024 After the bad review and few more complaints they offered me the solution to replace the server, however they moved the old disks to the new server and for me it isn't as replace the whole server. However how everything is working from more then 20 days without problem. I can't give 5 stars but only 3 instead of 1 because you provided me a solution only after have read the bad review and many other complaints on my side.

review_header: OVHcloud: A Disastrous Experience from Start to Finis
review_body: I cannot stress enough how utterly disappointing my experience with OVHcloud has been. From start to finish, their service has been an absolute nightmare, leaving me with nothing but frustration and regret. Let's start with the technical aspect. The virtual server they provided me with was a complete joke. Despite their promises of top-notch performance, the server's capacity fell short of their advertised specifications. It was like buying a sports car only to find out it runs like a beaten-up old jalopy. My team and I struggled to meet even our basic needs on this subpar hardware. But that's just the tip of the iceberg. When I attempted to address these issues with their support team, I was met with nothing but incompetence and indifference. Instead of addressing my concerns, they seemed more interested in passing the buck and shirking responsibility. It's as if they have a handbook on how to avoid providing any real assistance to their customers. And let's not forget their refund policy, or should I say, lack thereof. Despite my clear dissatisfaction and requests for a refund, they flat out refused, hiding behind some obscure company policy that conveniently absolves them of any responsibility. It's clear that OVHcloud cares more about lining their pockets than actually providing value to their customers. In conclusion, if you're looking for a reliable and reputable cloud service provider, look elsewhere. OVHcloud is a prime example of everything that's wrong with the industry – deceptive advertising, abysmal customer service, and a complete disregard for customer satisfaction. Save yourself the headache and steer clear of this dumpster fire of a company.

name: Abdulrehman Sandhu
review_body: I represent a web development company in London, and I purchased a VPS from OVHCloud on 3rd February 2024 because they provided Cpanel Hosting. However, my current hosting company only uses Plesk, and I wanted to migrate to Cpanel. My server was activated on 4th of February 2024, and I successfully migrated to the new server on 10th of February, subsequently closing my Plesk server. Unfortunately, on 11th of February, my server went down unexpectedly, and despite my repeated attempts to contact OVHCloud, I have been unable to reach their technical support team as they only operate during regular business hours, from 9 AM to 5 PM. After two days of persistent follow-up, I finally received an email informing me that my account has been closed for security reasons, resulting in the deletion of all 87 client websites hosted on their platform. Shockingly, they did not provide any prior explanation or warning regarding this drastic action. Although I am fortunate to have backups of the websites, the process of restoring 87 websites is incredibly labor-intensive and time-consuming. Meanwhile, my clients have been understandably frustrated and impatient for the past two days. To compound matters, I have yet to receive any refund from OVHCloud, despite being charged the full hosting fees for the two days of service that I was able to use. This situation has been extremely disruptive to my business operations and has caused significant inconvenience to both myself and my clients. I urge OVHCloud to provide a swift resolution, including a refund for the unused portion of my hosting fees, and to implement better communication practices to avoid similar issues in the future. **In response to your reply:** I run a software house. In the event of any issue with the software, you should have suspended the service and promptly informed me about the problem. I paid £90 for one week of service, and if this issue was not addressed, I request a refund. If necessary, I will escalate this matter to multiple platforms.

name: Maksym
review_header: Not great, but not too bad
review_body: A rather problematic provider in terms of positioning DDoS protection. They clearly allocate to dedicated servers an overselled network. But in any case, the servers are quite stable and the ping is acceptable. Sometimes there are unknown problems with ping and it's 100% on the side of OVH. Support is quite slow. Good documentation, flexible configuration of the dedicated server are obvious pluses for me. But it would be good to finally move to the standard of minimal 1Gbit network at all dedicated servers, as for me in the field of dedicated servers it should happen long time ago! And I would be happy to see 10Gbit servers at an adequate price. The firewall is unfortunately disappointing, namely the limit of 20 rules. This is not enough when you really want to secure a large machine, also in the firewall you can not use port ranges for example (8000-8050). DDoS protection is available, but it works strangely. Frequent throttling of pure traffic during a big attack, and you have to wait for a minute and a half for the connection to resume. Also TCP protection is obviously very weak, my router is often attacked, and 200k-350k TCP connections in a couple of seconds does not embarrass the traffic cleaning system of the OVH. At the moment it is a solid three out of five, because of the problems above, and the lack of a competitor.

name: Alex
review_header: Extremely Disappointed with OVH Support – Urgent Need for Improvement
review_body: I've had several interactions with OVH support over the last year, and frankly, my experience has been deeply disappointing. Here’s a detailed account: 1. Exasperatingly Slow Response on a Basic Inquiry: As my 12-month Pro Web Hosting contract was nearing its end, I reached out to OVH support for some basic pricing information and details about their database services. It took them nearly two weeks to respond, which is unacceptable in any business, especially in the fast-paced tech industry. This delay caused significant inconvenience and frustration. 2. Inadequate and Unhelpful Response to a Critical Technical Issue: A more serious issue occurred when I attempted a DNS record change, and it failed to take effect. Expecting prompt and efficient support, I contacted OVH. After a two-day wait, which is a lifetime in web hosting terms, their response was utterly unhelpful - redirecting me to generic online documentation without addressing my specific problem. This lack of direct support and clarification left me in a bind, with an unresolved issue and a feeling of being completely ignored. The level of support provided by OVH has been dismally poor. When dealing with technical services, delays and ineffective responses can lead to serious business implications. It's alarming that OVH seems to be neglecting this crucial aspect of customer service. I am writing this review to highlight the urgency with which OVH needs to revamp its customer support. While their hosting services might be adequate, their support system is severely lacking and has left me frustrated and disappointed. Improvements in this area are not just necessary; they are critical. to Luigi Thanks Luigi, as you mentioned the ticket for technical may be answer in your hours timeframe , but it s the quality that lacking. And again to day, the answer is a link to your documentation, that my request is out of your support. Thanks Luigi, as you mentioned, technical tickets may be answered within your work hours, but the quality is lacking. And again today, the answer is a link to your documentation, indicating that my request is outside of your support scope. Since joining OVH, I have had my fair share of issues. For example, SSL was not set properly, my WordPress site was pointing to both HTTP and HTTPS files, directory listing was enabled, and I couldn't use a free email account because it went straight to the recipient's junk folder. (I was also unable to add a DNS record.) These are basic things that should work straight out of the box, but they simply don't on OVH. Knowing that I cannot count on OVH support, I will deal with the problems myself as I already did for most issue. The irony is that your support team said they can't check the server config for data protection reasons, but at the same time they're telling me to contact your partner, who would obviously be able to help if I pay them enough.

review_header: Waiting one hour to get through to someone on their SALES line...
review_body: They're clearly not that bothered about selling anything... In my case I'm just trying to get through to someone in Billing (obviously they only give out telephone numbers for their Sales team, who don't pick up anyway...) to discuss my contract. I'd like to cancel as I've encountered too many technical issues at this early stage - my server won't boot in normal mode any more, something to do with OS configuration - and there is little direction on how to solve it. I get that there are different tiers of support and you can't get gold standard support without paying for it, but if you're not a tech whiz like me and you have trouble making sense of complex documentation, you're stuffed. For example, none of their support team has been helpful enough to give me a brief idiot's guide on how to check the logs in rescue mode, or if I decide to reinstall the OS, exactly what configuration I should select so that this problem doesn't reoccur. On the positive side, their live chat agents do respond very quickly. I just don't get how they can leave customers hanging on the sales line for so long - do they not want the business... My impression was this would be very much plug and play, but it's been a disaster so far. I can't believe I've been waiting an hour to talk to a human, this is worse than airlines. Share price doesn't provide too much reassurance either...

name: Tony Gavin
review_header: Take note of the MANY negative reviews
review_body: I'm highly experienced with servers (close to 20 years). I've had some poor experiences with hosts before, but this is FAR & AWAY the worst. After an entire day of myself and our server admin screwing with their utterly useless instructions, we just gave up trying to deploy the VPS we'd purchased from OVHcloud. We were repeatedly provided with instructions that DO NOT provide you with access to purchased services. Additionally, multiple "help" links in support emails lead to 404 error pages. I found support to be unhelpful at best and as useful as a screen door on a submarine at worst. Responses were slow. Questions were overtly stupid. Answers were uninformative and/or outright inaccurate. Their billing system has all the hallmarks of a scam. It is impossible to terminate services via their admin panel, just as it's impossible to delete payment methods or even pause automatic payments from your nominated payment source. This is contrary to what their own support pages state. The "instructions" for account cancellation are a work of complete fiction. Buttons to "pause" or "cancel" are unclickable. I have screenshots. I will be opening a dispute with Visa card tomorrow - no need to wait with this crew. I really don't know if their issue is simple incompetence or outright fraud. Either way, the consequences are the same. Do yourself a favour and stay away from this company. RESPONSE TO OVHCLOUD REPLY As expected, a response that may as well have been from a robot. Take notice of this. It's EXACTLY what you can expect from OVHcloud support; mindless copy/paste responses which fail to address the problem in any way. UPDATE 01 NOVEMBER 2023 Today, my bank issued me with a full refund to my credit card, after I opened a dispute. Once again, beware of this company.

name: Steph Baxter
review_body: The support offered by OVH is without doubt the worst I have ever encountered. I first opened a ticket on 2nd August on behalf of the charity I work for (ClassContact - we help sick children). OVH responded with a long list of documents to fill in. Our director duly sent ALL of these documents and more and we were astonished to receive a simple email on 7th August saying our request had been refused. On phoning the support desk that same day we were told that they could not contact the procedural team who deal with the matter, nor give us their telephone number. We must just "wait a few days for their reply" or contact them via another email. The procedural team subsequently did not reply to this or another email: not even an auto-response. The next day the support ticket was closed, declared as "resolved"! I phoned the "support desk" again, to be told exactly the same story. We must just wait for a response. Here we are a MONTH later still waiting... OVH were super-quick to accept our credentials when it came to taking our money, but then subsequently refuse to allow us access to our own account. Is this even legal? Of course our charity has not the financial resources to challenge this cavalier behaviour by OVH. I detest leaving bad reviews, and do this as a last resort when all else fails. Still hoping for a solution...

name: Asger
review_header: Annoying quotas and slow response times
review_body: I work as a DevOps consultant and have a 5 year+ experience. I was hired to check out OVHcloud, as a client was interested in potentially choosing them as their provider. I can easily tell you, OVHcloud is by far the worst provider I've had the pleasure of working on. The signup process itself is easy enough, but when you're ready to build, you're met with quota after quota, hindering you in deploying even the smallest, cheapest instances. Why are these in place, even after I have filled in payment info. and info. about the company? Not only that, when you write an email to OVHcloud (as that is the only way to increase your quota...), they ask you the exact same questions you answered, last time you asked for an increase, as if they are oblivious to you as a customer. To top that off, their response time is by far the longest in the business. I would love more European cloud providers, as we have to take data sharing seriously, but if OVHcloud is ever going to compete with the big ones, they will need to improve. Here's a hint: Remove annoying quotas and improve your response times. EDIT: OVH Cloud responded after my Trustpilot review and have now allowed me to manage my quotas myself, which is an improvement. You should just set a default quota, so customers are able to try out your services for some time, instead of hindering them completely.

name: Adeev

As of today, July 31st, I still haven't received the refund. My order numbers are 15613280 and 15611397. I am disappointed with their actions and suspect they might be operating dishonestly, offering servers at low prices to deceive customers. When an order is placed, they cancel it and pretend to refund. This behavior is dishonest and amounts to cheating. edit: i haven’t received any request from ovh yet. and also my account got closed 1 month ago when ovh cancelled my order.

name: Corey
review_header: Server Outages blamed on Client/Customer--No Support
review_body: Got the server on 7/8, installed a Windows Server 2019, used our own License Key. During setup we noticed minor network hiccups. We opened a support ticket, got no reply. Fast forward 18 hours, server is online, but will disconnect randomly and be entirely unaccessible unless using a KVM which will boot you out after 5 minutes no matter what. Ran a hardware test on the NIC, which came back with several failures. Opened another ticket, still no response. When we finally got a response, they wanted us to run several Linux commands for our Windows Server 2019 to determine some routes to ensure the NIC was bad. Even with us sending the reports from the machine, including reports from RescueMode, they wanted a specific type of report. So we followed their instruction, they did an intervention and just logged into the server later and uninstalled the Ethernet drivers from the Windows Server. We then got a follow up on the ticket telling us that the server was in WinRescue mode for us to connect and fix it, since we "broke" it. Somehow, without us being able to access the box for over 72 hours while they were "working" on it, it was somehow the clients fault we were unable to connect. BTW, I am a USA customer. They apparently have a different website with different allowed services we are allowed to have, and we get shoddy support.

name: Matt
review_header: I've used OVH for over 10 years - Satisfied
review_body: I've used OVH for over 10 years and had multiple dedicated servers with them. This is an unmanaged service so I receive no technical support. The price/performance ratio is higher than most other providers, it's rare to find better hardware for a cheaper price. Uptime is as close to 100% as you can get, very rarely have I had any hardware faults. If there is a fault, the intervention and repair is very quick. The control panel is mostly good, it can be a bit clunky but it handles a lot of OVH products. I do wish the firewall settings were easier to manage.

name: Mansoor Ali

review_header: Very bad customer support and lack documentation about products

After ordering, an error is written in the tab with IPMI. The level of support is terrible. In the only ticket where they answered - there was no help.
