Finally I had to placed support ticket for another reason, because I hadn't any other contact. They replied I have bad information in my profile, so my order has been cancelled, but my money still holds and I can place new order and make a new payment! I looked on my profile and really, there was an address I've never seen before. Not even in my country. Jalan Jarak in Dover... this is really far behind my imagination. I don't know where this address came from, but I'm 100% sure that I've never used this address. If I wanted to give them a wrong address, I will not give them a right email and phone number. I think that is their attempt to take my money without delivering service. They closed my ticket immediately after their response and they didn't want to discuss it with me, but still refusing to return my money. So, they attract me to credit - didn't gave me. Take my money - didn't delivered service. Refusing to return my money or discuss about it at least. Fraudulent company.

review_body: I am a new customer with OVHCloud, and I had planned to renew my dedicated server eco KS-GAME-2 in advance, which had a permanent 50% discount. name: Shiro
review_header: Literally worst experience i had hosting machines
review_body: I'm hosting machines with them since last year i had 2 machines along the time , 1 expired recently and i canceled it 2 weeks prior expiration date when i received the 12 months contract end notice and vacated it i got the surprise on 1st this month getting invoiced for 80% of the amount i was paying monthly because with them the contract ends on 13th even though they billed me every month on 1st and i literally begged to stop it since it is vacant and generates me nothing anymore for better than 2 weeks now to which i got the lame response you have to pay it and that's it. The machine canceled in question gave me nothing but troubles , was under attack for at least once a month and also freezes from time to time , the IP was blacklisted by a game company for more than 6 months until i had to personally ask the game company to whitelist the IP. Confirmed with the game company that the IP was blacklisted before my acquisition of it to which OVH said they couldn't do anything so that's why i had to contact game company personally , that was done regardless of the months i paid for it for not being able to use it properly. I cancelled my service with OVH USA months ago this year also because my project in USA ended and customer support there was on the spot always , an answer within 1 hour and very attentive and supportive , they gladly ended my contract when i asked them to and understood that i cannot afford to pay something that's not used anymore and within the cancellation term. But OVH Europe they do not give a single damn, i made a ticket 4 days ago and they only answered me today after i literally had to message support on Twitter believe it or not. I did not intend to make a review on the company as my other machine works flawlesly but this today had me outraged by the neglicence those people deal with. Expensive prices for the services they offer really. Customer support is literally non-existent you will get an answer faster on Twitter apparently and i bet on TrustPilot too. What a joke. If you're looking to host machines please look for alternatives you will lose money and time with OVH Europe.

review_body: Very expensive for ... No idea. They operate bare bones service like hetzner (good uptime) yet support is non existent. If you're going to pay more, then you may as well use a service with automation and support, if you want unmanaged (that still uses automation) use another service anyways. OVH cannot seem to scale with me they take days and days to process adding more RAM whereas any other service I used takes 5 minutes. Update: charged 3 times for the upgrade I requested 4 days ago, man it's a vps not a dedicated server otherwise I'd understand

name: Michael
review_body: I run a bare metal server with OVH Australia, and they have been fantastic. I have had some hiccups and there are some areas for them to improve, but honestly they are rock solid and every bit comparable to Vultr and other 2nd tier providers. I believe all of the negative reviews are likely from less technically minded people who have had issues and required hand holding. I haven't had to use their support, so it's possible they aren't that helpful. Pros - Pricing is literally the best by country mile (I did snap up a discounted rate offer) - Performance of the server has been blazing fast, and so far, 100% up time over the 3 months since I signed up - Enterprise grade interface / management portal from a functionality perspective Neutral - Server provisioning took ~4 hours - OS install was a bit clunky as I didn't set up the partitions correctly. The failure wasn't obvious, and required several attempts to enter recovery mode. This however was my fault, so whilst not an optimal UX, can't be blamed on OVH Negatives - Server installation email took a while longer than provisioning, therefore I couldn't find SSH access details. Hunted everywhere and gave up, intending to contact support, but email eventually arrived :) - SSH requests would periodically time out for the first day and the only way I could access the server was through IPMI. It has been rock solid since though, so might have been a DNS issue or something else I did. - Very slow interface / management portal. Takes forever to move from page to page. All in all, if you need a bare metal server, don't want to pay through the teeth and are willing to figure things out for yourself, these guys are worth every penny.

review_body: I've been with OVH for getting on 15 years & you'd think they'd be willing to help a valued customer! Think again, they demanded payment even though my subscription was already valid, I had to overpay to continue my service but was refused a reimbursement, this has happened twice? & for the last 3 months I've had problems receiving emails! Unless this is resolved asap I will have no choice but to part company? (Recent response) Yes, you asked me for more money although my subscription was still valid! You have done it again this year? review_header: What an absolute shambles OVH are
review_body: What an absolute shambles OVH are. NOTHING on their control panel works. It won't let me manage or cancel ANY of my services with them. They're "support" was to have me MANUALLY call their API endpoints - something an end user shouldn't even be aware of or have to do EVER. That's the whole point of the Control Panel. Oh, and eve THAT didn't work. And then, despite being signed in, they asked for ID before they'd remove the services on their side. I will NEVER use OVH services again. Their rating on here speaks volumes. UPDATE: Following OVH reply requesting more info, I submitted requested info. Unfortunately, despite saying they hoped I wouldn't have to go through this again, I did indeed have to go through this again this morning, and they have closed the ticket without resolution, so I've had to raise ANOTHER one explaining the whole thing again. Your 1st-line support staff are awful and really need to learn when they need to escalate before things get out of hand. I'm now in the position of having to report OVH to the ICO for breach of GDPR.

review_header: Awfully complicated to start a VPS..

Never really needed to contact billing support. But at OVH expect billing issues and bugs. Never faced a downtime really as i remember or just a very little downtime. That’s a 2 years experience with OVH.

name: Dionis Ceban
review_header: I am extremely disappointed with OVH's…
review_body: Update 05/18/2023 I am deeply disappointed with OVH's lack of communication and failure to provide the promised refund on 05/11/2023. It has been a week since I was informed about the refund, yet I have received no answers or reimbursement. This level of service is unacceptable. Update 05/08/2023: The list of the IPs page or Services doesn't load, again cannot renew or cancel any service. Update 05/06/2023: I am writing to express my disappointment with the persistent issues I have been facing with the OVH Client Area. Despite repeatedly reporting issues with the scroll function, I have not seen any improvement in its performance. It is particularly frustrating that the scroll function does not work on Safari but I've noticed later it works on Chrome, which creates unnecessary inconvenience. Furthermore, I am disappointed with OVH's refusal to refund my payment for IPs, which amounted to 512 euro. I understand that I did not request a refund for the entire amount, including the dedicated server, but I merely asked for a refund for the payment for IPs, which was declined. This experience has left me feeling undervalued as a customer and dissatisfied with the service. I strongly advise potential customers against using OVH services. Not only does their client area not work reliably, but the services also fail to load properly at times. Due to the faulty client area, I have lost 512 euro, and I believe it is in the best interest of other customers to steer clear of OVH's services. I hope that OVH can take steps to address the issues I have raised, including improving the performance of the client area and addressing customer concerns in a more satisfactory manner. 04/29/2023 I am extremely disappointed with OVH's services. The company has increased its prices in the last half of the year without any improvement in the quality of their services. In fact, the quality of their services has worsened significantly. To make matters worse, their client area is full of bugs. For instance, I was unable to scroll the page or cancel a service. As a result, I was charged for a service that I wanted to cancel but couldn't because of their faulty website. Furthermore, OVH changed the terms and conditions for existing services. There is no support to speak of either. If you submit a support ticket, you'll be lucky to get a response within a week. Overall, I cannot recommend OVH's services to anyone. There are too many issues, and the company does not seem to be making any effort to improve their services or address their customers' concerns.

name: Andrew Hughes
review_header: The Asia Pacific branch of OVHcloud are likely going to sink OVHcloud
review_body: The Asia Pacific branch of OVHcloud are highly likely going to be the cause of the downfall/collapse of OVHcloud. Abysmal customer service, in-ability to manage the workload, deceptive and dismissive business practices, business management that does not continue a trusting rapport with clientele, service staff that couldn't really give a rat's about the customer/client and give rubbish stock standard replies (just watch any reply given here it will be generic, in-sincere and of no real substance). Seriously atrocious management of the whole Asia Pacific branch of OVHcloud ... they will end up sinking this company. We were potentially going to on-board up to 2500 VPS instances (around $1.5M in revenue per year for OVHcloud and as few as 500 so approx $300K per year) yet they couldn't be bothered to keep a rapport with us, could not be contacted except via support staff that really do not care at all and just reply with crap stock standard responses and sound so miserable you could almost feel their lack of enthusiasm for life working for OVHcloud. They sounded soulless and down trodden. Worst experience I've ever encountered!!! EDIT: (Note to OVHcloud) I have NO interest in any solution you provide the damage was done. IONOS have gained our business and anyone reading this I urge to go with IONOS. 24/7 support that are responsive and continue to follow up with you and help you through issues even for those where it's you mis-read or couldn't find how to achieve something. You can call them as well, sometimes a 10 minute wait but you always get through to someone that is knowledgable and resolves your issue. They then have an excellent follow up plan and a dedicated account handler. Also their prices are better than OVHcloud as well. OVHcloud you cannot offer anything to us that will make us bring the business back to you. Again the damage has already been done.

name: Pavel Zavadsky
review_header: They just charged me ~370€ and cancel the orders
review_body: They just charged me ~370€ and cancelled all my orders because they said the payments were not verified? WHAT?? The most interesting thing is that the payment of 2€ for the first small test order they successfully accepted. And when I already started paying for the rest of the large orders, some kind of nightmare began. They succesfully charged my card, but the order failed. I also created a new order and paid from PayPal. Same thing - the money was deducted, but the orders were cancelled. Wrote to support - after 3 days they answered that "sorry, but you have to wait from 14 to 28 days for a refund, because you have a problem with the payment" And what was the problem? The problem was that they thought my zip code 000000 was wrong. BUT there is no zip code system in the United Arab Emirates, which is easy to google and OVH is the first company ever to have a problem with this!!! Outstanding incompetence combined with complete ignorance in the ticket, average response rate of 24 hours at best. At this point it's been a week, but the orders have still not been recovered. In the meantime, money has long since been debited from my card!

name: Xen
review_header: I purchased a server for a year...
review_body: I purchased a server for a year starting in June 2022. Everything worked fine until 2 months ago. I have been experiencing package drops for the last 2 months. The server was advertised as the ideal game server and for an amount of almost 100 euros per month you expect something. The package drops started 2 months ago. But according to OVH, nothing was wrong. They then intervened (4 hours after the agreed time...) and unplugged and plugged in the network cable while they were going to replace the cable. Then they replaced the cable from the wrong server. After that the problems were not solved. Then they went to replace the motherboard. After an hour I received a message that it was completed (while the server has not been offline. Great!). After a few days of fiddling, things remained fairly stable. Until the beginning of this week. Package drops again, lag, no connection, my ping monitors at 2 locations simultaneously found that no pings were received and at that moment all players were kicked and could no longer connect. OVH went to check again, they ran tests for 3 hours, nothing came out of this, and the problems suddenly got much worse. According to OVH, it is not their fault. Fantastic, is it definitely just me? After i have asked them to cancel my contract because i lost lots of community members due the disconnects, they simple say my contract can't be cancelled. After that, the server went down around 3-4 times a day and they now simply disabled the monitoring system so that the server does not create a ticket automatically. Unbelievable. As of today, i'm still bound to the contract. I have now asked them 2x nicely to cancel my contract immediately since they do not deliver what they promised me. I can't, I just have to follow their diagnostic steps for the umpteenth time. No! I don't want this anymore! Finished! I sincerely hope that everyone who is going to purchase a server from them has read this. Support is friendly, but poor. Prices are relatively cheap, but the quality is low. After 3 times of contacts via review sites they still say that they can't cancel the contract because it is a one-year contract. So they can let me pay each month a 100 euro's for a service that has a lot of problems. Unbelievable.

name: Simon
review_body: Like many others, surprised to see so many bad reviews. I have been an OVH customer for the last 20 years (since I was 13), I have always been very happy with their products. Yes it's a big company, and their products are rather cheap, so they have tons of customers. And yes customer service is maybe not the best, they probably struggle a little managing the huge amount of customers they have. But IMO there is nothing wrong with their products, very high availability, and they have not stopped improving for the last 20 years, creating the VPS, adding flexibility, improved the OVH manager, etc. The support usually takes a few days (at least) to answer, but you can pay more if you want more support (like 24/7), which I think is fair. I think a lot of these reviews are poeple who have had one bad experience with them and got very angry. Mistakes happen, it's more about how the company handles the mistake that matters. If you have a big issue I would recommend sending them a message on Facebook, just remember to be nice and polite :) Thank you for reading! Simon

name: Ryuji Kun
review_body: Last month I made an order for their promo VPS for 12 months. But a few days later my account was closed without any explanation, and I tried to open a new account with the same email to get clarity via support ticket. In the ticket they explained that I violated their terms and conditions in the contract, but did not explain what the violation was and how it happened, and they refused to refund my money. If you are trying to find a VPS for the long term, you should stay away from this one hosting company, because your account can be deleted at any time without any explanation and you will not get a refund. Customer service takes a very long time to respond. And of course you will find it very difficult to contact customer service, unlike most hosting providers who make it easy for customer service with live chat or fast ticket responses, you might even have trouble finding their support ticket. Not very user friendly. My worst experience in using a hosting service so far. Edit 13-3-2023 : There is no need for further explanation, the customer service explanation in the ticketing system is very clear, and I don't think it will make any difference if you take care of this matter. Your problem is in the terms and conditions that you have. Every hosting provider has an anti-fraud system, but only OVH has an anti-fraud system that is very sneaky to customers. The anti-fraud system on other hosting may refuse payment if it is detected as suspicious, or make a refund by canceling the transaction, then notifying the customer via email for clarification. But OVH doesn't have this, you just immediately delete the account, don't provide an explanation if the customer doesn't ask for it, and don't give a refund. That's all. After I saw many complaints on Trustpilot, it turns out that I'm not the only one experiencing something like this.

They would say that it's 120 seconds but it will definitely take more than 1 hour and in some cases 1 day, so order accordingly 3. Support is non-existant. So do not expect they would ever help you. The minimum time in which they reply now is like 1 day. 4. Their plans are charged based on bandwidth and they do not have resources in Dedicated servers mainly because they want to advertise their expensive public cloud. Feedback: Guys, don't give pricing like Hetzner, charge more if you want but at least give hardware resources as needed. Most of your servers have 10G NIC attached but you still only give 500Mbps with no option to upgrade it! Moreover, none of your servers have CPUs more than 8c/16t. Additionally, SYS and Kimsufi's Control Panel works great with speed whereas OVH Manager totally sucks, too much delay. I have to process everything from OVH API instead!

name: Xortrox
review_body: Edit: OVH got in contact with me after this review and remedied the situation. It seems to have been a misunderstanding between us and we are now committed to our new server instead of the old server, which we deem as an acceptable solution to our issues. Been a loyal user of Kimsufi, SoYouStart, OVH and OVHCloud in total for over 7 years now. We were migrating to a new production server and only after doing a full migration we realized our old server was still on a commitment period, support was entirely unwilling to transfer this commitment or do anything to remedy the situation, so now we're "bound" to paying for the old unused server for 11 months, or terminate it with a "termination fee" which according to their ToS/agreements is the full outstanding commitment amount. On top of this, it became clear to us that there was actually no evidence of ever entering into this commitment, no emails, no spam emails, no invoices indicating that the agreement ever took place or a contract was signed. Support also tried to provide us with "evidence" of this by sending us generic server installation emails which they told us contained date stamps for the initial server purchase, and then the commitment change. None of the emails contained a single date, label or title indicating anything of what they said. They also kept mentioning the price changes in our invoices from the claimed commitment dates, but this is something we've literally been brushing off as a tax change ever since it happened. On top of this they told us they sent 2 emails on more than one occasion during these chats, and we only ever received the one generic undated email. When pointing this out to the chat representative it was met with "you're choosing to ignore the evidence". Ridiculous.

However, OVH blatantly violated this practice by not only closing user accounts, but also refusing to refund. Their reason for refund is according to their user agreement. I want to say that these are written agreements that can be modified at any time. In the face of consumer rights, can you deceive consumers based on your user agreement? is this normal? review_header: Waste of time in Validation, Worst Support Team.
review_body: I've always been wondering why my client are not willing to use OVH to host servers despite my suggestion and low prices, until this blackfriday I've saw some deals and decided to host few personal startup projects here, drama started instantly. after confusing long steps, tried to add payment method 3 card 6 times... there was error in their gateways none could process the 3D pin, ended up using card under paypal, everything went fine. then they started asking documents which I did provide ID/Bill even copy of the card itself.... kept responding to ping pong emails not realizing how ridiculous it's delaying the whole project and wasting my time. here I'm writing so you don't fall in the same rabbit hole. I've been using the same cards/paypal etc. over the years ordering cloud and dedicated servers withing few minutes from other providers, if you ask my advise, DON'T waste your time, their support and validation is like submitting for a domain name in 1998. order number CS6765573 ---- Update: after this they closed the account which was legit under my company name and domain, and held the money for 14 business days too. I propose a new name for their fraud team : Anti Customers, and hundreds of similar reviews here are the proof for that. Worst support team I've seen in my 11 years of experience.

name: Will P
review_header: VPS is fine but no support at all.
review_body: VPS is fine but no support at all. I have a VPS with them which is fine to certain extent. However I quickly upgraded it as I didnt know the demand I needed. After not getting 1 upgrade go through I tried again which did go through. 3 Days later the 1st upgrade went through. The same spec. So it charged me twice. Sent a Ticket 6 days ago now and had no response. Opened another last night and nothing to that one. Added : Sales people called me despite my account saying I didn't agree to it. Edit: I have had quick Reponses and can only assume the ticket was lost . Refunds were given for the duplicate order. To OVH : I didnt want to give details as Ive heard OVH closes accounts for people that complain but anyway the matter is sorted and I have put 3 stars in for the quick resolution.

name: Chou-Tac Chung
review_header: Very Slow and Inefficient response from support
review_body: I am with OVH for almost 10 years. Things go pretty smooth except 1 thing that is blocking me now. The recurring problem is when my blog's memory reach beyond the 800mo quota. OVH disable the writing mode without telling me in advance. A notification like: "Your memory will reach your quota soon", would be appreciated. Why? Because they suspend the writing mode till I contact them. And they take ages to respond. Meanwhile, I can't even log properly to Wordpress and suppress anything to solve the issue. I have to go through FTP. That's obviously no user friendly to clean up wisely the space. While the support was amazing a few years ago, the service is now horrible. They did unlock my blog, but after a long waiting. Then, I was trying to figure out a solution through restoration or activating plugin to lighten pictures ... that OVH locked the blog again! So I have to recontact them again, and wait for an unknown duration... Once, I solved the issue, but it last a few hours only. I restored my blog just before my last post publication. It went fine. My blog was back to normal. Yeah! So I could write again a new post. My 500mo jumped to 700mo. I was dubious, but I felt relieved since the blog worked. But during the night, it jumped to 830mo again while I was sleeping! Bam, OVH locked the account again. (So I have to recontact them and wait an eternity to get an answer...) I haven't yet figure out the issue on why the memory auto increase..... The thing I feel disappointed and frustrated is how OVH never answer my questions, and take days to give inefficient response. My problem is still unsolved since the 5th November 2022. Almost 3 weeks my blog is paralysed. It is not just a blog but my business. I usually do not give bad reviews of services. A friend told me while they may ignore me at the support, I may get heard by OVH writing here. Cross finger. Thank you for listening. Hoping OVH take this as a feedback to better help their customers.

name: Pablo Lema
review_body: Have you noticed OVH USA gets great reviews, but all other OVH sites get horrible reviews? That's because they have DIFFERENT POLICIES in OVH US that they don't honor on their other sites. And if you are from anywhere but the US, they will FUNNEL YOU, to any site except the US one. The absolute WORST company. They will make it as damn hard as possible for you to leave them. I had to spend hours with support today, I emailed them LAST WEEK that I was having trouble canceling a service on the dashboard. Today it AUTO RENEWED and it was just an endless back and forth to get that cancelled. Downgrading a server with addons is also impossible, they expect you to BUY another server and then they will TRANSFER your credit there, but you have ALREADY PAID for an extra server plus setup costs. The Dashboard sucks, and the dashboard and the support team will tell you different things. I had to send in a PDF of a Dashboard confirmation I got because support told me it didn't work that way, I am still waiting to hear back on that. NEVER, EVER get a commitment with them, it doesn't matter what they promise you. There is no negotiating or paying a few months as a fine to get out, THEY HAVE YOU BY THE BALLS. They make everything difficult on purpose. Like really difficult, like you need to interact with an API to downgrade bandwidth speed. Save yourself the trouble, its a shady, shady company. With a little search you can find CHEAPER and FAR MORE REPUTABLE companies that will not try to iron clad you to themselves. By force.

review_body: 22-05-22 created a ticket for help with cdn service 24-05-22 ticket got assigned by agent "Your request has been transferred to our technical team responsible for WEB services." 30-05-22 ticket got re-assigned "Your request will be sent to the claims department so that an agent can take charge of this case and reply to you as soon as possible." 30-05-22 asked for a refund because it was taking too long for a reply. 30-05-22 my refund right was denied because: You have placed an order for a service, validating during the order that you refuse to apply your right of withdrawal. In addition, you did not wish to continue with the steps proposed by the support. Therefore, there can be no cancellation and refund of your order. To confirm the resolution of your ticket, you can either reply to this email indicating "Accept" in the first line of your response, or by closing the ticket in the control panel. To reject the proposed solution, please either respond to this email indicating "Reject" in the first line of your response, and include additional information, or or continue the exchange in the control panel. name: Sarath
review_header: A company that works to charge us Less
review_body: I was with Digital Ocean for nearly a decade; I never looked for an alternative provider. But recently there was a 20% cost hike on their services. What annoyed me was that they didn’t have the courtesy to inform me in advance; instead I learnt it from the increased bill. This made me look out for alternative options, and to my surprise I realised that there are many good alternatives to DO out there. The OVH caught my attention with its long industry experience and I feel they are the “Second” company Jeff Bezos highlighted in one of his famous quotes. “There are two kinds of companies, those that work to try to charge more and those that work to charge less. We will be the second.” - Jeff Bezos. Now my first VPS is running on OVH for many weeks, and I am more than happy with their service. For your reference, approx. monthly VPS ownership cost for OVH and DO (as on 16th Sep 2022). OVH - $9.78 for 2vCore, 4GB, 80GB NVMe SSD DO - $24 for 2vCore, 4GB, 50GB SSD

name: Hsins
review_header: Making VAT Exemption Difficult by Asking Item not Mentioned in Advance
review_body: That's a really bad experience. I opened a ticket for applying the VAT exemption because I'm a customer not in Europe. The first man deals with this ticket ask for the proof of identity (ID card/passport or driver license) and the proof of address (utility bill or bank statement). After submitted the documents, he pass the ticket to the financial department. Then the second man make me submit the documents again and emphasis that the documents should be in English. That's really unreasonable for asking the ID card should be in English. And the labels title in the bill are marked with English. That's totally enough for recognition. They ask the translations not mentioned in former message or their agreement. I've searched for the experiences for VAT exemption, the translations seems not the mandatory item. That impose the burden on customers outside the Europe. EDIT 2022/09/16: As I mentions: (1) The requirement of translation is not shown on both the ticket message former, the agreement or any guide or rule on your site. (2) It's ridiculous that "translation by the certified institute" is mandatory. I've browsed most of the posts on the Internet (e.g. personal blog/LowEndTalk forum/hostloc forum... etc). The statement you told me seems totally a pack of lies. Refer to one of the posts: "准备水电单，银行账单，话费账单，得带地址，中英文无所谓。你甚至可以用淘宝的交易界面 F12把名字账单改成自己的 拿chrome自带的网页翻译翻译成英文，最后截图。" "Prepare for the utility bills, bank statement or mobile rental bill with address, no matter in Chinese or English. You can even translate your Taobao transaction page with default translation tool of Chrome by pressing F12" EDIT 2022/09/19: Finally, I got the VAT exemption passed. But I don't content with the process. You can just add the mandatory requirements listed on your agreement. Also, unify the standards for all customers.

review_body: Deceptive pricing and incomplete offerings. OVH has repeatedly "accidentally" advertised lower prices than are actually offered, their support is next to useless (6 months to even get an answer beyond "we don't know"!), and not all services they advertise even exist; They will happily sell you DNS service on domains, and then turn around and say providing it is your problem. This used to be an excellent, reasonable-cost hosting company, but you can't trust them to keep their word any more. While other options will likely cost you more initially, they will actually provide support and you'll get what you are sold. An update, weeks later: You'll notice a reply from OVH to this review offering to review this in my existing support ticket; Their response was an empty promise to escalate to their "claims department" and then two weeks of complete and utter silence. Don't use this provider, and don't trust any of their replies here as an indication that they are attempting to improve their services.

name: りしん
review_header: Terrible service, shirking responsibility. Paid for domain renewal but OVH did not deliver the service.
review_body: Terrible service, shirking responsibility. Paid for domain renewal but OVH did not deliver the service. UPDATE: Domain Expires Date: August 7 2022 August 2, automatic renewal triggered, payment completed and invoice generated, and email from OVH telling me that the renewal was successful (but no, it wasn't) On August 7, the domain expired, but there was a 10-day grace period according to the rules. At this point the status is still "ok" On August 12, WHOIS showed it was still "ok", but OVH didn't do anything. On August 17, it expired for more than 10 days and entered the redemption period according to the rules, and the status changed to "pendingDelete|serverHold". At this point, the domain was suddenly stopped resolving without any notice, causing my business to be affected. I submitted a support ticket to OVH, but the technical team incorrectly assumed the cause was the "hold" status of the domain, which is faulty logic that reverses cause and effect. The domain was " hold " because OVH did not deliver the renewal service, not because the " hold " status caused the failure to renew. Also, the "hold" status does not affect OVH's ability to deliver renewals. On August 21, after I provided a photo of my personal ID, the support ticket was closed for no reason. I then reopened the support ticket, but unfortunately the support team still incorrectly believed that the "hold" was the cause of the problem. OVH incorrectly assumes that the cause of the incident is the "hold" status of the domain, pushes the responsibility to an unsupportable reason, and refuses to refund. name: Mees
review_header: What You See Is What You Get
review_body: TL;DR OVHcloud is a typical case of WYSIWYG (What You See Is What You Get). You get the service you paid for, but do not expect any additional features or services. Keep your expectations low when choosing for OVHcloud, and ensure that you have sufficient experience with managing a server, OVHcloud won't help you. If you are looking for a VPS provider more modern and adapted to the newest standards and technologies, seek further. In addition to what I have written above, OVHcloud feels/is outdated. Their dashboard where you can manage your services looks outdated and is terribly slow. In addition to that, OVHcloud's support for IPv6 is very poor, they only give you a /128 per VPS with no way to get more addresses. First of all, the /128 is problematic when you are planning to run mailservers on your VPS with support for IPv6, as spam filters like Spamhaus blacklist whole /64 when an IP in that range sends spam. This means that if someone else within the same /64 block on OVHcloud sends spam, you will be blacklisted in common spam filters as well. Second, if you really only want to give /128's to servers, at least give people the option to get multiple /128's (like how it is possible for IPv4 addresses on OVHcloud). Third, the anti-DDoS feature OVHcloud adverts only applies to IPv4. Your IPv6 traffic is left unprotected, which is awful and misleading. OVHcloud should properly mention that their anti-DDoS feature only applies to IPv4. The same story goes for firewalls, you can only set them for your server's IPv4 address(es), not for your server's IPv6 address. Next, the propagation time of VPS. OVHcloud promises to propagate VPS within 120 seconds. During the time I was renting VPS at OVHcloud I haven't seen my ordered or upgraded VPS propagate within the promised 120 seconds. Instead, the average propagation time was around 30 to 60 minutes. The VPS offered by OVHcloud are fine and I didn't have issues with them. For the price you are paying, I think the price to quality ratio is quite good when it comes to the VPS performance. The bandwidth that comes with your VPS usually is in the range of the guaranteed bandwidth you're paying for and doesn't come with a limit, which is a huge pro compared to other VPS providers. Conclusion: OVHcloud is fine as long as you are fully capable of managing your own server. Do not expect to get any help from their customer support team to avoid getting disappointed. If you are seeking a provider more modern, seek further. If proper IPv6 support is a must for you, OVHcloud isn't the provider you should go with. Do you have a tight budget and do you want to host bandwidth-intensive applications? OVHcloud is the provider you should go with.

name: Kashra Serversysteme
review_header: They once were good, but are not anymore
review_body: I am a customer of OVH for more than 5 years now, so I feel competent to write a review which provides a complete picture regarding being a customer with OVH. I signed up with OVH in 2016 for a simple VPS. It was good, just plain simple, easy to use, fast and low cost (about 4€) with phone support for free. I used it for failover NTP services. Everytime one of my company´s NTP servers needed hardware service, the traffic was routed to this little OVH VPS box and it answered the requests. Now I have a few hundred NTP servers worldwide and upgraded the VPS as well as ordered two additional VPS servers. I noticed OVH did go a long way down since 2016. The service panel was basically untouched since 2016. Features like cloning one VPS image to setup another are not there. You have to manually install everything by starting with one of their few images to choose from. (I did not and used the "rescue" net boot and iSCSI to load my own image to the VPS) After ordering 16 additional "failover" IP addresses from different countries I noticed I could NOT assign them to the VPS. Why? Because they can only be assigned to a server in the same datacenter. They are FAILOVER IPs. The name implies that you can use them to switch the IPs to another server if your server fails. Like server A fails, you switch the failover IPs to server B and don´t need to rush the repair of server A, because all requests are with server B. But you can´t switch these failover IPs to a different server, because the server needs to be in the SAME datacenter to do so. How stupid is that? These failover IPs are geolocated to different countries, but OVH locks them to the datacenter of the VPS you order them for. Like a french VPS gets assigned a failover IP from Germany, but you can not assign the german failover IP to a german OVH server. I can not even tell how stupid that is, because the customer needs to order all servers in the same datacenter to use the failover IPs. If there is no free servers in the datacenter, well too bad for the customer. The next thing I noticed is that I got a lot of emails from OVH. They read Anti-Hack "Attack to IP-Address x.x.x.x" Once the server gets traffic, OVH just blocks the server from getting the traffic by routing the traffic to their "protected network" so the server is no longer "under attack". The problem is, the server is basically offline because the traffic is rerouted away from it to an OVH blackhole network. They write that "legitimate" traffic is not affected, but it is. So, once the server gets NTP traffic, OVH thinks "oh no, an attack, let´s protect the server by blocking the traffic until there is no more traffic". And they keep blocking it until the traffic is very low. The worst thing is: They provide a firewall in the web interface. You can deactivate it if you like, but it is forcefully activated as soon as an "attack" is taking place and you can not disable the firewall until the "attack" is over. Since their phone support is no more in Germany, I wrote several tickets, and they usually took a few days to get to it by sending one reply every day requesting nonsense information like "what is the server used for?" and "is legitimate traffic blocked?" and "which ports are affected?" Once you answered all their questions, they "do some things" so you are not receiving the "anti hack" emails anymore and the firewall triggers less often. But they can not disable the DDOS system, they only can enter some values, according to a response I got. To sum it up: #1 The customer interface is old and has very few features. No custom image to install, no way of cloning a VPS. No options to configure the VPS in any way. You can upgrade it to the next better product, but there is no downgrade path an no options like configure the amount of RAM or CPU cores you want, like there is with 1and1 / IONOS. #2 Their firewall is just dumb. It filters legitimate traffic by routing it to a blackhole once there is some traffic (in my case only 30Mbit/s) #3 Their "failover" IPs can only be assigned to a server in the same datacenter. Even though they are geolocated to different EU countries, they can not be used with OVH servers in theses countries, the servers must be in the same datacenter. #4 The support system is only available by ticket, the international phone support just tells you "write a ticket". The tickets gets answered once every working day, but only by sending out text blocks with nonsense questions, which have already been answered before. #5 The host system hardware is old. They use haswell systems for their VPS (model name: Intel Core Processor (Haswell, no TSX) The processor is a Gen 3 Xeon CPU and was good in 2016. We now have 2022 and Gen 12 Intel CPUs. All I can say is: They were good, but are not any more. There are many others which are way better like Hetzner, IONOS, DigitalOcean.

name: Mark Roberts
review_header: Avoid! The reviews here are accurate.
review_body: I purchased an online exchange account with this company and set up the mailboxes. I then proceeded to use their mail migration tool which is clearly included as a service on their website. This failed with various errors and so I raised a ticket. I was told that support was only offerered by an online guide. This online guide covers no aspects of errors or problems and so cannot be considered 'support'. I pushed further and was told that the tool was working fine. It clearly doesn't. I pushed further and was told they would look into it if I paid for premium support. Outrageous to supply a tool that doesnt work and to then try and charge for supporting it. They also refuse a refund as I have now taken my business elsewhere - and incidentally, the mail migration process worked fine with the new company. I have lodged a chargeback as the only way of getting my money back and reported this company to UK Trading Standards as the practices here are borderline scams.

name: Jean F
review_header: Support needs improvement, same with quality.
review_body: I recently ordered a KS-14 dedicated server to realise after payment, that additional IPs are unable to be purchased which was the whole point of the dedicated server in the first place. Furthermore, I had opened a ticket to request additional IPs as I wasn't aware at the time that I wasn't able to order additional IPs for Kimsufi servers ordered from OVH or Kimsufi, simply didn't know about it. Their support team replied with useless answers stating I can order via the API when I can't, their team was clueless about my issue which took about 2 weeks to fully resolve. After that, they replied stating that I can't order additional IPs for my Kimsufi server which I hadn't known about as stated above & it wasn't all that visible on their eco page. Apart from that, I had noticed that the drives were also failing right after I opened the ticket. With that out of the way, I wanted a refund so I replied to ticket countless times stating that for about a week with no answer, I then contacted them on Facebook where Max R. replied & helped me out within a great response time (About 2 days) which was very easing considering I've been basically talking to myself inside my ticket. Today my refund was processed all because of Max, once again - if you see this, thank you 💓.

name: Alex
review_body: Have had servers with OVH for many years, support is basically non-existent which is fine if you can manage things yourself. However recently I needed to upgrade multiple cPanel licenses purchased through OVH. Their upgrade function doesn't work on their website at all for a license, the delete license function doesn't work (To remove & add a new one), I contacted support with a request which took literally over 1 month for a reply. The reply was providing API information to run an upgrade. Which also didn't work. Then after a long wait of a few weeks, I was told to delete the license & re-add. Unfortunately the delete function failed with no reason. Now replied to my ticket and expecting another review. On one of my accounts I requested a review into compensation for lost customers & affected customers due to inability to upgrade/expand my license (And being capped at the limit at the time). Rejected as the license was functional (Albeit, only to the limit of 100 accounts). I wouldn't care about compensation if I could upgrade a license without waiting 30 days.

name: AL Sol
review_header: Delivery times and "support" are a joke
review_body: The support and delivery times are mind-blowingly awful. So is the communication related to that. We've ordered several servers in Frankfurt with a delivery time of 72h. After about a week of ordering, we still didn't receive any server or communication from OVH so we decided to reach out. After going back and forth and begging for an ETA, we received the following response: "The server might be ready at the end of the month." (while we're only 12 days in the month). Nothing else. I understand that there's a global hardware shortage and that certain parts are difficult to get. What I don't understand is why their website claims delivery times that are flat-out lies. We were planning on doing a mass migration to OVH from a previous provider but the experience has been dreadful so far. I'm not sure if we can rely on OVH for our growth. EDIT: I have provided you with my details and I'm looking forward to an update as to how something like this can happen.

name: Robert Spragg for Yellowstone
review_body: We have been using OVH for a number of years. The big hosting companies all have their flaws, but we always considered OVH to be one of the better ones. Yes, the tech support leaves a lot to be desired - almost always either a linux kernel breaks or a hard drive fails. Hard drive failures are handled very swiftly - but we still need to hire a linux engineer to fix the software side of things and get the server back up and running after any of these events. The positives of dealing with OVH have, up until recently, outweighed the negatives....until the time came when we went to cancel two of our services. After suffering kernel corruptions (requiring us to keep booting from a network kernel instead) late last year, we decided to commence a round of replacements for two of our servers, out of the 15 or more services with OVH. The two boxes in question were taken out in December 2019 and January 2020, so we were well out of the original one year contract (or so we thought !). Three new servers were initiated in January 2022 in order to migrate the websites from the two troublesome boxes. The process of moving the data had been quite slow due to staff absences due to covid, and other issues we were facing with the out-of-date versions of linux on both the new and old servers. We were all geared up to cancel the two old servers by the beginning of April, one week ahead of the monthly renewal cycle...except we couldn't find the cancellation option. It turns out that sometime between our previous batch of servers being taken out in 2017 and the next round in 2019, OVH have changed their auto-renewal policy. After the initial one year commitment, all of our services always dropped down to monthly commitment automatically, but it seems that now they autorenew for either one or two years (whatever your initial contact is). We did not know anything about the change in procedure. This behaviour is diabolical and now means we are expected to pay for two unused servers for 6 and 9 months respectively, even though we have replaced them with THREE further dedicated servers. I have complained and moaned and got absolutely nowhere. The initial support ticket was opened 9 days before the usual monthly renewal...by 2 days to renewal we hadn't even had a response. Only a phonecall to them kicked the whole process into life. We do not wish to move away from OVH at the moment, but I am quite prepared to wait until both servers have expired in order to get a final and quantifiable monetary value that we have overspent with them, in order to issue court proceedings to get this money back at a later date ! Beware everybody and make sure you change the settings of each and every server you take out with them in order not to be trapped like we were !

name: xSunLighTx3
review_body: I'm hosting on OVH cloud for several months now and currently I have a plesk hosting for my web projects. The uptime of my server is 100% without any downtimes and the performance is pretty good and consistently, even for a cloud server. The plesk license package is pretty cheap and recommended from my side. OVH servers itself are not the cheapest on the market but the quality is very high. You can easily upgrade resources (cpu, ram, ssd) in your ovh customer center whenever you want. The support also helped me when I had problems but it takes 2-3 days for a reply (standard customer support). I know hoster who replies after 10 minutes consistently. OVH could maybe improve that. One of my website got a DDoS attack and OVH has immedately mitigrated the DDoS to secure my hosting. Even single DoS attacks will be blocked by OVH. If you running a reverse proxy such as cloudflare, you have to care yourself about DDoS. Overall I'm very happy and I will buy further OVH services soon.

Plesk refers to OVH is responsible for support as a reseller. OVH "I'm afraid this come outside of scope of support as we only distribute plesk." Now it been a weeek since last reply from OVH, and I'm pretty clear we going to take our business elsewhere.

name: OutOfSpace
review_body: I guess lot's of people here with bad reviews are just expecting something that OVH is not able to provide (yet). OVH was (and due to their 'poor' support, still is) for people who know how to run their own sites/systems/servers. If you don't know how to operate one of those (in depth); just stay away and choose another party, because once you need support you probably going to be dissatisfied. For those that DO know how to run their own stuff, OVH is a solid place to be. And yes, their support service definitely has lots of room for improvement, but my experience (for over 8 years now) is that they always fix the things - which are completely out of my hands - in a reasonable time frame. Also don't forget OVH is one of the largest cloud providers in Europe (if not THE largest) and tall trees just catch much wind. To put it in perspective: There are over 18 million sites hosted on OVH and about 1000 'bad' reviews here on Trustpilot; you do the math.

name: Modestas Baranauskas
review_header: Servers are good (not DDoS protection), support is non existent
review_body: Servers are good. Yet support is basically non-existent. DDoS protection is far from advertised. All good until you face a bigger attack which OVH isn't able to deal with. Then you are left alone to deal with it yourself. Servers getting attacked daily, OVH protection detects attack yet it still goes through that protection and drops legitimate traffic. I opened ticket, sent wireshark captures during the attack, explained everything else I knew with few messages. Next day I get an answer that I didn't send some of the necessary info (while I sent it in couple separate messages). It honestly seems like its just some bot answering the tickets who can read only the last message... Anyways, I answered 30min after I get answer on the ticket (with all information in one message), and no more answer in 2 days. I don't know if they are working on it, I don't know if they even seen my message, nothing. I believe if server is getting attacked hourly - it should trigger some priority to take a look at it. But nah, I guess I am just "too small" of a customer they would actually care about.. So 3 days later they reply that there is no solution if attacks are coming from OVH network. And all I can do is to report IPs from attack for abuse team. Would be hell of a solution if there weren't 500 IPs~ spamming over 40000 packets in seconds. So basically, you buying a dedicated server from game gamma (with, advertised DDoS protections specially adapted for games) then you also need remote DDoS protection from somewhere else (which cost additionally of course). So maybe its worth to think about less expensive alternatives with "worse" protection before falling into OVH

name: Sinem Dokmeci
review_body: Stood up a new VPS with this company based on turn up time, not prior reviews for a small local pool company. Within 10 minutes of the server being active, I begin to receive notices that the box has been compromised. At this point, we've yet to even log into it. So, the password provided and created by OVH was compromised. We reset the instance, reinstalled, and we set a 32 character password: Within 10 minutes - here we go again with the box being compromised. After hours and hours of going through server logs and working with their less than helpfull support, I found nothing. Nothing at all. No Malware, No RootKit, No Virus, No access logs, nothing. Nothing at all. This goes on for months and months. Finally had enough when they began to shut the server off on their own. When I complained about that, they started adding random firewall rules to block traffic, and then blames us. Finally fed up, and threatened to take it to social media - they send us a disconnect notice. Had issues with OVH since day .5 So happy to have left them and went with a real company based in the USA and not offshore. Update: Despite the company’s reply below, I am unable to provide them with the information that they need. Once the review was posted on trust pilot, my account has been locked. Even though I’m paid up until the end of the month. If I could post a picture, I would

name: Roman
review_header: The server does not work very often
review_body: The server does not work very often! This is the most terrible company. Today, the server was not working again again. We are a startup and I am losing profit. Now we will must to pay money for moving and configuring from another server I really don't recommend ovh cloud - these are the worst servers. They make losses. ___________ Responses to tickets: 1) ticket 176540. 10/01/2022 11:32 I created a ticket and was answered. "From: OVH Support Hello, We thank you for your patience as we worked on and looked into this issue. This outage occurred because there was equipment in Newark that was planned to be upgraded/replaced on 11th of January at 00:00 AM EST. Some modifications to the routing had been done in preparation for the upgrade. An Internet Service provider was doing a planned maintenance, when traffic failed to go one way (due to the maintenance) it went another route, that route was Newark NJ, which failed and thus caused an outage. During this maintenance, the link from Paris to Washington had to be taken down. Traffic destined for this link was re-routed through London to Newark. This routing issue prevented it from going any further than Newark. Since then everything has been restored and we are working to make sure something like this does not happen again for you. If you have any other questions, please feel free to contact us via support ticket or chat. Thank you for choosing OVHcloud. Best regards, — Zaiem A. Customer Support Advocate" 2) ticket 181776. 02/02/2022 09:08 The same thing happened the second time. I created a ticket and was answered. "From: OVH Support Hello, Regarding the connections issues you reported this morning, I wanted to report that our NetOps team found this issue and was able to resolve it. It seems there was some port flapping after traffic was rerouted during a scheduled maintenance. Rest assured our teams are doing everything they can to prevent this from happening again in the future. If you find any lingering issues please feel free to reach back out. Below is the Status link for reference: Thanks, Sean OVH cloud Support" ____ Added 9.02.2022 They promised that they would do everything possible so that the problem would not happen again. Given a bonus!

name: Jonathan
review_body: Don't buy from this self-proclaimed one of the best cloud service providers in Europe, I bought a dedicated server the other day, and a few hours after paying, I've been denied login. I reached out to their official service Twitter, again with no response. In this digital age, there is no human customer service chat window that can respond instantly. The more ridiculous logic is that automatic reply asked me to log in to the exclusive panel to initiate a ticket. Excuse me, if I can log in to the panel, do I still need to file a complaint? I've lost £96 so far with no response. My ID is: yz6934-ovh, there is no exaggeration above, just a warning to other people.

name: Nicolaj Madsen
review_header: It is a NO from me.
review_body: I ordered a pretty big server from them on a commitment-- The order itself included several additional upgrades to ram and IPv4s. The commitment period was 2 years. After about 10 months, the company I was using the server for went bankrupt, and so I write in to OVHCloud to review my options for the server- I needed to reduce the cost of it, or if possible at all then cancel it despite the commitment period. Unfortunately for me, OVH doesn't want to remove the unused additional Ram or IPv4s, so now I am stuck with an overpriced machine that has unnecessary upgrades. What pisses me off the most, is that they've since my purchase gone ahead and completely removed the Product I purchased-- And instead moved it to a different category at a much lower price than originally. I requested the difference as a discount, given that they are obviously ripping me off, and yet again despite my financial trouble, my company going bankrupt and past loyalty, OVH still refuses to provide me with any type of help or discount. Their "Support Team" also has to be one of the smallest teams I've seen- On average it takes them 6+ days to answer, and their answer is always the same "Sorry you can't have X, our rules are Y but we can offer Z" without any concern for what you've just actually said, and the "offer Z" often being an affront. In my case, they offered me to pay the full commitment immediately (With no discount naturally) to receive some "loyalty" bonuses-- Which I find to be a joke when I'm writing in to ask them to *lessen* the monthly burden, not dump it all into one. I can't help but to feel like every other reputable alternative server provider, with almost no exceptions, could provide a better, more all-rounded and cheaper experience than OVH could. TLDR: * Had a 2 year commitment, needed a discount (since the cpu has gotten cheaper on OVH) or to remove all upgrades on my server, only for OVH to refuse after leaving me waiting for days * OVH doesn't have a support team, expect to be left on "read" for 6+ days. * OVH will likely refuse to help you in any way, shape or form and offer a computer/bot sounding reply every time after waiting 6+ days. * OVH will charge you more than their competitors for the same product with worse service. * I suggest Hetzner as an European alternative to OVH, and practically any other provider as a global alternative. At the end of the day, I'm not that much against how OVH handles things, and just a few months ago I may have given them four stars, but to refuse removing "Upgrades", to refuse to apply a discount to a loyal customer when all NEW customers receive it and to then ignore my plea for help and insult me with an offer that is the exact opposite of what I need? Never again making a purchase from OVH.

name: Mr. Peterson
review_header: Stay away! Full of spammers taking 💩
review_body: If i could give you one star i would. This is the worst provider that I've been working with. I understand there's no support, i get that but when it comes down maintain your network and hardware, please do it. I have empty server just sitting there for months, they had ddos attack few days in a row, i logged in my server and apparently someone is using my IP to reroute spam emails.??? I don't have a single website hosted, it's empty server. I opened support ticket with explanation and as a usual it takes them days to respond with generic messages, probably copied and pasted with answer that, "this issue its out of our support scope". How is it out of your support scope? It's your network, you should keep your IP clean and not being blocked and blacklisted and have server full with spammers. On the top of that i signed up for 2 years, since they had tempting deal, but now they telling me i can't break the commitment and cancel the server. Who does that? It's a hosting, you don't pay, it's canceled. I guess ovh isn't good for businesses, instead it's good spammers to take a crap on their servers. Stay away from them!

They then terminated the instance without warning and claimed it was our fault. Tl;dr OVH can't recognise clean traffic and will terminate your account

name: Dan
review_header: 2 new servers paid but not delivered
review_body: Ordered 2 new servers yesterday morning. It's paid and taken from my bank account but no confirmation and 1.5 days later and still no servers... Called the helpdesk, where I had to wait around 20 minutes before someone came up and said: there's no solution at the moment. 'Just' wait until Monday, and if there's not chance, then I can put it forward to the data center. The other option is to call the sales department, which I did directly. But when pressing through the menu, after the final option I got a message: Sorry but this option is not available at the moment and the connection was stopped... How on earth is this called a service? Someone at a helpdesk is not able to help, the sales department is closed at Friday at 14:00h and the instruction is just to wait. They already have the money for the service but the service itself is not delivered. If I need to wait until Monday I lost 5 days where I paid for plus valuable time to work on the transition for the servers.... Edit 17-1-2021: Wouldn't it be right to put that explicit on the website when people change the configuration of the server, the delivery time will be longer? 'Delivered as soon as possible'. I've been told it can take as much time that the expectation and HOPE is that it will be there at the beginning of next week. That makes almost waiting 2 weeks on these 2 servers. I still don't call this as a service and far from helping your customers quickly. Because of this situation we now have to look at other providers such as Contabo.com as we need the servers this week. We might move away completely from OVH if they succeed to deliver quickly...

review_header: Satisfied but should be less expensive
review_body: Overall, I am satisfied with the service but I feel their prices should be lower compared to other providers. Not everyone can afford this type of hosting...

name: jinit
review_body: 30 Nov 2021 14:04:14 – original order. I received the authCode from customersupport-ovh.co.uk on 30/11/2021 14:02 which was applied straightaway. Order was then cancelled as OVH failed to take/accept payment of £0.00 for the transfer. 06 Dec 2021 – 2nd order Received the authCode from customersupport-ovh.co.uk on 06/12/2021 00:06 which again was applied straightaway. But again the same error where OVH would not accept the £0.00 transfer payment. After which the ticket support were opened up. However, now the TAG had been changed from 123-REG to OVH-fr at some point after 6th December 2021. After repeated attempts to sort this matter out, it was clear that OVH had no clue what they were saying. As OVH kept on saying to look out for a new authCode, but I fail to understand why I would be needing a new authCode when the domain is already with the OVH-fr TAG. I was trying to move my domain to OVH. After getting in contact with Nominet, it was clear the domain was with OVH-fr, as this was the TAG on it. So OVH had completed the transfer but were keeping the domain away from my account. The only way to take control over my own domain was to pay Nominet £12.00 fee to get the domain released away from OVH. So please explain how you still believe that it’s not OVHcloud at fault from your ‘thorough verification’? SINCE OVH HAVE STOPPED REPLYING TO ME - 16 DAYS SINCE LAST CONTACT. TICKET 3456559 --- UPDATE 31/01/2022 - after a month, they finally replied the following: 'Thank you for your patience. Your request has been taken care of. After having analyzed your request your claim concerns the operation paid on the registry Nominet. Therefore, we are not in a position to respond favorably to your request for compensation, we will not cover the indicated fee.' Be very careful if you use this company, they will take your domain from you and keep it in their control, to which you'll have to pay £12 fee to Nominet to get it released from this horrible company.

name: Customer
review_body: They deactivated my account as soon as I signed up for no apparent reason. It's been over a week since I submitted my verification documents and I've yet to receive a single response or update. I messaged them on Twitter to ask how long the ticket processing times are and they haven't replied to that either. I can understand that ticket queues might be long sometimes, but keeping customers (or would-be customers) completely in the dark for over a week is completely unacceptable. At least give us a best guess estimate, is it going to take an hour, a day, a week or a month?

name: Consumer
review_body: Absolute fraud!!! I have paid for a domain. Informed afterwards on the additional time required to process the order. As a result I've failed to get neither domain nor money.

name: Harry
review_body: I started using OVH at the end of August due to their reputation. I liked the look of their website and their panel was generally user-friendly, which was great for me, because this would be my first time owning a dedicated server. The server specifications were as advertised (kind of - I was meant to have "1Gbps bandwidth", which was later discovered to be "at least 500Mbps", and quite often we weren't even getting that - but regardless, the machine itself was very capable), and the server was delivered in a few minutes, which was great. Monitoring was fantastic, and the on-site technicians fixed problems we sometimes didn't even know existed. Our server was located in the Canada BHS7 datacenter, as that was the location best for us at the time. This is where the issues began. Our datacenter choices immediately became a problem. Presumably, this specific datacenter had an issue with connection consistency, meaning that latency was all over the place. I was able to replicate this near the end of December by purchasing a second, less powerful dedicated server in the same location, and getting the exact same results. This meant we had spent 3 months (pretty much our entire time with OVH) attempting to optimise our programming only to discover that it wasn't even our fault. Bandwidth speeds, as mentioned earlier, randomly dropped catastrophically due to this issue. I requested a refund through their ticket system for the second server I had purchased a few hours after finding the issue (22nd Dec). Eight days later (30th Dec), I had to create a second ticket as they had responded that they'd "get back to me" (sent on 28th Dec) and I had heard nothing since - the ticket had even been marked as closed. Around two weeks after my initial purchase, I finally got a "useful" response. The refund request was denied. Will you have the same experience? I can only speak on what I've had to deal with, but if you're purchasing a server for something important, I wouldn't test your luck. Needless to say I've moved away. For reference, the machines I purchased were the "Game-2" (the main machine) and the "Game-1-LE" (the machine I purchased to test my initial theory).

name: Chris
review_header: Servers may be good, but customer service stinks
review_body: I ordered a server with them on the 4th of December, it was advertised as 72 hour setup. It's now the 18th of Jan and still no server. Even worse they are completely blanking my tickets asking for information on what is going on. I've been waiting for a response to one ticket for 26 days (I got a generic response 19 days ago saying they would be back to me shortly with more information, and nothing since, and another one when Maxime wrote a reply here, with basically an identical "we'll get back to you" 6 days ago and nothing since, I don't consider that an answer). Waiting 45+ days for a server advertised as 72 hour setup is bad enough, but the absolutely unprofessional practice of not bothering to reply to support tickets with any details on what the hell is going on is by far the worst part. I have absolutely no idea if they are out of stock, waiting to see if servers become available, or if they have no intention of ever providing a server, all I do know is they have been holding on to my payment for the last 45 days. It's a real shame. I've been a customer for 10 years, but haven't had a server with them for many years. I was actually pretty excited to have a server with them again, but they clearly just don't care about their customers.

I am cPanel NOC partner since 2011 and running business since 2008 as hosting provider. But they don't care your losses and business. I have all email conversations, If anybody want i can provide full logs, They just suspended both servers just within less then 12 hours after report. review_body: The Worst Customer Support Ever BEWARE!!. I basically took the time an effort to set up and configure a VPS server with these guys. I upgraded several times and then needed to downgrade. I would NOT RECOMMEND this service for the following reasons: 1)They NEVER respond to open tickets. 2)They cannot be reached via the phone, when you call you are greeted by an AUTOMATED AGENT that just tells you to open a ticket. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!! **UPDATE:*** Despite the company reply below and my following their instructions to send them my account details, the matter is still yet to be resolved!!! The ticket hasn't even been acknowledged!! Thus my advice still stands: Avoid this company unless you want to be very disappointed!!

name: Drawrgon
review_header: Decent if you don't need support
review_body: First up, I've been with OVH, SYS and Kimsufi for over a decade. The support got worse every year, the offers more and more uninteresting. While they had incredible offers for several years (prob around 2011-2013), things just got more expensive and restricted. During above mentioned period, even the cheapest (4 EUR) servers at Kimsufi had a gbit connection. They're down to 100 mbit/s for years now. Support (at least in Germany, but I doubt it's better anywhere except France) is pretty much helpless and can't do much without forwarding stuff to their French colleagues. Different answers from different hotliners to the same question don't help much. Their abuse department is non-existent from my experience, even scans and attacks from within their own network are left alone. The most positive is the massive worldwide network they run, which probably failed a total of less than 30 minutes in the past decade over multiple servers. OVH IP ranges may be on blocklists of other providers, so you have to get your IP removed from their lists if you encounter issues, i.e. when sending mail. Additional IPs are cheap and can be picked geolocated in many EU countries. If the servers run, they run. No issues with traffic or hardware yet. All of their plans are unlimited bandwidth and they don't care if you saturate your connection 24/7.

name: Sarah Wesley
review_header: HORRIBLE customer service. Impossible to cancel
review_body: Impossible to log in my account. I reset password, used my 2-FA app, used emergency recovery code, impossible to login. Customer service never answers. How convenient so i cant cancel my plan. It's the second time you're doing this. It's roberry.

name: Wilberforce

Unfortunately, I could not upload the said script to my root folder because maximum file upload is 9MB. What's worse, they failed to do a refund even after telling their support to deduct domain cost from the fee I paid and send whatever is left. Now I decided to convert the hosting to a WordPress host site. Their so called 1 click module has so far taken up to 6 hours. I can't access the WordPress folders and url is blank. I can't delete the installation as well because it says my installation is still underway. YOU ARE BETTER OFF MISPLACING YOUR MONEY THAN BUYING AN OVH SERVICES. Update: I have requested to a certain Penelope that she should deactivate my account and remove my credit card as users are not authorised to remove their cards at will on the OVH dashboard. I have counted my losses and moving on. OVH cloud is the worst there is and must be avoided at all cost.

review_body: Customer service is absolutely terrible. So, I bought a Rise dedicated server and wanted to downgrade to a regular VPS. I submitted a ticket, and they responded in less than a day. review_body: I seriously don't know why there are so many bad reviews. I founded a crypto startup and we've used OVHCloud for all our infrastructure and it's been totally resilient. And affordable too!

name: Danielle P
review_header: Not even 1* - Appalling& worst customer service
review_body: Appalling company and worst customer service ever. I bought a domain with them and for no reasons suddenly I cannot login anymore, with the same details that I have used before. I have asked to reset my password and am still waiting for an email. That was hours ago. Emails to their support are now rejected. Their only outrageous solution in the rejection email is to send ID and other private information to an address who could be anything.This is outrageous and highly suspicious. All I wanted to do was login and do some admin but I cannot talk to anyone, exchange emails with anyone and have absolutely no trust in them. I am glad this happened before I set up the website, email address etc. because frankly that probably saved me from tons of issues. I will cancel my account and I imagine I'll have to do this by post, as there are no away to contact them. To OVH don't bother sending me another generic email saying you aim to provide the best level of support. It's simply insulting when we cannot contact you.

review_header: If only I could vote 0 stars
review_body: if I could vote 0 stars, I would. I mistakenly bought a domain from them, and found out I could get better elsewhere. Absolutely zero customer support, i wasn't able to speak to a human voice when I tried to ring. Their chatbot service is appalling. And to cancel my domain, they wouldn't give me a refund, they asked for my photo ID which i reluctantly gave, and then asked me for info on my company, which I don't have as it's a design portfolio site. I have no information of when will my site be available again. It's like they are not even trying. name: David
review_body: Don't get fooled by how "big and legit" they seem. Their services are horrible. Their "control panel" if you can even call it that, is by far the least intuitive management system I have ever used. Their auto renewal for domains is broken so many times they don't renew and your domain gets suspended without warning (no invoice is even created so there's no way to know unless you log in and check manually). Sometimes when buying a domain, you receive an email with a confirmation of success but the domain never actually gets registered but no error messages are sent out. The worst thing is their support. No matter what my inquiry has been, their responses have been anything but on point and mostly rude and ignorant. Sometimes they choose to not even respond. I have one ticket that never gets a response while others do so it's clearly a matter of what they want to respond to and not. I've been using their services a couple of years and i've hated every minute of it. The only reason I stayed was because they had a few services that others didn't and the fact that transferring domains to someone else is costly.. If I knew beforehand how horribly bad my domains and myself would be treated by a company, I would have never signed up. Don't do the same mistake I did. Find someone else. Their sometimes cheaper domain prices are not worth the trouble. Edit: "Thank you" for taking the time and writing a standard response and even re-using the name from one of your previous responses. My name is David not Sachin. Either way my review remains unchanged as I have still to receive any response to my unanswered questions.

name: Sachin
review_header: I've been in this industry for almost a…
review_body: I've been in this industry for almost a decade and without a doubt this is quite possibly the worst experience ive ever had with an online server host.
