name: Aseef
review_header: There is a reason OVH is rated 2 stars, but...
review_body: Short summary: I can definitely see where OVH's 2-star rating is coming from. There is a reason for that. - There software / website is full of bugs. - They rarely offer any refund. - "Meh"/Below-average support at best. - Their site loads pretty slowly. - Their VPS clock speed is mediocre at best. But I also think there are reasons for why its still worth purchasing from OVH despite such a bad rep: - Free DDOS protection: these days, all websites or game servers need some sort of protection - Upgrade Customization: With other services, if you want say an extra 4 gigs of ram, you have to upgrade the entire VPS and have pay for things you don't need (ei more storage, cpu, etc). With OVH, you need more ram? You just pay for the ram. You need more storage? You just pay for the storage. - Backups & Snapshots: Really nice feature to have to be able to restore your VPS to a snapshot before you screwed stuff up. Its not free though... - GOOD PRICING. Really the biggest reason. Not only do you get a good amount of ram/storage/memory for what you pay, but we also have the added DDOS protection in the mix. Really hard to beat. A longer explanation of why I rated 4-stars & my experience: In my case, I was trying to purchase a VPS from OVH. But during my initial purchase, after I clicked the "pay" or "purchase" button, the website told me that an "error" occurred and nothing happened. So of course, thinking that my purchase didn't go through, I refreshed the page and tried the whole thing again and it worked. However, as it turned out, the first purchase also went through. Next of course, I contact customer support about what had happened asking for a refund on the other VPS. But they told me that they can't do the refund and can instead "proceed with a time transfer to the server [I] want to keep". Sure. In my case, I was OK with it. But OVH's reluctantness to offer the cash refund definitely left a bad task in my mouth. It was a fault in THEIR software that I accidentally ended up purchasing 2 VPS'. And now they tell me to do a time transfer instead of a refund? Really unprofessional. Even if they did refunded me, the money would have ended up in OVH's account anyway, so I don't understand why they didn't just refund. But, I suppose as long as you don't have to deal directly with OVH, you are probably good. Anyhow, then, even with the cancellation of my VPS, their website still gave my error messages in the process and the VPS wasn't properly deleted. Really showed two in a row how buggy the OVH site is. Now it's been almost 2 days and I'm still waiting on a response from OVH regarding this time transfer. The first time they did respond within 24 hours though. (Edit: I did get a reply before the 48 hr marker. So not super fast- yet acceptable.) Ugh, and not to mention how long everything on their site takes to load. It's really annoying. Still, at the end of the day, despite how OVH treated me, I am still pretty happy with my package for $11.50 / month for 80 GB SSD, 4 gigs memory, and 2 CPU. And I don't have to worry about masking my IP behind Cloudflare because OVH comes with DDOS protection :). And though I didn't have too much fun dealing with support, as crappy as it was, it still got the work done. All things considered, I'm between 3 stars / 4 stars, but I definitely think that OVH at least deserves more than 2 stars, so I'm gonna go with a 4/5. Some advice to OVH for fixing their stars: - Open up the pocketbook: Stop being so reluctant with refunds. Makes you guys look cheap and greedy. - Fix your website. And improve usability. - Invest more resources into hiring better support teams.

review_header: The service breaks down regularly, support is not helpful

They even claim that when they do not provide the service we're paying for, they don't have to refund us. In Reply to the response from OVH: This is what the support wrote us: "There's no refund that a customer can claim for a Load Balancer problems, cause this is not an option with SLA on it." This is another original reply from the customer support: "It's all your decision to buy another IP LB instead of wait for resolution." So they say that it's ok if the service is not available and the suggested remedy is to buy another service, which is very likely to fail again soon (as it did the past times). And if a (managed!) service fails, they think it's okay to wait 36 hours with a first response (and claim here that 36 hours is within the service level of 24 hours) and that they neither guarantee availability nor provide compensation if it fails. This is just rediculous. We're paying about 1200 € per month for this "service". Edit 2021-10-05: Still we don't have a response on this incident. The last response from the support is from 2021-09-24 (and even that is just a "we'll contact our Kubernetes team", since then, we have asked for an update a few times. @Luigi B.: You said here publicly, that you are responding within 24 hours. We can prove you wrong. Edit 2021-10-25: Still no reasonable response. The only thing we have heard is that the outage was due to a network problem that has occurred weeks later, which seems unlikely, to say the least. @Luigi B.: Are you still on this as promised?

I have 20 years experience web-building. I wrote two tickets with a difference of 18 hours between them. Looking by the numbering, over 2,000 tickets were sent by other users of this hosting in 18 hours. I paid for a server in Singapore, but instead they set up a server in Canada. When I asked for a refund because I didn't need a server in Canada, they said they saw no reason to return the money.

name: Charles Smith
review_header: Just the worst customer service EVER
review_body: I wouldn't normally bother writing reviews here, but I felt I had to in this case because I'm just so mad. Signed up to OVH public cloud to test things out - was considering getting a private cloud, but definitely not anymore. Created a cloud instance - ordered some additional IPs, paid upfront for everything. Started getting the instance set up - spent maybe 3 hours on it, went to bed. Next day - instance totally inaccessible - no response to ping, can't access via SSH or even VNC. Turns out that their automatic backup process somehow managed to crash things... but what do I know... I created a ticket 18 days ago. I've been told "we're looking into it". No other information - only get a reply when I actually ask for an update. Just this minute got an automated reply saying "we now consider the issue resolved". Hundreds of bucks thrown at this and I got 3 hours of use out of it and customer support which couldn't give a damn about me. Can't get any decent support from anyone, no-one seems to care. Literally the worst example of customer support I've *EVER* experienced in my life. If I treated my own customers like this I'd be out of business in about a week and I'd deserve it. I have no problem with a company charging extra for premium support - I don't need my hand held but if a service I'm paying for is completely inaccessible then I'm entirely at their mercy. It's absolutely astonishing that this company can honestly expect people to serve their own business critical services from here and not even offer even the faintest notion of help. Edit to reply to OVH's reply: The ticket ID is 2566751. I have had two auto-updated since writing this... "We consider this issue now resolved"... Erm, no? 25 days my cloud instance is unreachable and the best I can get is "we're working on it but have no ETA". Just shocking.

name: Zakir Daud
review_header: Unethical Billing Practices and Terrible Support
review_body: I had clear communication with OVH to cancel my services at the end of the 1st year. They confirmed this to me by email that all services would be cancelled and they would not bill me any further. They took a further £811.91 from my credit card for another year and I have been trying to get these funds refunded back to my account! I have had to raise a dispute with my credit card card company and they are pursuing this. OVH subsequently issued a credit note and closed the case but they have not refunded me the money. I have been tried to call them and I just get put on hold and then no answer. Their communication has been extremely poor, they have taken funds unethically and they don't respond in a timely manner. This is the worse experience I have had with any company and I would strongly advise that you stay away from them.

review_header: We had a server that was burned to the…
review_body: We had a server service with OVH that was destroyed by fire. [Check out OVH Strasbourg Datacenter burns to the ground.] We had prepaid our contract and have been fighting with OVH now since March 2021 to have the 3 months we prepaid refunded. Not to mention if we didn't have a backup we would have potentially lost everything for our business. Now they give us the run around after calling them repeatedly to get a refund. We have tried to be understanding of their situation but it is getting ridiculous. OVH: Return the funds we paid to you NOW!

name: Roberto Riccioni
review_body: Stumbled across this company whilst searching for something else on the web, had a look through & the prices seemed really good. Wanted to get a basic cloud server where I could backup my local server settings just incase something happened. Setup took a little longer than other providers, but was still in good time & the service started up great. A few days in I started to get messages saying an attack had been detected & my server was going through a process of protection (what I assumed) which I thought was a good thing. This however is where the greatness stopped, I kept getting messages stating attacks were being detected, then suddenly a message stating my server had been sending attacks & the account has been closed due to breach of contract. I contacted support via Social Media & email several times, eventually someone came back to me basically stating exactly what the email said & didn't give a lot of help. I emailed back stating I reject the outcome & want more info, baring in mind this was also connected via VPN to my network if something was up then I wanted to know. Absolutely nothing came back from the support team, still awaiting their response now. I've since switched to another provided & their support team responded to a basic query within an hour. Morale of the story it's cheap for a reason.

name: Jindřich Buk
review_body: Never again. Support after Strasbourg accident is really dreadful. They are not able to react to my support task for more than 2 months. Only way how to communicate with them is via FB messenger and there I was many times told that task was escalated, but nothing happened. Injured users should receive credit as compensation. I have received no credits. What's worse is that I also lost the money paid for the destroyed server.

name: Cubuzz
review_body: Yes, the OVH support is very slow, but the service itself is working like a charm. There's no handholding and some default configs are busted, but if you have the technical knowledge to set your stuff up, then this platform is doing a really, really, really great job. Pros: * Free backup storage with a dedicated server (500 GB is more than enough for me) * 1 GBPS Connection * Fairly good documentation * Free KVM Cons: * Support is super slow * Haven't tested TCP yet, but with UDP, the firewall is only monitoring and not filtering much traffic * The OVH firewall needs about 2 minutes to fully apply rule changes. In our case, we need to dynamically open and close ports. This does cause us some minor downtime every now and then, but overall totally acceptable. I think that OVH is a good provider if you know what you're doing.

name: T.Fitz
review_header: If I could write 0 stars I would.
review_body: If I could write 0 stars I would. This business is such a joke. Years ago OVH was a pretty decent business, but I have quickly come to the realization that OVH is out to scam everybody they have utilizing their services. I owned a VPS I paid $39/y for however the last year I did not use the VPS and thought it would automatically cancel the next year. I was charge and within 1 day requested cancelation and refund because I no longer used that VPS. It took them 3 weeks to even reply to that ticket, and 1 week into that ticket I submitted a refund request through paypal directly. Paypal sided with me and refunded me. 3 weeks later OVH finally responds to the ticket stating that they cannot give me any refund, and instead would give me account credit. That wasn't good for me because I no longer intend to use OVH platform. They now keep stating I have a debt in my account and I must pay it, and I have told them countless numbers of time to close my account and that I was not paying back a debt I should not owe. Buyer beware, these people are a complete joke as shown by the reviews… they have gone downhill and will only continue to with their stupid support and policies.

name: Angelo
review_header: Violates trust, but otherwise good value in servers
review_body: I have two dedicated server and five VPSs, and have been with OVH for four years, paying them $250 per month. I don't expect great support for a $5 VPS, but for a $120/month dedicated server I do! The value of the servers is good, but as others say, their support is all show and no go. I had no problems until recently. I filed a support ticket in November 2020 about an unresponsive server. The server came back on-line many hours later, but I never heard a word from OVH. In March 2021 (four months later) they closed the ticket without ever responding. I filed another ticket eight days ago and have heard nothing. I get a billing notice at the start of each month, and April was no different, but they deleted my credit card from my account and somehow expected me to know about this. On 13 April they suspended all seven of my servers without notice, after 4 years of being a loyal customer! They sent me an e-mail to let me know the servers had been suspended, but since they host my e-mail server I only got that e-mail after the servers were back on-line. I logged-in to their dashboard and saw no notice of anything being wrong. It said the network was fine and all my servers were working normally. When I looked at invoices I saw "unpaid". They have automatically billed my credit card for four years. I opened the invoice and manually paid it. Then I went and checked the payment methods and saw that my credit card was gone and below the empty table was a message that said, "If your credit card is suddenly gone, just add it back". Judging from the message, they know they have a bug that deletes credit cards at times and are putting all the burden for that problem on their customers. Surely they could have detected that my servers were set to "auto pay" and that the credit card was gone and could have e-mailed or called me about it! You know it's a huge enterprise that can be that cruel to customers and still stay in business. The only good thing I can say is that they had the servers back up within an hour after the extortion payment. But there was never any human being involved. I have been gladly paying them the monthly fee; I always felt it was a good deal, and was a happy customer from 2017 to 2020, i.e., until I needed support. I filed a support ticket on the 13th telling them what happened and how they should have tried to reach me a few days before suspending services. I asked for a simple apology, an acknowledgement that they cared about me as a customer, and maybe a small credit (optional). My ticket sits there for over a week now saying "in progress" with no response. I have started moving my servers. This taught me: don't put all your eggs in one basket. They killed my web, e-mail, database, three DNS servers, etc., took everything off-line for hours. I'm going to spread my DNS and web over multiple services, as I've done in the past, to make sure they are accessible if one has a problem. A little more expense and hassle, but as the saying goes, "fool me once shame on you; fool me twice shame on me". In short, OVH violated my trust. $250/month is a lot to my small business, but they have shown that keeping a customer they have had since 2017 does not even matter enough to call or send an e-mail when there is trouble.

review_body: First off, their website is unusable. Cancelling my two registered domains proved impossible because of persistent internal server errors on the OVH customer dashboard. Secondly, their tech support is a disaster. When I reported the errors to them, I was told I would be able to cancel the domains myself via the dashboard (?!). Either they didn’t understand the question, didn’t bother to read it properly, or a bot replies to their support tickets with a standard reply based on certain words in your message. Their Twitter team was frustratingly useless too; first they ignored me, then they sent me round in circles. Then tech support asked for more screenshots of the same error because one wasn’t enough; they didn’t believe I was getting errors on their control panel. They also, rudely, informed me I can only cancel my domains through the website or via registered letter. They point blank refused to do it at my simple request. After two weeks of pointless communication, I wasn’t prepared to spend any more time or money on this issue, and I certainly wasn’t going to stand in line in a crowded post office mid-pandemic. So I stopped the recurring payment on the Paypal site and will patiently wait for OVH to suspend my account for non-payment as it seems to be the only way I can leave, and this after 15+ years of being a customer. In short: lousy experience and a complete shambles. Also the rudest, most unhelpful customer support I’ve ever encountered. Would not recommend.

review_body: I utilised OVH for non-critical workloads in a previous role and their bang for your buck was great. We were spending north of €250k/year so had a dedicated account manager and had few issues. During 2020 as they've revamped their support offering, there seems to be more and more misses. The latest miss has been around ordering domains. Filed the order and got an email indicating documentation was required. Neither the email or the control panel indicated what documentation was required (just an expectation for 2 documents). I filed a support ticket immediately and tried calling them. My call eventually got through their Canadian support team who historically (and still do) know nothing about the European business (good luck getting them to resolve anything). My support ticket hasn't been touched more than 24 hours later. If you are spending lots of money or can rely fully on their automation, OVH are worth considering (I've always got the impression that their technology and engineering is pretty solid). If you're looking for anything oddball / customised, go elsewhere unless you can commit a large spend.

name: Anthony Boyle
review_body: OVH now offer a Web Hosting service in Australia. I signed up for the Professional plan (pro2014 web hosting plan), bought a cheap (~$5) domain (a .ovh one) to try and I quickly built my website using Wordpress. All the tools are there to quickly get a site up and running. I developed a small application to run in the background and that worked ok too. The only issue I had with it was that any emails I sent from my .ovh account went into people’s spam account. Once I was happy with my prototype, I bought a proper .com domain (from OVH) and tried to deploy that on the hosting service. That’s when I hit a brick wall. I couldn’t get rid of the .ovh domain and couldn’t deploy my ‘real’ domain. I also couldn’t get rid of the .ovh email, the system kept coming back with ‘Page not found’ type errors. I reached out to support but they were useless. They seem to only work Monday to Friday, they’re in Canada so replies only came in at night time (Australian time) and they were less than helpful. I suspect their main KPI is to get the support call out of the queue, not to actually help people. They have no concept of support or helping people or Customer Service. Their standard response is to send a link to the manual; it’s all, essentially, self-help. I asked them if I could delete the .ovh domain and the answer was “No, but here’s a link to the manual to add another domain”. I asked why I couldn’t change the email hosting and she asked if I clicked the link quickly enough and tried cutting & pasting it into my browser. Rather insulting response really. I asked if I could re-set or re-initialise the environment so I could start again and they said “No, but here’s a link to the manual on how to host multiple domains” (I already tried that 5 times). I asked for a refund so I could start again and they said “No, there’s no technical problem so we don’t do refunds”. In the end I just walked away from it. I spent around $200 but learned a valuable lesson. My advice – If you’re building a simple website and you won’t need any help, OVH are fine. If you’re an experienced infrastructure support engineer and you can manage the environment yourself, OVH are fine. If you suspect you may need some assistance then you should probably stay away from OVH and look at someone like Siteground – they are fantastic and really, really helpful.

review_body: Not sure who they are but they have compromised servers sending massive amounts of spam and they haven't done anything to address these issues even though I have been reporting each of them for weeks.

name: Zoran Altiparmakov
review_body: OVH is great! If you are professional and know how to manage the system by yourself, I definitely recommend OVH. I was skeptical about renting a dedicated server from OVH, since Trustpilot comments were mostly bad, but when you read the comments, you will see they gave a low score only because people are not experienced with managing their infrastructure, and in the free support package, you don't get support for basic things like 'How can I install PHP', etc. OVH clearly states that with free support, you are on your own. You only get support for critical situations, as I had. I was using OVH kernel for my dedicated server, and when I updated the kernel with the original CentOS one, my machine could not be booted, because OS was built with OVH kernel. They immediately send a technician to check what is wrong with the system, and they notified me right away. I contacted them, and they explained to me about the problem. What I like about them: - A modern panel where you can manage your server, access via IPMI, add more space on the fly, etc. - They respond immediately in critical situations - They are cheap - Fast internet - Support is slow, but they are very professional and explains a lot What I don't like about them: - They have good documentation, but not great, some things are missing.

review_header: Do not host with this company!
review_body: I rented a dedicated server from OVH for 3 months, and everything was perfect. Then I got a bill from OVH and was told the day it was due. However on the day it was due, they just decided to suspend my service when I still had up until midnight that day to pay the bill. After I paid the bill, I discovered that their 'suspension' had caused my OS and files to corrupt, with no way to recover them or get a copy of the files. I contacted support, and they are basically ignoring me hoping I will go away. Stay away from them at all costs! Do not trust them to be reliable!

review_body: I have been an OVH customer for years. I had several dedicated, hundreds of IPs that I bought individually and had 160 customers hosted there. I have always had problems with IPs disappearing, accusations of abuse with very little response time, but I have always kept on account of the good price. But out of the blue, I received several phishing warnings from my sites and the same day I received a warning that my account would be permanently deleted, and that there was no use in replying, that it was irreversible. Result. I lost my 400 dollars in IPs, I lost my 15TB of files, all my settings and went bankrupt of my company. I don't recommend that you trust them in the long run.

name: Scalp Trader
review_body: I ordered a "dedicated server" (Intel Xeon 1245v5 - 32GB DDR4) hoping that it would perform to my expectation - I was totally wrong, and it cost me USD71 because it was non-refundable. I currently have a 2-CPU VPS (High Frequency) from Vultr and it performs much better than the so-called dedicated server. I have a NodeJs application running on both Vultr VPS and OVH Dedicated Server, and they were monitored for several minutes at the same time. Before long, the dedicated server's "event loop latency" became a large number (e.g. 17ms) while that of Vultr VPS stayed at around 5ms. I tried dedicated servers a few months ago from NameCheap and Hetzner with the same specifications, and I was very satisfied with those servers. The only reason I was trying to get a dedicated server from OVH is that NameCheap and Hetzner do not have data centers in Singapore. I had a suspicion that they had given me a VPS and labeled it as "dedicated server". I felt cheated.

name: Mark Anderson
review_body: Absolutely abysmal Support. Really so very very bad, a) Their service purchasing process is buggy, unable to create the correct configuration and their web page menu, which shows the headings but not the actual items below is a joke. b) We were charged automatically for a service that we did not order. After submitting a request for a credit, which took 4 days to respond to, it took another 2 days to "investigate" and then another 2 days to get our money back. Then if that wasn't bad enough, we got another invoice and automatic charge to our account just a few days later, for the same screw up they just fixed, !! So again we had to go through the same process of complaining and waiting - and more waiting. c) We then had a server problem which was Urgent. No one was available locally, on a Friday, so we made contact with Singapore. While the chap we spoke with was pleasant and helpful, and he communicated with us consistently and "expedited" our service request - 4 days later it was still "unassigned" and still a problem. Absolutely appalling. d) Their Billing system is a joke. Information "unavailable" is often seem on the screen, and there is little correlation between screen and information. Very amateurish. If you are in Australia, you can forget and Sales pr Technical support, it just does not exist, even if you want to spend money you can't find anyone to talk to. It's ludicrous. Bottom line - If you want a service that is on the cheaper side and willing to gamble, try OVH. If you want any form of Sales support or Technical support, best to look elsewhere.

name: Kalaster
review_body: I tried purchasing a VPS service from them and I got stuck in in their payment page, Signing into paypal would not let me commit it as payment, So i gave up and moved on to another service. An Hour later they preauthorized my account for the $11.50 6 TIMES!!! 6 TIMES!! They witheld $69 from me for over a week!!!! I could not contact their customer support for days because their website would not allow me to login, no matter how many times i recovered my account, until finally I logged in and emailed support. Days later they closed the ticket without response and charged me twice officially. I have most of the money back, but they still charged me twice for a service I never received. As of right now, I can no longer login into my account to contact their support, I cannot find a phone number anywhere. I'm in touch with paypal to get my money back. I still have no website they won't cancel it to free my domain and they tell me to be patient for them to process the domain!!!! Don't ever ever ever use them.... do the opposite of recommending this to anyone, warn people of how bad they are... My review is real! any review saying they are excellent is just someone in their office trying to get their score up. Oh and not to mention if you speak Spanish like i do that's good for you because some of these people can't even speak english and i had to put my Spanish to the test for them to understand me!

name: Adrian
review_header: 1Gbps* unmetered connection (* 20Mbps if you use it)
review_body: I was using their latest "NVME" VPS... They keep sending me automated notification that I am under DDOS attacks. I am not. They automatically disable my server network around 3-4 times a day, exactly 15 minutes at a time in order to "protect" me. Imagine what that does to your site if it goes offline 15 minutes whenever there are most users (spike), or whenever Google bot crawls it. Google will mark the pages as "error" and drop them from index. I asked to receive sample IPs of these "attacks" but they keep telling me they don't have any (imagine that), ticket 7975797255. And that I should use tcpdump while under "attack" to view the IPs. Well, I did, and I seen nothing wrong. Edit: now my OVH server is unused (zero traffic), I installed Speedtest from Ookla, I ran a speedtest, I instantly got an "Detection of an attack" email. Because I downloaded a file with 950mbps. Next the speed was 20mbps (limited by their "DDOS" protection). So you get 1Gbps unmetered connection, as long as you don't use it !!! OVH charged me twice for same server 14 days ago, I still didn't get my refund, ticket 769798425 which I see as "closed". I honestly wish I had nicer things to say. Get well soon.

review_header: Worst services I had ever experienced. The waste of money.

I have several Dedicated Servers rented on OVH, and now I know why setup fees are so high. They hope that you will continue the service usage because you had paid tons of money, and you don't want to switch to another hosting provider. I don't know how things are going at OVH, but I know that it is THE WORST HOSTING PROVIDER I HAD EVER USED.

If you have a US.OVHCLOUD.com service like a dedicated server in the USA locations vs Canada or Europe they WILL NOT provide you telephone support. I just got on the phone to 1-855-684-5463 politely explained the issue and they said "Due to the issue with the Treaty and OVH U.S. owned by a different CEO he could not provide me support" and the best he can do is tell me to go make a ticket for my service that is not working. I told him that "I am not getting off this call until I speak with someone who can help" and he re-stated and shouted back and forth with me getting nowhere. Eventually he said "I am very sorry cannot assist further" and hung up on me. I called back and got the SAME bullcrap. I am SO DONE! with OVH.

name: AVENTUM International Gameservers
review_body: The issue with these servers is in the firewall configuration thats made by OVH. A small 100mbit/s DDoS will make the server drop all traffic, including all legit traffic, resulting in a total lock-off. That's exactly what SHOULDN'T happen when trying to mitigate DDoS attacks, because you try to be 'up and running' not 'down in misery'. Pricing is a bit heavy too, so this gets 2/5 stars in our Host Provider discussion.

name: Raphael
review_body: I have just left OVHcloud after the End-of-Life of their VPS classic 2014. Unfortunattely, there were no automatic migrating solution to a new VPS. I have received a promotional code for buying a new VPS for 12 months with 6 months free. After checking what could be ordered (without even paying), this code has been considered used without any possibility to be released for a real order. Their customer support takes several days for sending replies which are not even satisfying (ticket 3433467135). Finally, after migrating manually to another hoster, I have tried to stop their VPS before the end, without success (due to a bug on their website). Seriously, I don't know if i will trust OVHcloud again after this bad experience.

name: Hannes Becker
review_body: WHOLE SERVER WIPED AFTER 14 DAYS We got a new credit card and failed to update payment. Also during Corona we could not read the automated mails from OVH that payment did not go through because people were on forced vacation. After 14 days, our entire server, including all client data was deleted. No backups, no nothing. OVH did not bother to at least make sure to call us to inform that something is wrong. Instead, they deleted tens of thousands of EUR of value because we did not pay 42,99 EUR in time. We can still not believe it.

review_body: We use Private Cloud in OVH + one dedicated server. Never had any issues or downtime for past two years. I like services they offer, it matches with my business. They proceed new orders extremely fast. Support is very good an responsive. All recommendations for them.

This company does not care about anything.

review_body: Support is slow, everything else just works. Remember their prices are very competitive for the services they are offering

name: Alexander Napoles
review_body: Company should go bankrupt. They do not care about their customers. Horrible service, abusive networks who would ever in their right mind use them.

name: ray ray
review_body: I paid both of my 2 servers that i have with ovh for 1 year each. 1 got activated and the other one never did! The status stays confirmation. Even thought they withdrawed the money from my credit card! They ignore support tickets , no one bothers to review them. This company deserves 0 stars! Just find another company that cares for it's customers

name: Breffni Potter
review_header: February 2020 - OVH Support sucks and their billing team are a liability
review_body: OVH have on a frequent basis, had a terrible billing team. Technical support has been reasonable from time to time. I've been a paying business user with servers and public cloud providers. I have had enough, I'm gone. OVH decided to wipe their customers bank card details, without telling them. This means that come 1st of Feb, invoices don't get paid. Now a normal provider would send daily reminder emails saying please pay invoice or it will be suspended. Not so for OVH. They decided instead of notifiying a customer, just to suspend them on day 12. Quite a shock when all the websites/infrastructure went down on the 12th of Feb. So we react, we log in, find the unpaid invoices and try to re-add card details and pay. No luck, Oh no. Try to call support, get stuck on hold for ever and ever and ever. Open a ticket in their portal, no response, you get the lovely automated acknowledgement, but no response. We are now 48 hours into an outage with our entire infrastructure is still down. Thankfully we have disaster recovery and backups. OVH billing team is a liability for business and I plead with you to run away from them and never ever never ever use them. Not to mention every single new customer of theirs I have reccomended to them, has had to endure a tedious manual verification for any new product. If OVH care at all, ticket: 7590039670

name: Mirko Jovanov
review_body: this is the worst company ever, I asked for a refund, and they don't respond to their tickets, I'm still waiting for a response on my ticket, it's been 8 days...

name: Ruckus
review_body: THIS WEBSITE HAS ALLOWED ILLEGAL ACTIVITY TO BE HOSTED BY CRIMINALS. I HAVE REPORTED MANY MANY MANY TIMES BUT THEY CONTINUE TO IGNORE AND DO NOTHING ABOUT WEBSITE ENGAGING IN FRAUDULENT ACTIVITY. THERE ABUSE FORM HAS A CAPTCHA ERROR AND THEY IGNORE ALL ABUSE EMAILS.

name: onyxcode
review_body: It's been close to an hour now and my domain STILL hasn't been registered because they supposedly have to "check your payment manually". Namecheap gets it done in under 2 minutes! Also, I jus noticed it says ".space registration REQUEST - 1 year". Yeah, can you believe that? It's a REQUEST! And listen to this baloney in their ToS: "the Supplier cannot guarantee that the registration of the Domain Name chosen by the Customer will be carried out by the relevant Registry". GARBAGE! I'm glad I ordered through PayPal so I can get my MONEY BACK! Update: They claimed to have refunded my money but they have not! I have opened a dispute through PayPal

name: Mika
review_header: Customer service is slow to solve incidents, interface is slow to do anything
review_body: Take more a month to solve an issue. The OVH support is awful despite being a client paying $100 per month. One of our employees had their inbox accidentally flagged, which blocked their mailbox. After three tickets opened (because they close the other ones when they say they will escalate the issue to another team), we are still waiting and left without any updates, and no access to the mailbox to work on; thus we cannot even read mails from our clients. Awful. The dashboard is AWFULLY slow. Doing anything will waste HOURS of your precious time. On top, unlike AWS, the user permission management is very primitive and only "works" in certain parts (not actually fully... if you give read only access, users can delete or break your VPS and such things).

name: Sam
review_header: Bought two domains three days ago
review_body: Bought two domains three days ago, DNS still not updated. Service can't be worse than this. DO NOT BUY from this rubbish company.

name: Peter
review_header: Excellent Service at Excellent Prices, as long as you are technically savvy.
review_body: I've scanned a few reviews here and many seem like people who had hoped that everything would be magically fixed and working for them, or that OVH knows how to fix the mess someone created when editing a production file and breaking things. I'm technically savvy with more than 20 years of system administration and networking experience. If it breaks, it's probably my fault anyway. I've had a dedicated server with OVH in Canada since May 2014. Amazingly low pricing (4x-8x lower than AWS EC2 for the same specs) and wildly solid reliability. In 3 years there was one network outage that lasted 8 hours on November 2, 2015 -- the entire North American datacenter network was offline due to a dark fiber failure. Other than that outage, I cannot remember another issue. When I've had issues, the phone and email support have been good enough to surprisingly technical. I'm not sure what people expect, but as long as the hardware is running and when disks fail they get replaced quickly, I'm a happy camper. I now have three dedicated servers with OVH, two in the US Vint Hill DC and one in BHS. I'd absolutely use them for more servers.

We purchased more than 30 VPS but since year 2018 we started having frequent issues like these: 1) I/O errors on CentOS VPS - They told us that the problem of damaged disk is due to CentOS kernel. We simply lost the server and had to recreate it on another machine 2) Some servers simply become not available from some networks - They told us that the servers are too old(but they were created in year 2016) 3) We purchased an additional disk, and a day we started to get I/O errors - They told us that we had a software problem, then that we done some misconfiguration but at the end it was their administration issue, they forgot to renew the additional dist when the server was automatically renewed. 4) All our servers started to experience very low I/O performances compared with a year ago 5) We have an independent monitoring system and every days we experience at least an outage(more or less time) of one of our 30 VPS In practice every time you have an issue they say you are at fault, but we simply suffer poor infrastructure issues. It seems they wanted to grow acquiring more and more customers without investing a dollar in improving their infrastructure. Of course we took the decision to migrate all our servers to another provider. Please, do not consider OVH good for production systems or you will be overhelmed by your customers complaints.

name: SBB
review_header: Easily the worst large hosting provider
review_body: Far and away the worst mainstream hosting provider I've had experience with. They are a constant, persistent source of spam, and one of the most prolific hosts of spam vertised websites, AND they consistently turn a blind eye to those issues, failing to address them in ANY way - even after receiving multiple abuse complaints. They're also responsible for the ONLY servers located in Canada that I've ever received attempted brute-force logins from - and they of course ignore abuse reports regarding that as well. In fact, their handling of network abuse is so completely inept that they are one of the few providers I regularly see spammers using for both sending their junk mail, AND hosting the sites advertised in them (often even using domain registered through OVH) - spammers avoid doing that with most providers, because it means putting all of their eggs in one basket, meaning that a single abuse complaint can shut down everything. But they're clearly not worried about that happening with OVH - and it appears that OVH doesn't give them any reason to. At the same time, a quick Google search finds numerous complaints from people who have had their accounts shut down by OVH, over a temporary compromise that allowed spam to be sent from their account. So it seems that the message is: if you're a legitimate customers hosting a poorly-secured WordPress site on OVH, and it gets compromised to send spam, then they take a hardline "shoot first, ask questions never" approach. But if you use their servers solely for the purpose of spamming or other criminal/malicious activity, then (as long you have enough sense to do it in a way that isn't caught by their automatic monitoring) OVH is perfectly happy to continue providing service to you - even after receiving hundreds of spam complaints. Interestingly, Canada recently amended its anti-spam laws to hold providers liable if they fail to address spamming in a reasonable timeframe. OVH seems like a PERFECT test case for that, given that they profit from knowingly facilitating spamming & other illegal/malicious activity.

name: Steffen
review_header: There are really a lot of unjustified negative reviews
review_body: There are really a lot of negative reviews and I cannot find that this matches my experience having managed hardware for multiple of their clients over 5 years now. Are they perfect? No. They are more for technical experts, so if you have no experienced IT then this is probably not the best service for you as support is quite tightly focused on ensuring the infrastructure/hardware works 'as specified', not more. Interoperability is definitely going to be your problem. If you want more, then it costs and there are still limitations. Make of that what you will. For the clients I've represented and the companies I co-own, they've been pretty decent overall. Support is basically 9-5, but I've managed to get support out-of-hours as OVH are also in Canada. Not perfect, but definitely workable. For real emergencies you will get routed (eventually). Considering the price, I can accept that. My experience is with: Web (domains, email, Microsoft) Dedicated Servers (Servers, NAS, IP) To be honest, I cannot fault the service - it works as advertised. 4 stars instead of 5 because: Sometimes support is slow to respond to tickets opened on the portal and the bundled SCSI/MegaRAID drivers for some of their dedicated servers are unstable at high I/O. Updating the drivers is a nightmare (but possible, just about) as you lose the storage and as you are remote, it's very, very hard to change them as you lose any media to install them from.

name: Keith Copo
review_body: what a discusting company, tried to call it rang for 22minuets . sent so many tickets without a single preply . registerd all my domains with them to find out that sone of my domain name have expired , not transferd over to"OVH"... if i could give it a minus i would ,

name: Bobby Wibowo
review_header: Rented a Singapore VPS for 12 months
review_body: Rented a Singapore VPS for 12 months. I used to have DNS issue for over 2 weeks, causing my app to fail to resolve to various domains. Fortunately it wasn't really an important feature of the app, so it didn't cause much inconveniences. However, OVH support when handling the matter was quite appalling. My ticket was ignored for over 14 days until I sent a direct message to their Twitter. The owner had to reply personally to my ticket. I assume merely because the owner was checking out the Twitter account by himself. Other than the very bad customer service however, the server was running just fine with pretty much zero downtime during the 12 months.

name: Paul Lunny
review_header: Actual service is hit and miss
review_body: Actual service is hit and miss, but the support is terrible only open 9-5 and no out of hours technical support no one in billing answers, in my opinion STAY AWAY!

name: m3m
review_header: If you just need barebones hardware and…
review_body: If you just need barebones hardware and operating to use as you please they are a great option, if you need customer service or support you'll need to double/triple what you're paying and find somebody else.

name: Mark S Jensen
review_body: They are the worst company ever. They will not answer when writing to them. They gladly accept your money, but you don't get what you pay for! I bought a dedicated server yesterday and still haven't got my product. When I write to them, guess what happens? I NEVER get answers back from them! I can and will NEVER recommend oh to anyone! I regret having bought them. So to all of you others who think "Ovh is the way to run something stable" Keep away from ovh! They cheat you! But they would love to have your money!

name: Oliver
review_header: Cheap, Billing team NEVER respond to ANYTHING
review_body: Transferred a lot of domains to them over the past 12 months and found the platform takes some getting used to. Support on tech queries is good but only if you phone them. However BILLING team NEVER RESPOND to ANY queries. Im not even sure that team even exists as you have to chase them 6 or 7 times before they respond to anything and even then you have to call their tech team which is separate to get the billing team to do something. Its very frustrating. Its very cheap and could be the best on the market with some small tweeks on front / back end systems.

name: Alexander Brian
review_header: Price is reasonable yet the support…
review_body: Price is reasonable yet the support sucks. If you happen to purchase their cloud server, do pay attention they once billed are not refundable. Nor the contact will assist you.

name: Luis Santos
review_header: No Support drives the dirt cheap price.
review_body: No Support drives the dirt cheap price. If you are technical enough to maintain your server and dont care about support, this is your provider. OVH seems to be made by techs for techs and you get what you pay for. I've had a ticket open for over two weeks without a reply.. i so don't care if it never closes. Simply works. deal with your own support.

name: Richard Dale
review_body: I have tried quite a few hosting companies over the years. Media Temple, Heart, 123 Reg, Go Daddy and none are perfect. I have used OVH for almost two years. I have x4 VPS servers with them and so far I have not experienced a single second of down time. The only emails I receive from them are to tell me when to renew my servers. They are super cheap too. You have to remember though that OVH sell unmanaged severs, thats why they're cheap. The clues in the name. If you know how to manage a server via the command line then you'll be fine. If you don't and need cpanel and GUI's then stay well clear. Its just not the service for you. Most of the reviews on here seem to be from people who don't really know what they've bought. Since writing this review I placed an order on Friday night that hadn't gone through. I called them first thing Monday morning and they dealt with my issue straight away and in a pleasant manner. My order hadn't gone through because it was my first order and my details needed to be checked for security reasons. No problems with OVH. Like others have said. If you don't really know what you are doing and need GUI's and tech support holding your hand every two minutes then OVH and not the company for you. If on the other hand you want top quality servers and the cheapest prices on the web look no further.

name: Niclas
review_header: Affordable hosting plans but BAD technical support
review_body: OVH is dirt cheap. But this comes at a price: technical & customer support is INEXISTENT. If you have a solid technical background in database management, PHP, and know how to address basic technical issues, you're almost all good. If not, forget about it: sooner or later you will run into a technical issue that will have adverse & permanent effects on your website. And do not hope to get any help: average response time from OVH's support is 5 days (technical support) and up to 7 days (invoices and client support). I still have 15 of my websites hosted on OVH, because I've built a technical knowledge over time, and they're not as crucial for my business (except one) as my other website hosted on WP Engine which is quite resource intensive and requires immediate intervention in case of an issue (WP Engine's average support response time is 6 minutes). OVH is really affordable (great if you just need a blog), but forget about getting any help from them. I'll continue using them, but I'll never rely on their support to assist me in any ways.

name: Simon
review_body: no refunds given. onboarding and checkout is a total convoluted mess (example: you need to enter all your credit card details TWICE in two separate forms but it's not clear if the first form actually billed you). the login emails have broken help links. customer support takes days to reply. just feels like a backwards company who doesn't give a s##t about customers. dont be sucked in by the cheap prices. they're cheap for a reason...

name: Jack Jenkins
review_body: Great provider. The people below probably just went with OVH because they're cheap without understanding what OVH are. No, OVH will not hold you hand. That's why they're cheaper than the people who hold you hand.

Destroy peoples businesses. Stay away, in fact run away. Run a mile. These people are wastes of space. Don't even deserve to be alive

review_body: Someone needs to sue this company. :/

name: Marco
review_header: Awful Provider, stay away from them!
review_body: Worse company ever, they have a useless customer service providing incorrect answers after 4-5 days. Their services are not as advertised on their website, they have a lot of limitations and strange policies created in order to force their clients to buy additional services for something that other providers offer for free. They refuse to provide refund for duplicate or incorrect charges. Just don't buy anything from them, even if heavily discounted.

name: Tomasz Waleciuk
review_body: Actually it's much easier to list their pros than cons (not enough space here to explain how hopeless they are) - the only good thing about them is price. They give you cheap price most of the time, but remember: you buy a cheap service for that price... I am not sure if it's worth its price btw...

name: Paul
review_header: Booked a webhosting plan with included…
review_body: Booked a webhosting plan with included domain (free for the first year). OVH didn't do the domain transfer and wasn't able for more than two weeks to transfer the domain. Therefore I had to search for another provider due to the domain contract running out with my old provider. OVH refused to refund the money because the webhosting paket itself was working (how usefull without the intended domain), I should have seen the missing domain on the invoice (the domain name was listed three times on the invoice) and they offered a domain transfer to me for free (well yeah, after three weeks and after it was to late. And offering something for free which was supposed to be for free in the first place is not such a generous offer).

name: MukeMan
review_body: Wouldn't use them again - ever. They couldn't care less about their customers or customer service. They will simply cut your services off (irrespective of whom you are hosting) at a whim, then start citing their contractual terms & conditions. I was advised that I had to block an IP port that was used by the software system I hosted otherwise I would be cut off. I explained the situation, but they weren't interested. I even offered to buy a hosted firewall service from them, but they said they couldn't do that! In the end they took down my server - all because of LDAP being available!! Last time I checked LDAP is a IETF registered Internet protocol! Made no difference to this lot; my server was taken down. Lost the client I was hosting and they cancelled the contract. OVH are pretty useless I'm afraid. Beware!

name: cw
review_body: spam relay.Amazingly awful.Hosting and sending malware.They are s#um.

name: Tom Greinert
review_body: mixed feelings. there still customer since early 2005. was the time as the domain rush started and got decent prices. moved all after 2 years bec there dns servers not good. the prices are cheap still but no customer support at all. for newbews no go

review_body: Horrible customer and technical service. I am facing an emergency (phone line redirect) and it's been 1 week the thing is pending !! 1 week without professional phone line, for a business !!!! Shame on you OVH, you don't deserve our money.... Looking at your score reviews everywhere, you really got some homework to do if you wanna stay in business !

review_header: My experience with OVH is as a …

review_body: Usually the tech support response takes 24 hours to 36 hours. But recently, it took only 10 minutes to reply. Weird.

review_header: Another Free Trial Scam & Incompetent support
review_body: Their public clod offer was advertised with free credits, so I registered to try out the service. And of course they needed my payment information to activate it, so I was more than happy to give it to them. In return the activation code didn't worked. When I asked the support about it, they simply ignored my question. Furthermore, I was that silly who decided to get through it and try the service without the credits at my own cost. Here even bigger problems have begun, their technical support wasn't able to answer my simple technical questions, linked totally irrelevant urls as answer.. My opinion is they have no idea what they are doing/selling, avoid them at all cost if you value your time and hard earned money.

name: Vlado
review_header: I have over 60 Dedicated Servers with…
review_body: I have over 60 Dedicated Servers with them. Never had any issues since 2 years. They have strong network speed. My customers are happy.

name: Stefatorus - Tutoriale Servere
review_header: I've read many reviews here and I have…
review_body: I've read many reviews here and I have never had any of those issues listed in the reviews. Yes, OVH is not the best hosting firm in terms of support. They sell bulk cheap equipment that's worth it. Their Support will fix any issues that are on their behalf (hardware, security, etc), but don't expect them to teach you how to purchase a product or to lead you in the right direction. I've been using OVH for 2 years now; currently renting 15 servers from them. The quality is outstanding, all the issues we had were minor and were dealt with correctly, and the prices are really good. As for the other reviewers, please review what you pay. You don't pay for managed hosting, and you also don't pay for somebody to explain how you can purchase x or z. They are strictly there to help you deal with hardware issues that your company is having.

name: Dave Sharman
review_header: This company specialise in sending out…
review_body: This company specialise in sending out bulk unsolicited emails, & totally ignore abuse report requests when submitted, to cease unwanted messages being received by the recipient. This is the most awful network provider I have ever experienced, as they show total disregard by way of lack of action when complaints are raised. They claim to have no control over the contents on their own network, I have never heard such rubbish & nonsense excuses!.

name: Jesse Chadwick
review_body: What a Joke, this company is just rubbish. We had 2 servers over the span of a year the second one was due to the first one having hardware faults and dying so we got another one had to manually copy each cpanel account... it cost me a fortune. I moved in july... zero stress since moving. Cheap is not always better the staff at ovh were rude and arrogant and not worth my time...zero stars as well!!

name: Rui Silva
review_body: I've subscribed a Web hosting plan with email accounts included, and at the beginning after configuring my MS Outlook client to those emails accounts via POP3, everything was working very well. A few months ago without any changes on my side, when refreshing Outlook to check for emails, my 4 email accounts can take up to 20 seconds to check for new emails. Unacceptable! Contacted support twice and they just tell ya that everything is fine on their side! Don't think so mate. As well why OVH always starts customer account website in French! I know you're a French company, but couldn't you just change the language automatically accordingly to the customers geolocation?

name: Sven
review_body: Literally unbelievable this company is still in business... they must be one of the worst companies ever created. You do not receive replies from support, either by phone or email they are unreachable. Their billing system is totally messed up... their user interface is messed up.. the list goes on and on.

name: Peter D
review_header: I've been using OVH for almost two…
review_body: I've been using OVH for almost two years now. I can't believe how bad their reviews are here. I haven't had any issues with VPS products I've purchased; no downtime and have never had any issues managing my servers. One of the top VPS providers that I use.

name: Jane Holson
review_header: If I could give less than 1 star I…
review_body: If I could give less than 1 star I would. Everytime I've purchased and configured a server with ovh it stops working a week or 2 later (without even configuring anything). It's always something to do with their firewall configuration. Their cpanel will say all http, dns, ssh, smtp is disabled for no reason and you're left for hours trying to debug servers without any prompt support

name: Matthew Stagg
review_body: I needed to build a small environment for a client in the US. I needed two servers, one to run PFSense and one to run xenserver. First I ordered the box to be PFSense. It said 120s to deploy but it actually took a couple of hours, but I'm used to this, the same is true when I use OVH.co.uk Next I needed to order a windows instance by the hour in order to install the OS through the KVM using a local iso. Created the project, ordered the instance. Error. Over and over again. Gave up, ordered the instance through our UK account, got it, installed PFSense. Went back to ovh.fr to order the xenserver box and a /29 for the PFSense box to nat onto it. That was Monday morning this week.The client needed the service up by 5pm GMT on Monday. at 3pm GMT ovh.fr started showing my card as declined. Went to my bank to ask them if there was a problem and they said they were seeing no attempted charges. Called ovh.fr waited 30 minutes for them to answer. Told my card was being declined. Built the environment elsewhere, delivered it 45 minutes late. Called up ovh.fr the following day to ask what had happened. After the apparently standard very very long wait (this time over an hour) they said they had had a payment system problem which had now been fixed. Believe it or not I'm actually trying to use ovh.fr instead of ovh.co.uk because I live in France. So, although this attempt was an utter blowout I decide to persist. Tuesday my order for the IPs goes through and they are delivered. By Friday my order for the second server is still in "validation" which I now know means manual intervention by and "administrator." So I ring them up to ask what's happening. After the standard one hour of my life ticking down while listening to the same "be patient while we waste your resources" spiel I get through to them. Apparently I need to wait until an administrator can validate the order (presumably the same administrator who put through the IP order but not the server order.) They've gone home (if they'd answered the phone in under an hour they'd have been there.) It'll be Monday. I tried, I really tried to bring the business to France. But they clearly don't want it. I cannot think of a better way to tell a customer that you don't want their business than to behave as ovh.fr does. Be warned. Beware. Be elsewhere. I specifically asked for an email address to send a complaint to. None was provided so a public forum it is. Update 2018-11-02 17:58:00 Request server and account deletion Update 2018-11-05 20:25:00 Server and account still active Update 2018-11-07 07:56:00 Server and account still active - no response to ticket Update 2018-11-08 07:43:00 Server and account still active - no response to ticket Update 2018-11-09 09:03:00 Server and account still active - no response to ticket

name: Richard
review_header: I would gladly give them 0 starts if it…
review_body: I would gladly give them 0 starts if it was at all possible. I had no problem with the product they offer, but their support & ticket system was completely and utterly rubbish. 7 full days without even a response on a support ticket. Two other tickets have been lying there for 3 days, just no response.

name: Stackport Billing Department
review_body: I have several servers with them, had several problems but slowly managed to resolve them. The support is very crappy, you need to keep repeating one and the same thing until they understand the problem. Mind you, I have been in the hosting business for about 20 (twenty) years now. Ordered a couple more servers with them recently and then the sh*tstorm came - one server came without a vRack, the failover IPs could not be moved to another datacenter. It has been two weeks now since I reported the problems to them, all they do is lie to me that the problems are fixed. Especially Marc-Antoine B. has been a consistent liar.

name: Dave Harris
review_header: Have had a ticket open now for over 2…
review_body: Have had a ticket open now for over 2 weeks without a reply. Additional attempts to reach someone at OVH have been fruitless. A scam of a company as far as I can tell.

name: Elimos
review_body: VPS offline, who knows why. They won't reply to tickets.

review_body: i dont get the bad reviews. I started off with ovh.com before i was transferred to .co.uk and never had any problems. i own a VPS with several websites and dont have any problems. PS: i had to learn out to work with the VPS and linux, if you cant do that you better off with a normal hosting or Cpanel.

name: PeX
review_body: The servers aren't that bad like the other reviews are saying, but every ~2 weeks the server is just crashing and destroying some files on it. And that sucks. Thanks for nothing ovh

review_body: I have a simple case with changing DNS servers and I'm waiting days for every single message from them.

review_body: Utter, Utter, Utter waste of time. I'm on my 3rd reinstall now in under 6 hours. All I've done is have the temerity to reboot the box... Avoid

name: Sajith Tharaka
review_body: I have paid for a server until October 1st, But they suspended server with auto generated invoice at August 21. But the server has been completely renewed and paid for October 1st. No reply for support tickets even. Not working phone number. What company I have selected. Very poor attention for support tickets.

name: Oliver
review_header: Dishonest practices w.r.t. voucher and slow support
review_body: Decided to try their public cloud services using a £25 free credit voucher that they e-mailed me, following prior experience with them (VPS). Made £19.87 worth of usage. Their billing system kept trying to charge me £39.74; this happened at least 3 times before support replied 6 days after my original request. (and, I think this is only because I pestered the ovh.co.uk customer support e-mail 3 days in). I also find their billing system rather confusing as there are at least 3~4 tabs concerning billing, most presenting conflicting information. Despite the control panel saying the voucher was applicable to 'All' products, it turned out that it was restricted to the UK datacentre, and this is not what the control panel defaults to using.. After a bit of back and forth, the support team did correct the amount from £39.74 to £19.87, which I gave in and paid. That said, following this experience, it has left a sour taste in my mouth and I will probably migrate.

name: Miskie
review_body: I had multiple issues with OVH. There support is awful and replied maybe a day or 2 late. Then when I requested a refund due to all the issues they completely ignored me. Not to mention that the machine kept crashing.

name: Cello
review_body: Deep-rooted criminals and hosters of multiple scam and online pirates websites. Currently under investigation of our company for ignoring DMCA and no respect to international and local law. Looking forward to seeing the owners and administrators of OVH behind the bars.

name: centralcrafts.com
review_header: If you are coming from a platform like…
review_body: If you are coming from a platform like Google cloud beware. OVH charges you at full rate even when the instance is turned OFF. For me, it makes the platform utterly pointless. I got billed £150 for a week of nothing. I could have had 3 x dedicated servers for a month at that price. Customer service is not only slow and ineffectual but rude and threatening. When I queried the bill I was told to pay it or I would be pursued. Lovely.

name: Dainius
review_header: They NEVER responds to abuse reports
review_body: They NEVER responds to abuse reports - when sending them reports with logs of they hosted IPs that are scanning servers, scanning websites for vulnerabilities, scanning for SSH, FTP logins etc. I reported few times - got nothing from them. Tried to notify via support, AND whois abuse contacts. No any reaction. Well, my decision was simply block OVH networks. Maybe host is good, I dont know, but from this side they are so far WORST.

name: Bader Alajmi
review_body: I have placed an order for a customisable server from OVH that was scheduled to arrive within 72 hours (As they said), but this is the forth day without any response from their side which is very wired for a company in this size. However, to be honest, their servers are very stable and powerful. I wish just I have never face the delay in my server order to write a 5 star.

name: David
review_header: Cheaper but you get what you pay for... corrupt VPS + useless support
review_body: Cheaper but you get what you pay for = corrupt VPS and useless support. I was with linode for 8 years and not a single issue, my customers are with rackspace and aws - almost same story. ovh - a couple of months and my vps dies with disk is corrup message. Provided and saved in a secure place root password is no longer working so can't get through the screen asking to run fsck manually. Rebooted in rescue mode to look around but when try to reboot back to normal it's hanging. what a piece of c**p. We got notification two hours later that it's down - what a speed! We spoke to CS in the middle of outage and they were insisting everything's looking good on their side... yeah... you sounded so dull like you were about to fall asleep on the other end of the phone in the middle of a crisis. Seriously, our core system is down and you're saying that it's going to take long time to investigate/fix then can't give any time scale??? On top of that their ACP is pretty rubbish, no one has probably ever heard about UX at OVH - in ACP left menu items not accessible to me are not distinguished and look exactly the same colour as those accessible so can't tell when things activate or not = have to click through each one to find out! - I can't reset root password from the ACP either (took the time to provide feedback but no action at all - nor update details on their own systems - look at forum.ovh.co.uk - badly implemented SSL cert) - they supposed to call back to discuss but never did)... Now I wish I didn't move my services - time to look around and pay a bit more for stability and usability because these guys are making things no properly and rather unnecessarily overcomplicated. Spining up new VPS is not instant like all others do. They should create accounts on competitors' panels and look around then simply take the best functionalities - simple as that! And please do STOP those silly and outdated redirects to different web portals to create even more accounts and logins... jeeezz - this is what SSO has been created for! A couple of stories to read: http : // www . webhostingtalk . com/showthread.php?t=1178759

name: Sam
review_body: As far as I am aware for many years OVH has had a reputation as a hosting provider for providing hosting for malware/illegal content and also a very large amount of spam (meaning their ip's are frequently blacklisted) I would not want to place any of my websites within this environment.

name: John Falkner
review_header: OVH.co.uk is not the same as OVH.com!
review_body: I have only had 100% positive experiences with OVH.co.uk. OVH.com is not getting good reviews below! I don't know why but..... I say try the UK company. Customer Services are top notch from Dublin. Even for beginners like me. Check the Trustpilot reviews for the UK OVH operation. It's consistently good & deserves the praise it gets IMHO.

name: Jacob Muscab
review_body: No support at all I have tried contacting OVH.com about my issue with my Dedicated Server I paid for June, and their system changed it to July So it then suspended my server for 'overdue on payment' Submitted a support ticket, emailed them an rang them 3 times and still no response after 6 days

name: Marrico Manlapig
review_body: Trash support. First purchase of a "Gaming Dedicated Server" will have an immediate problem. Calling the support center will do nothing. First they will say it will take a couple hours, and after you call again they will tell you its gonna take 24hours to fix. Really. You purchase a Server and you won't be able to use it for 24 hours. or until they fix the god damned problem. Why sell faulty servers. Trash company.

name: Algis
review_header: Why OVH is not as good as it pretends to be.
review_body: Summary of our experience with this provider is as follows: TLDR; if you value your time , money and service quality - stay away from them. Machines can be rebooted or suspended without notice in advance any time. Account can be terminated according to their terms without even notice. Even if prepaid several month ahead. Enough third party accusations without proof. Technical support will not help, as they have no authority over decisions from other dept. (abuse team which don't bother to test facts and they even can't be reached , they might just ignore you). They will not easily return your data if it is a little more sophisticated that plain files on filesystem. You can do it only by court ruling, but it will cost you.

name: 30fill
review_header: Problem before some months with down…
review_body: Problem before some months with down the cloud servers in france and now my server its down again. Replay to tickets after 2-3 days. All my customers have no services becouse server its down. Now i move me server, iam lucky that i have backup all my datas (dayile) on server out of this company.

name: Adrian
review_body: couldn't Cancel my service now they are trying to sue me for £20 despite me having paid them over £500 over the years. seems legit.

name: Kollin Lockamy
review_body: Asked for service to be cancelled. They ignored me and billed me for a new month. I asked them to refund me and they said they have never had anyone ask for a refund before. I called my bank and had them dispute the charge, should it continue to go through. Notified OVH and they said I had no previous charges on my account. Awful business practices and non-existent customer service.

name: Adrián Rivero
review_body: Their VPS have very good price, and while they are working things are ok.. But if something goes wrong, you have no idea of when you could get their support.. they don't answer to the Tickets you open in the system after several days later, they have a phone that I've been waiting on it for 15 minutes with a music in french, and nobody answers. The support is in general the worst I've seen so fast. BTW, to find the phone to call in their site was quite challenging, and I'm still looking for some email to write them.

name: SPL
review_header: OVH contract is disappointed me - worst company
